text:
I had a hard drive issue with my Dell computer, so I bought a new hardrive and brought it to this place to complete the setup/recovery. The cost was quite reasonable especially since they updated it to windows 10, and included an anti-virus, PLUS they can provide any help if needed via remote access.  Well, more than a month after, my laptop needed Windows activated??? So I called them and without hesitation, Jeff, was able to get it fixed via remote access. So I didn't have to bring it over to them or pay any additional fees.
Highly recommend them!!  Their knowledge and customer service is awesome!!

The food was 4 stars but the service was 2 stars, so I split the difference for a 3-star rating. I had the Huevos con Chorizo and it was excellent. But i am always frustrated when the order taker is not the order deliverer. The order taker was nice enough, but the guy who delivered my order had to ask if it was the right meal. Never a good sign in my book. And he spoke very quickly using kitchen-ese to refer to my meal (just saying "huevos" is not enough - it means eggs and that's not enough to tell me if you brought the right meal). The order taker stopped back to check but infrequently and when she delivered the check, she did not tell me to pay at the front and asked if I wanted my drink to-go. I sat there with credit card on the table for another 20 min before it occurred to me to bring the check to the front desk to pay.

Had to come here to get dog food because we didn't have time to grab ours due to the fact we had to evacuate our home from the fires. The gentleman working was super friendly and even threw in a free bag of treats after learning we had to evacuate and have had a long day.

NOTE THAT THIS IS FOR THE LOCATION ON THE RIVER WALK, NOT THE ORIGINAL IN THE FRENCH MARKET. Stopped by on our first day in NOLA. Tried Cafe au lait for the first time, and found it a bit more bitter than I hoped. I figured it would be half coffee, half milk/cream. At least it was hot. The beignets were tasty and sweet, a bit heavier than I'd hoped. If I stood in the line at the French Market, I would have been disappointed.
The views here are better than the views in French Market. You can watch the steamboats on the river, and maybe a Carnival cruise will pass by.

WOW! This place is amazing! Went with a couple of friends and we all had different flavors. I loved them all but my favorite was the coconut cream. If you are a fan of coconut then you have to get the coconut cream. You won't be disappointed.

I am so fortunate to have discovered Nechelle and her amazing salon. Her service is out of this world. Not only are her technical skills on point, but she pays great attention to detail, values communication (it shows!), checks in wit you about your comfort level (too cold? Need a drink or a magazine?), gives you options during your consultation, spends a ton of time giving you her undivided attention, she values connection and makes it her business to go above and beyond for your service. Everything is the salon is very high tech. Her shop is simple, classy, and inviting. Even the music was great. She's also managed to transform my poor hair that was butchered by a razor into a work of art that I can gladly sport. Her education and passion are apparent, as is her kindness, which she shows equally to every guest, making it an inviting space for everyone there. She listens to what you said you wanted, and she always has a smile. Never leaving Nechelle!

I had been wanting to try this place for a while. So glad I did!! small place, but very comfortable.  I went there with my two boys & we all loved it! Seems like a local, family owned place, which I also love & the food was awesome!!! I would definitely recommend!

Very approachable for the uninitiated Nicaraguan diner (me). Owner(?) was very friendly and helpful with menu orientation.  Sampler platter that I had was perfect to try a variety of things. Plenty of food and reasonable price. Small, casual, and clean - order at the counter.

We were happy to find this place on our way to the beach. We have our favorite places for pizza back home and were pleasantly surprised by how good the pizza was here. The fries were also very good. I would have given 5 stars but our wings were a little dry. This place is tiny, only 5 booths, 1 table and a small bar but definitely a good place to grab a pizza.

I was so disappointed in the Christkindlmarkt. I was so excited to go, as I love Christmas and German festivals. This fell short. I hope they take the feedback from attendees to improve it for next year. I knew it would be busy, but the ice skating rink took up so much room that there was barely any room to walk through the crowds. We couldn't see anything that the vendors were selling because the crowds were so ridiculous. The lines for food were laughable. It felt unsafe for the market to be so crowded, I feel like it could have been bad if there were an emergency. For some reason the market just didn't have the Christmas spirit. 
The worst part was that we parked in the Veterans way garage (all the signs point you to park in this garage). To get outside, you have to go to the bottom level but there was no way to get from the parking garage to the market. You have to walk through a hilly, muddy construction area to get over there. It was not lit and was not easy to walk across. I saw some older adults and children who had some trouble getting up and down the hills. I felt like this event was put together without fully planning it out.

This place had the location we were looking for! 

It's right on the water between the bay and the ocean. We ate on the outside patio for dinner and had great views with live music playing. We were in on a Saturday night.

The food was amazing. Grouper fingers are our go to when visiting the beach and this place did not disappoint. The fried shrimp tacos were also great and stuffed with more shrimp than we imagined, but they needed a sauce on them though. Would have been great with a cilantro lime aioli. We added ranch to ours. Mild buffalo shrimp appetizer was a good size and tasted great. 

4 stars because service was a little slow and our waiter seemed to be really busy. Our appetizer also came out after our entrees did. But, couldn't complain too much with great views and great food!
Ordered shirts from here, sizing was off and we orderd lots of shirts. They didn't help whatsoever with the size discrepancy. They were not very nice either.

I enjoyed my 5 day stay. I didn't enjoy the $29 + tax parking across the street Premium parking ( ($40 on one day do to the football game ) but it was cheaper and faster than the $40 valet the hotel offers. Had no issues with the self parking. Croissants every morning get boring. They could make a pot of coffee in the lobby at night. Or even just for Christmas! The staff was exceptional. They are redoing all the old buildings across the street so the road is pretty busy in front. Nice hotel. Close walk to the French quarter.
First time doing an escape room. Tons of fun, staff is great! Would definitely go again!!
Tried to call in an order on a Sunday and the phone rang busy for 15 minutes. Now I remember why we stopped going to this Beef's.

First, the hotel is beautifully remodeled.  Very modern.  Rooms are clean and wonderful.  The restaurant disappointed me.  I was not too hungry, so I ordered the Hummus plate and a garden salad with shrimp.  How difficult could that be?  Hummus was good.  The pita bread was super greasy and appeared dipped in grease.  I Could have ordered friench fries for that much grease.  But, I ate it because it was good.  Filled me up, so I ordered the simple salad.  The salad appeared fine.  But, when I looked closely, a few of the shrimp were greyish, which means not fully cooked.  I DO NOT eat partially cooked shellfish.  Another server came and stated they can throw it back on the grill.  That violates Health laws.  I said, "no thanks," and she brought me back another salad without the shrimp because I said hold the shrimp.  What upset me was, the original server came back and with an attitude.  He stated, "buy the way, we took the shrimp and looked at it under a bright light and it WAS fully cooked."  We discounted the shrimp.  I said, "It was not about $$.  Really?  You are going to argue with the customer?  Tell me I was wrong?  That is customer service 101. Do not argue with a customer.  He did not ask me if I wanted anything else....So, here I am writing this review.  Chef, please keep an eye on your cooks.  Dining room Mgr's, send your server back to customer service school.  Making you look bad.  They failed me today.  I'm on business with an expense account and in the restaurant business.  Shame!!!  By the way, the only Chardonnay by the glass was $18.  Even the Ritz, has a house wine for $10.00  Strike 2.  : (

We hosted our son's birthday party there this fall. We had mini golf to occupy the kids and batting cages for the parents to take some time to play. It was a great day. They made everything easy and fun. I would recommend it there to anyone.

Our kids flight got delayed after we started to the airport, so we took a detour.  So glad we did!  Mcnamara's Irish Pub is the real deal.  We enjoy d the fish and chips, curry chicken, potato soup, and Shepard's pie.  Oh yeah, we started with Scotch eggs, which we all agreed was the right choice.  Needless to say the atmosphere reminded me of my time in Ireland on a pub tour.  Will be back when the band plays!
This park is lit at night! Love seeing palm trees in various colors. Great Instagram spot - look up!

It was bad.  We had a reservation for a large group and they didn't have enough tables or chairs for our group.  When we asked about it they told us there probably weren't any other tables that size.  Eventually they did find something.  The group didn't get water or drink orders taken for 45 minutes!  The appetizers were good.  Our main courses were just ok.  I got a non alcoholic drink limeade-  it was tiny and not good at all.  The server was very short with us.  We had planned to play games afterwards, but we left and won't be back.

The atmosphere is rustic and it seems like slowly cheaper looking furniture is creeping in. It's losing some of the kitschy ambiance I have loved in the past. Our food was just okay. The potatoes were over spiced and barely warm, but my omelette was good. The coffee is always empty and the coffee bar is always a mess, which might not be a big deal if the coffee tasted better. The staff is boring and barely interactive. I think you lose something with the counter experience. I'll be back, the bacon is good and I'm willing to ask politely for assistance and more coffee. The place has potential, I just don't see it for the price right now.
Come on acknowledge. Someone is at the door and accommodate them when two tables are ready took awhile to even look up

Came in for a scheduled tire rotation (I had an appointment)... this is a simple procedure which should take no more than 30-40 minutes.  Still waiting after an hour... the price is good for the service performed.. but the time for the service is wanting.

This is the place that I measure all other similar Asian buffet restaurants against. I've always had a positive experience with the staff, and felt like they go out of their way to keep this place very clean too.

You can always rely on the standard food options ranging from a variety of Asian and American greasy fried comfort food. But what I also like is that every time I go, there's always another dish or four that wasn't there the previous time. So I like that they change things up. They also have separate sushi and made-to-order hibachi stations as well. They also have soft serve ice cream and frozen yogurt machines (a much better option than frozen cups at other places). But my one complaint is that at my most recent visit, they didn't have the one thing I always look most forward to when I go. They put out these bowls of some sort of powered nuts that I put as a topping on top of the ice cream. It's out of this world and I hope it was a temporary decision to not have them that night. Please bring them back!

I was a little disappointed when the restaurant burned down a few years ago (thankfully nobody was hurt). I wasn't sure if they were going to reopen, but they did. And the makeover looks amazing. They re-did everything using grey tones everywhere that makes everything look more modern and sleek. So, I am happy that they have continued to stay open and are doing better than ever it seems.
Quite pricey for a restaurant in a Sparks neighborhood. Food is excellent though.

Expensive for very little food.  
2 meals, one with water came to almost $20. 
Could have a better meal at Smokey Bones or Red Lobster for that kind of money.
Only positive is that staff is extremely nice.

This was, to put it simply, yet wholly, sad. Merchandise was almost all the same from vendor to vendor, and yes, even though it is crafty and unique, too expensive. They're catering to Carmel, that's for sure. They needed a wider variety of goods when it came to cost, we don't all want to spend $200 on a nutcracker. 

People come for the food. That caused the lines to literally wrap around other booths and sidewalks for about 100 yards. We could not believe our eyes, there was no way we were going to wait...

That sums it up. That and ice skating. So we left after exactly one loop around, disappointed and empty handed. This event needs a lot of improvement in variety of activities and set prices. Also - more food vendors. They lost a lot of business just from people not wanting to wait.

This place is amazing, lamb shoulder was awesome the guac was yummy but small portion . I loved the decor. It was chic authentic decor, the hostess was super authentic as well super respectful and he knew what he is doing . Lighting was amazing . I will def come back here and recommend this place to all friends . Can I ask the owner to open another branch in Fishtown??? I am sure it will be successful

My first visit to Half & Half was wonderful! Fresh orange juice and blueberry pancakes were excellent! Second visit was disappointing, however. I ordered the eggs benedict with spinach and avocado - the poached eggs were under-cooked and potatoes were barely warm. Also, the orange juice glass smelled which ruined the flavor. We were seated at a booth close to the bar and it was definitely drafty. Finally, it happened to be the first really cold day (22 degrees) and there was no coat rack which made for a close fit for the four of us.

The service here is excellent. Seated right away. Coffee in less than a minute and really decent cup pa joe.  Ordered two eggs over easy and the turkey sausage links. Food arrived in less than 10 minutes. As happy as we were to seee the food so quickly the waiter was impatient that it took so long..lol
It's a great breakfast joint a few minutes drive from the PHL airport. Oh one last thing the toast came out with the food which is important to me.

Stopped in for hot chocolate over the holiday. Beautiful space in the lobby of the Ritz. Service was awful! Food was brought out with no place settings, napkins, silverware. Hot chocolates came to the table one by one, 15 minutes apart.  While food was good, this is the Ritz after all and service should be better.

Really a pleasant experience. It is better once inside.  Great wait staff, good suggestions.  I will take friends there when going to the  downtown.  The asperigass appetizer was a great find. I'll try the bar next time since it looks like a great gathering spot.

The vibe of this place is KILLING IT.
I also just popped in because the items pursuing me from the inside as I walked past the windows. Good marketing you guys!
Unfortunately there's no way I could afford anything in this store, including a single ply square of TP, I'm sure.
I want to give this place 5 starts because really everything about this place is incredible, minus the pricing and affordability of any items available in Two Old Hippies.
I would probably more likely describe TOH as Two Ol Hipsters instead.
I don't think I'll be back (insert very sad face)

Once again, I was told that they couldn't take my order at the drive thru. They said their computer was down and I was asked to come inside to place my order- though she was able to tell me that through the speaker. So, if she can communicate through the speaker and take and prepare an order inside - how can she not just take my order through the speaker? And this happens all the time. Once I was just told I'd have to come back later because they were in a shift change. What? It's time for Taco Bell to strip this franchise from its current owner and put someone in place who can run it effectively.

This place is awesome. Best meal I've had in years. Literally years. 

It's all small plates so we had the Korean tofu, ramen, potato croquettes, and spaghetti. Everything was mind blowing. My only regret was not getting dessert. We really wanted to but were so full after all the food we ordered that we couldn't possibly. 

The ambiance was nice - a little dark. I would recommend this for a date or place to catch up as the place itself is tiny so it would be awkward getting a big group in there. The music isn't blaring so you can actually hear each other gush about how wonderful the food is. Service was great too.

In sum, I would come back to Philadelphia for this meal alone.
Delicious menu, beautiful atmosphere and amazing waitstaff. Very clean and did I mention how wonderful the food is! The owner is an amazing man and we enjoy this place immensely!

What a great surprise. I stopped in here as Vintage and El Vez were crazy full for the holidays. An amazing selection of vegetarian options. The highlight of the night was the punch. Perfect for the holidays, light and refreshing, with a hint of green apple and cloves. It was like a light mulled wine. Yummy! I'd go back anytime.
Yelp location on this is wrong it's inside the Galleria Food Court. Classic grilled sandwich place that always delivers. Can't go wrong with the California Chicken or the Phillys. Great prices too!

I came here with my girlfriend last weekend and the tacos were absolutely delicious. I had the pork tacos and my girlfriend had the fish tacos. We also both got the empanadas. We both loved our meals and don't have any complaints. This is definitely one of the best taco places we have been to.

A good friend from a NOLA took us there on our first trip there and it blew our minds, amazing food. Just good ole down home fresh southern creole cooking with a warm inviting atmosphere. We make sure and stop by every time we are in town, too good to skip.

Cafe Du Monde is an obvious must if visiting New Orleans. We were glad we visited for delicious beignets.

We each ordered one order of Beignets, three to an order. It was the perfect sized treat for us. The beignets were yummy, not too greasy and covered in plenty of powdered sugar. I wouldn't say they were mind blowing, but beignets are an obvious must when in New Orleans. 

This location was clean and quick at pumping out orders. The staff was on top of clearing tables so that tables were always ready. There are tables inside an some more outside along the water.

We hoped to beat crowds by visiting this location inside of Outlet Collection at Riverwalk and it proved to be a good plan. At 8:30 in the morning we didn't have a wait and there was plenty of seating available. Later in the day we walked by the original location and the line was huge. If you are interested in beignets more than location and this is convenient I'd suggest coming to this location.

I've been going to Great Clips for about 3 years now and every time I've gone they asked me if I want it cut to a certain thing and I say yes and they do a superb job clientele is fantastic they work real close with you
Very clean shop,  nail tech fixed my nails and made them look beautiful.  Exactly what I asked for.

If you have visited Conshy but haven't been to Guppy's, then your Conshy experience was not fully complete! Whether you are looking for a low key date night, a place to watch a sports game, or a casual place to go out on a Saturday night, Guppy's is your place! They have great food specials and a very welcoming atmosphere. There are not a ton of tables but if you come on off-peak hours, you shouldn't have a problem with sitting down right away. This is the perfect place to keep things casual!

I was super dissatisfied with my experience today at the Ulta in cool springs. I was in to shop for a perfume and wanted to smell a perfume they had out on display and they had no tester out to smell. I asked if they had a tester available and was told "We recommend going to a department store to smell that". If that's the case, I would have went to the department store and bought from them. I don't understand why another bottle couldn't have been opened and made a tester. I ended up not buying any perfume and just getting other things I needed. Then, when I approached the counter to check out they looked at us a couple times and then were like "oh do you need to check out"... yes?? Why else would we be standing here? Just an all around bad experience and I won't be returning to this Ulta.

I thought this Hampton Inn was nice however I had  one thing I think they could improve on.

1. Put meat on the Breakfast buffett
2. Need better signs on how to get to the parking lot

Other then that the beds are very comfortable and the wifi worked great. The place is clean and tidy.
I was looking forward to having a burger and fries from this place but was let down. Fries were cold and looked old. The burger was ok but just wished the were on point.

Hands down the best espresso in town! I'm from DC and love going to Blue Bottle Coffee. This reminds me of Blue Bottle. Very nice staff, welcoming. Double shot ristretto in their cortado very flavorful.

This is my boyfriend and I's go to place for sushi. We always come for the 2 for $8 lunch special. The sushi is always fresh and tasty here. The interior is super simple and the space is very clean. Every time we come here, we receive exceptional service. The waitress always makes sure we're okay and if we need anything else. I definitely would recommend this place to anyone.

Amazing experience. Rob was a cool dude. The guy who checked me in was also pretty dam nice.. The place was cool nice vibe. Nice friendly group of guys. Rob created such great conversation and kept me engaged the whole time.. His 1st Time cutting my hair and was pretty dam good! Groom barber shop needs to take a page out of these professionals hand book.... #LearnFromAtlasGrooming #GroomBarberShopWasNotNice #RobIsTheMan #AlreadySetMyNextAppointment

The name doesn't lie! The food was absolutely fantastic!! The food was extremely flavorful and great Dim Sum options:) I loved the artistic atmosphere and the cleanliness of the establishment. All the art and interior design goes together and it's done very tastefully. Will be returning again for sure!

Fantastic Food, Fabulous Service!

We had the antipasta ( which had about 10 items on it. All fresh and special, and yes I loved the tiny bit of truffle oil on the egg., the lettuce with blue cheese and bacon salad, the rib eye steak, Italian Chicken( cant remember the name :) )Garlic bread, home made pasta . Ive been here before but you outdid yourselves tonight. We even called in that night for a reservation, had to wait only 10 minutes but it was so worth it !! Our server Brandon was the best!!. They accomodated my gluten allergy. Cant say enough good things about Deanna's . My favorite place to eat !

Food is 3 stars but the restaurant is extremely clean. It gets a 4 overall rating.  Want to come back and try something else. Got boneless spare ribs and sweet sour chicken. Ribs are ok and the chicken was fried, which was a surprise.
Awesome breakfast sandwiches. They were made with egg whites which is a little different and the menu didn't specify it. I loved it though.

Have used Tim and Rittenhouse Handyman 3 times in past 2 months and extremely satisfied with all aspects of this firm. They're prompt, courteous, smart, on-time, and efficient. I'm thrilled to have found a great company like this with reasonable rates.

Just found out about this place! Amazing knowledge and customer service you won't find elsewhere in Tucson! I'm impressed and will definitely be back. Name it they have it and can do it! I don't want to speak to soon but I can't see myself buying from anywhere else!

Ooey gooey goodness is the best way to describe the grilled cheese at Meltkraft @ Reading Terminal Market. 

Based on a recommendation: Skip the Brie and Avenue D and go with the Truffle Shuffle Special since it's not always on the menu and apparently in high demand. I honestly wasn't crazy about the tomato soup, could have used some cream but hey it's all about the grilled cheese.

On Saturday during lunch I probably waited a total of 20min which wasn't too bad.

I've been meaning to leave a review for Cafe European for months now, we try to go at least twice a month.  This is a cute little family owned restaurant with outside seating by the water. Service is great and the food is even better, we haven't tried anything that we didn't like. The Shepherds Pie and Goulash are two of our favorites. If you like wine BYOB.  Enjoy :)

Very friendly and attention detailed service, we met every employee there it seemed!! The dishes were hot and delicious, with rich and deep flavors. They have definitely set a new precedent for this Indian restaurant lover!

Great American corner deli. Fast service.  Friendly staff.  Large selection of all the classic sandwiches. 

Reuben was amazing.  Hot pastrami grilled to perfection.  Not too sloppy. 

Free on-street back-in only parking at the police station across the street.

My husband and I were visiting Nashville for the first time on December 9th. We wandered around downtown looking for a place to eat and found The Stillery Midtown. Gary was our waiter and we found out is was their soft opening that night! We decided to try a few our their signature "moonshine" cocktails which we have never had before. Gary was very helpful helping us decide which ones to try as I can be very picky with my cocktails. I had the Blackberry Lime Moonshine and my husband had a Blueberry Smash. OMG SOOOOO good! We ordered the Sriracha Devil Eggs as a starter and although I am not a fan of spicy these were dynamite!  Gary had asked the chef to go light on the spice for me, which they did, but they still had a bite to them which was enjoyable and the prosciutto was thin and crispy. For our main course we had another round of moonshine cocktails. I stuck with the Blackberry Lime and my husband had the Dreamsicle (which taste just like a orange creamsicle). We split the MC Burger which was one of the best burgers we have ever had! It came with a side of shoestring fries that were super yummy as well! The burger had 2 patties, prosciutto and a fried egg on it. It was cooked to perfection and just oozed with yumminess. In addition was asked for a side of the mac and cheese. I can't decide what I liked more, the burger or the mac and cheese! The mac and cheese also was one of the best I've ever had, we finished everything! We are not big eaters and usually leave half our food on our plates or take it home but OMG not this time! We inhaled it all! Gary was great, great sense of humor, checked on us frequently but not annoyingly like some do, even took our picture when we asked him to. Billy, the general manager stopped by to introduce himself and check on us. He gave us some information on what to do during our stay and was very helpful as well. We were very appreciative of the genuine care we were shown this night and to boot dinner was free! We left Gary a nice tip since dinner was comped due to the soft opening but really we would have tipped him heavily anyways cuz he deserved it! Good job guys! We will be back on our next trip to Nashville and we already sent people your way! Thanks again!

I chose this as my regular vet, and I have been so glad that I did! Everyone at this clinic is friendly, helpful, and so great with my dog! He genuinely gets excited to go to the vet because of this. Every issue I've had with him has been treated conservatively, and has been affordable. The place is spotless as well, and they have a great waiting area with coffee and tea. Best part is, they are open 24/7 for any emergencies!

I absolutely love this salon! Finding the right hair stylist is more difficult than dating, and  I had several haircuts around town before finding this gem. 

The staff is friendly and welcoming, offering a smile and refreshments. The atmosphere is bright, modern, clean, and comfortable. And Natalia is amazing!! She is always able to give me the cut and style I'm looking for and is the most friendly and personable stylist I've met!

Although sometimes this place can be dead, it shouldn't be. This place has quality food full of tantalizing taste. My girlfriend and I both ordered the Spiced honey roasted squash, kale, queso, pepita, and salsa verde. One will leave your belly happy and two, maybe 3, will leave your belly full. Hope this place survives the Santa Barbara rent!

You may wonder about Arepa but until you try it you don't know and you will be hooked. 

Cool place in the lower garden. 

It is amazing.
We love the Coachman--great food, reasonable prices, and a good drinks.  It's one of our regular places to go and we can always get in without having to wait.
Good tasting food that was made quickly. Waitstaff is polite and quick. Reasonable prices for the main line area.

Warm dark wood paneled walls, high back dark booths, glass bubble lights dripping from the ceiling, simple elegance.  The wait staff is professionally dressed and service was top notch.  If you are looking for a high end dining establishment for steaks and seafood for a special occasion this just might be the place.  Just don't forget you wallet because it's pricey! 

We started with the Point Judith Calamari (Sweet Chili Sauce, Thai Chilis) 
Cooked perfectly and the chili sauce was on point!  Not to hot but full of flavor!  The Ahi Tuna Tartare (Avocado, Ginger Ponzu, Sesame Seeds) which was melt in your mouth FAB-U-LOUS!!!

For our entree we ordered the special Petite Lobster Tail with scallops, two cheeses, and corn and peppers.  the scallops were cooked to perfection and the sauce was tasty!!!!

And for desert we shared a piece of Ten Layer Carrot Cake (Cream Cheese Icing and Pineapple Syrup).  it is seriously ten layers of carrot cake heaven!

For that special occasion this just might be the place!

Great city.
One of the best to walk in the USA.  beautiful sidestreets.
The food, sports franchises, transportation..

Love Kohens kosher deli. The deli sandwiches are my go-to orders, but they also make great orders off the menu. The steak sandwich is also one of my favorites. Everyone is friendly in the store and I think it is a great quick dining experience whether you adhere to kosher dietary laws or not. I wish it was opened a little later in the day so that I can get dinner here.

I went last nite (freezing) for my nephew's b-day. Just crowed enough to be happy.Seated right away ,roomy. Our waitress was Brooke,I recommend her ,was there when we needed her,no hustle.
Started w/ a great Manhattan,and a Stella,no rush,wasn't driving so I had another.
I had crab cakes,nephew mixed seafood grill BOTH were very good,and better than I had remembered.
I have always liked the atmosphere here,but the wait staff can be sketchy,so we will ask for Brooke next time.
Only CON:: Please  a few more of the micro-muffins would be appreciated.They are excellent ,fresh and tasty,but we had to beg for a refill.
We are definitely fans,enjoy the New Year !!!!!!

The owner, Lisa and her staff, were warm and welcoming. She went beyond our expectations with wonderful stories about the towns history, and "must sees" in New Hope. I highly recommend her family owned/operated B&B...it was wonderful to return after many years!

Went there for dinner Friday, December 1, 2017 & with my order I asked for a small cup to get water. I was told that they don't do that, they have to charge me for an empty cup. I have eaten at other Popeyes and never been told I have to pay for a glass of water or just the cup. Just bring your own water or your own cup when you go to eat at this popeyes (1516 chestnut st. Philadelphia).

A horrible experience from beginning to end.  Took over 30 minutes to order a drink.  Staff was in chaos.  Food was ice cold by the time it eventually arrived and then it took 15 minutes to get a completely undeserved check. They might want consider actually hiring a manager.  One of the worst food experiences we have ever encountered. Anywhere.
Wow!! Wow!! Wow!!  Superb. Kick-a55 gumbo. Rockin pecan pie. Yumbo mumbo gumbo = super gumbo plus fried shrimp on top. Mind blown!!
The food was really tasty, and the staff was great! I really enjoy the artifacts, and country style accents! This place is really nice! Try it, you can will not regret it!

I came to status with a group of girl friends we had a blast!! The bartender Brain and the manager Manny made the night.  They really made sure we were having a good time. They have a dj on the weekends which is always a plus for a roof top lounge. I send everyone I know that's going to Philly there to at least grab a drink and hang outside on a nice night.

I had a great experience here yesterday. I called 30 minutes before they closed to see if someone would be able to give me a haircut. The manager told me they would take care of me and Matt who cut my hair certainly did. He was so friendly, he understood my needs and concerns and was very genuine. I told him I was sensitive to the thinning spot on my head and made a suggestion to the type of haircut. I valued that a great deal. He made great conversation and even suggested some products, it wasn't just to make me spend more money, but fully explained why I should consider it. I   had my interview and I have him to thank for making my cut sophisticated and gave me pointers to create a polished look. I highly recommend. He took his time and it's the type of service people want.

Lovely converted home with interesting features in a great location off of Mass Ave for restaurants and bars - but not in the heart of downtown if that is important.  Pluses include an access code that allows entrance at your convenience - but we had to call several times as we never did receive the email that was meant to convey the code as well as various other instructions for parking, etc. We stayed in Room #2, the largest and most expensive of the 6.  It was clean and attractive, but chairs were tiny and uncomfortable and mattress was soft and lumpy - not making for restful lounging or sleep.  While WIFI is touted, there was no code in the room for access, and we couldn't locate anyone to inquire.  We were caught off guard that no breakfast is provided on site, as that is part of the enjoyment of staying at a B & B rather than a hotel, for us.  The one option available that morning (Louie's doesn't open until later) was Henry's, which was not a good experience.  Parking is almost two blocks away, which is very inconvenient and not made obvious on the web site.  The indication that street parking is plentiful is very misleading, as this is a very populated and busy business district with limited parking.  We never encountered a proprietor or staff person, even when searching to ask questions.  This is certainly a serviceable option for a place to stay, but not superior to a hotel experience, in my opinion.

Note added after Leesa's response:  I appreciate your quick attention to the review and your detailed response.  I should add that my preferences are not likely the same as others who have enjoyed the Inn, based on other reviews, so folks should give it a try and will likely be pleased.
I ordered the thin end rib dinner, food was delicious. The guys that work there are hilarious never a dull moment. I'll be back when I'm in town!

I've been here quite a few times, but had an extremely good experience here recently. 

I'm not vegan, I don't like spicy food, and I'm not particularly an adventurous eater. The staff was very informative in regards to what was spicy and what could be modified to be less spicy. The service was prompt and friendly. 

The ramen was extremely flavorful and I might go once a week during the winter to recreate the experience. Really awesome place.

I did not like the mayonnaise they put on the burger. It made it taste too salty. The fries are great and they give you ranch. I ordered a Moscow Mule and they did not serve it in a copper cup as described but in a glass.  My fiancé had fish and chips and loved it. I might come back for a basket of fries and another Mule if served in the correct cup.

As this was my first time ever staying in a hostel, I had no idea what to expect. At a minimum, my expectations were pretty bare bones. The Quisby completely exceeded everything I had imagined. The rooms are clean, the breakfast was filling, the bunks have memory foam, the staff are awesome, and they have a decent 24 hour bar. Additionally, they are right next to the trolly and still have quite a few restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. I will definitely stay here again- you can't beat the price for whats included!!
A good place to miss.  Food not so good and service worse.  Very bad dining experience.

I frequently visit Due Amici for late night pizza. There are a variety of pie options from chicken buffalo, margherita, BBQ, sausage, ham, vegetarian and the list goes on. After living in New York I often miss a large slice of New York pie, Due Amici fills that void. Every slice I've eaten from here has been delicious. The veggie pizza is my favorite - it's loaded with mushrooms, peppers, olives and cheese. The price is quite steep for a slice of pizza at $5 a pop. If you're on Ubor I recommend stopping by for a slice.

One of my favorite restaurants.   Great service and great food.   I had the Kobe beef sliders and fries.  Sliders were cooked perfectly with a bit of garlic aioli.   Fries lightly seasoned.   Very relaxed atmosphere.   I will return
1st visit and had breakfast and YUM! Well cooked bacon(a must) and home fries done just right. Can't wait to try the bbq next time.

CWAS cannot be missed! As both a meat and veggie lover, this is absolutely worth the adventure. Snag a res, this place is tight and crowded. Being from NJ, I find myself visiting philly quite often. I have visited CWAS this past September as well as Sept 2016 for a friend's birthday who is vegan. This is some place I would have never chosen on my own but I highly recommend this joint. 
Friendly and attentive staff, sweet environment and decor. If you get the chance to sit in the back sit away from the wall so you can see the cool screen playing old video clips. 
In my recent visits I have tried the Gin cocktails on special and fell in love. They use such awesome ingredients like ginger and rosemary and I enjoyed the creativeness. 
As it is tapas, we chose to order almost everything. Standouts were the Bucatini and meatballs and Korean fried tofu. I could have sworn it was meat! The Tofu was crisp, spicy and so flavorful, i could have ordered and eaten it all night long!  The zucchini crab cake sliders were tasty though I wish there was more filling it was too much bun! Try the Bao buns! They won't compare to some amazing one I've tried in Brooklyn, but hoisin sauce is great!
Food is ok, nothing amazing...dont just come for the food. Overwhelming dance floor and stage and plenty of seating. Open atmosphere, seems to be a good bar..just not great food

Clean, super spacious, cozy, and never too loud!
Most of the people come here study, get works done, and even for interviews because it's such a great environment like that!

There are three different section on the first floor and more in the basement if you need. There's wall plugs everywhere for your digital items, fast WiFi, one clean bathroom. Easy to find parking! Drinks and small pastries are available with friendly baristas. 

My favorite is their London Fog Tea!
Great location on Central.   Fast service and delicious food!   I had the seared tuna and I loved it.  I will come back for drinks or dinner again.

I've seen very few places that are as revolting to stay as this. My husband and I have been homeless for the last several months and we have not seen anything this unbearable. If it wasn't so cold outside (and paid for by our church) neither one of us would have stayed. This is NOT worth the cost of over $67 a night!  

The rug is covered by residue of past, shall we say, romantic encounters.  It was so disgusting that I didn't even want to walk on the carpet with bare feet or even socks.

Black scuff marks were on the walls.  Maid sign had a crack in it.  Vent on the heater was broken.  The window shade couldn't be hinged.  The bathtub was dirty and had holes in it.  There was a huge rusted out crack in the ceiling above the shower.  Wires sticking out everyplace.  Heater outlet ripped out from the wall and mortar falling out of the hole.  The grass outside was overgrown and uncared for and covered with garbage.

The microwave and refrigerator were so filthy I was afraid of using them.

The state of the room was so bad if I had not been so bone tired I wouldn't have used the bed for fear of what bugs might be crawling in it. I'm pretty sure I should head to the free clinic and get myself checked out for bed bugs or whatever may have been in that filth hole of a bed.

The hotel policies were bad.  They did not want to give a room to 2 married men.  They did but very begrudgingly.  I felt judged and degraded as a human being.

This is Budget Inn; whose budget?  Finals Trump?

Holy sjhdiqhanspcuwgwbakxhv I'm in love with this place. After a 2 hour ride from North Jersey to a job site , walking into this place was such a relief. Sonia, the owner, was fantastic and welcomed me even though I probably had a tired, cranky face on. HOME MADE everything , even the vanilla. My vanilla latte was SO tasteful of vanilla I only needed to add 1 sugar packet afterwards. No chemicals added into anything. Almond croissant was soft, flaky, buttery, and so so good. Truly. I barely write reviews but I had to write one for this place. Thanks so much Sonia! (Hope I spelled your name right) I'll be back again for sure

I love the salsa. There can be a wait when there is a game on but it's worth it! The monster burrito is huge and amazing plus is a great price. That's what my boyfriend gets and the monster chimichanga is also amazing but I can't ever eat that much so I normally just get the regular. I also really love the dessert options. I was curious how to make the fried cheesecake and the cook told me. Which I find kinda cool. Also I love there white queso sauce they put on the burrito and chimichanga!!

This is such an amazing spot! I really enjoyed the Fried Chicken and my sides of Mashed Potatoes and Mac and Cheese. I also had my very first Chocolate Pie and was very happy with the experience (I ordered the Spicy Chocolate Pie). The lines move quickly and the service is great.

Pleasantly surprised. My first time there today and had a really great experience. The whole staff was helpful and friendly. I had to eat about ten minutes for a bay to open as they were really busy. I'll definitely be back to shoot some more.

I visited The Harding House as part of a group event several weeks ago. The format of the event was a banquet style dinner followed by dancing with a band. When all of the guests arrived at the venue, security roughly patted everyone down and demanded to see identification. The contracted security guard even confiscated a woman's ID claiming it was fake, when she was in fact 22 and had presented a valid ID. After several of the men in our group demanded the ID be returned, it eventually was, but the security guard offered no apology. 

While the table settings and presentation of the banquet were well done, the food was subpar. The chicken and pasta dish I ordered was served cold, although the exterior was warm as if it had just been microwaved. The appetizer salad and dessert, however, were fantastic. 

Overall, the service throughout the evening was subpar. The waitress assigned to our table rarely filled our water up or removed our plate, and got several of our orders wrong. The band and the dancing following our banquet were lively and made for a wonderful evening, which is really why I am only giving The Harding House 2 stars. 

Their customer service and attitude towards their diners are below average.

Definitely worth the trip. Food quantity/serving size is better than fair for the cost. No complaints with the taste, it was delicious! Ordered a 14" Los Olivos Pizza and Antipasto salad - we will come back here again to try other offerings from the menu.

Parking does seem limited, but I didn't take away a star for this reason. I just feel like this place is a solid 4 star, maybe 4.5, just not a 5 star place.

A local chain with overpriced (hence the 4 stars) but delicious smoothies/juices. Everytime I come here I get the Honeylove smoothie-- it's so amazing and delicious that I often try to recreate it at home. They often have samples of random nut mixes laying around and of their juices in the fridge. 

Once I came here 15 minutes to closing, and the lady working gave me a few juices for free that she was going to have to throw away anyway because they were expiring the next day!

Seriously disappointed. The whole miserable experience started at the host stand.  We booked a table, only to be kept waiting for a good 10-15 minutes .  We only had one party ahead of us on the books, but as friends and family of the host arrived we were pushed further back on the wait list.  There were no available menus and we were pushed onto a small table.  We asked if we could be moved to a larger (set for 4) and were told that they were so backed up it would not be possible.  Then low and behold 2 minutes later a party of 2 were seated at the table we inquired about moving to.......  OK still open minded and optimistic our waitstaff were really great.  Hector was really helpful, and our waitress was really helpful too - although run off her feet.  We order muscles - don't bother they were dry and chewy, although the broth was good.  I ordered striploin med/rare -- it came out very well done and was like shoe leather.  The frits were burned and there was very little demi glace. Our waitress replaced it and although the 2nd steak was closer to medium, it was still so awful, our waitress comped the dish.    I don't think we will return, we were massively disappointed and expected a lot better than this travesty
Coolest spot in town. Best place to watch a game and lots of things to do for fun.

The broth they served was really good and the portions they offered were pretty decent for the hotpot. The real downside, however, is the terrible service they had. The lady with the short hair had so much attitude towards us, didn't serve us our order of veggies because only one order was not in season but didn't bother to tell us, and

For a busy Saturday night, we were a party of 5, the place was crowded, we were immediately seated and greeted by Tiahna, who provided great service. Very pleasant and attentive. Drinks came quick, followed by aps and our meal. We don't have one bad thing to say about our experience. Definitely will return.
Kevin was our serviceman and did a terrific job. He was clean, focused, efficient and very pleasant.

It's been a while. They still have the best clam chowder, but they got rid of some mainstays like the blackened cheddar chicken sandwich. My Caesar salad was soggy with dressing and one of our soup bowls was only half full. Our server was pleasant. No automatic tipping here yet. Just in Calgary I guess.
Without doubt the best (North) Indian food that you can get in Reno. Amazing and authentic taste for all the items we tried.

I didn't really want to go here, but I was outnumbered by my family.  I like BBQ, but not that much.  This place is a place I'd go again - and soon!  Everything was really good... and the service was the best part!  The sweetest manger and kindest employees! Give it a try!  Eat local.

First of note, the Save Our Cemeteries tours are hosted by a non-profit organization dedicated to preserving the historic tombs that make the New Orleans cemeteries so interesting, so right off the bat your money is going to a good cause. On top of that, the tours are excellent. Our guide was Jaime, a lifelong resident of New Orleans who was extremely knowledgeable about local history and blended traditional lore with myth busting. We took the St. Louis No. 1 & 2 combo tour. St. Louis No. 1 is right behind the church where you meet the guide, and it took us just over an hour to get through it. (Note that you can only visit this cemetery with a guide; tourists cannot just walk in on their own due to an unfortunate high amount of vandalism.) St. Louis No. 2 is a few blocks away--about a 5-minute walk--and has definitely seen better days. There is a highway built over it and is open to anyone, but it still has some really great stories and tombs to see, including a number of notable civil rights activists. Have well-informed guides who can hold their own among historians really added great value to our experience. I'd take this over a cheesy sensationalist tour any day!

This is by far the best fedex print and ship center in philly and I've been to almost all of them! The staff is friendly and efficient..and they always get my orders right. 

I've often needed several copies printed and bound with pretty specific instructions..made up on the spot. If you're friendly and ask nice they are more than happy to go the extra mile to get you what you need when you need it. 

I've witnessed several customers with attitudes or stupid questions and I've never seen an employee get upset. They're more than happy to answer your questions, show you how to use the self serve machines and walk you through projects. 

There is a wide array of supplies available for purchase from shipping items to basic office supplies..it's nice to have this right around the corner for when I'm in a pinch.

So, I was unimpressed by Bank & Bourbon. I went here the Wednesday before Thanksgiving and they were out of the top two things that I wanted from the menu (the scallops looked incredible, so I may have to go back when they are back in stock and update the review). 

We had a nice dinner, with relatively inattentive service. After ordering drinks (The Afterthought cocktail should not be its namesake, don't hesitate to order that beauty), it took a while to get them and then an even longer time to get out waitress' attention to order. 

Ambience wise, this place is very trendy despite being inside a hotel. The restaurant is pretty dimly lit and there are a few types of tables with different seating options like couch loungers. It seems good for groups as well.

For dinner, I had the Bronzino with roasted vegetables. It's a whole fish, but you  have the option of removing the head when served, which I requested. It was really buttery and rich. I couldn't finish it because I am not used to that amount of butter. The roasted veggies were pretty oily as well. My friend had the ahi tuna appetizer and a Brussel sprout salad as her dinner and she liked it. 

All in all, there are very few options for vegetarians, and some of the fish items even have bacon grease, so it's even tough for pescatarians. I am not anxious to recommend.
We had a group meet there last night. Our waitress Helen was great. She made us feel at home and welcome. The food was good and prided well.

Stopped here on 12/19/17 at about 630 pm.  When we  entered the door and proceeded to the counter, there was no one behind the counter, simply signs plastered all over the registers directing one to place their exclusively at the kiosk. God forbid someone actually take your order. After spending 2 minutes obviously fumbling with our order on the kiosk, a very excitable and frazzled crew chief/manager took our order. We took our seats and waited about 12 minutes for our order to be served. During this wait, the crew chief/manager constantly was heard throughout the dining area yelling out directions and orders to his crew. It was really, really a bad show. This continued the entire time we waited for our meal and while we ate. As we were leaving...and this crew chief/manager continues yelling in the kitchen... I see him pointing and shaking his finger directly in the face of a crew member and yelling "we DO NOT put tomatoes on a Big Mac!!" This was really unpleasant, unprofessional, and intimidating to do to someone.
The family and I had a great time. We've been to plenty of Hibachi restaurants and so far this one has been one of the best. Our Chef Josh was so good with the kids and the food was great!

Super friendly staff, great facility, calm environment, very nice doctor who took the appropriate amount of time for my concern, and relatively inexpensive.  I initially went to a competitor who wanted to charge me way too much. Since I am from out of town and need to iron out my health insurance plan, I was self pay.  I almost paid it but then went with my gut, left, and found this place instead.  I was charged almost HALF the other place quoted me.  So happy I found this place.

I love filling up at the Costco near my place, just outside of San Francisco, and it turns out I love filling up at this Costco just as much.

The hunnybunny steered the chariot into one of the lines, I jumped out into the sub-freezing air and negotiated the cards and pump, and we motored along with a happy tank.

Thanks, Costco, for the great prices and the flow-directing staff. It was a short but sweet visit.

This location sucks!!!! They steal your change and can't get an order right to save their lives!!  Just gave me hazelnut instead of Carmel and my daughter had a huge allergic reaction.  The DD at City Hall is by far the best location they have; this was a good spot a year ago.  They lost all their  good people!  Save yourself the trip

Server and manger was really rude. We went with team for dinner. Server broke glass on our table and one of our team member was hurt and bleeding. Server said sorry but did not provided any care. Luckily cut was minor and bleeding stopped. We asked manager and she was rude too, she asked us it happen once in while and no big deal. We were about 8 people and they included $60 tip on final bill without providing good service. Waiting is too long. Food was okay, pricey but not as quality. Will never return to this place again.
Good spot, good sandwiches, good service, good sides including the cole slaw. Check it out!

Best Indian Restaurant! I loved it!
I haven't tried anything yet that I don't like! My absolute favs so far ... gumbo, chicken, shrimp, all the sides lol and garlic naan! 
They even made my fav drink ... brandy milk bunch ... their way which was awesome!

Incredible local cuisine that we had as soon as we landed in Tampa.  My 5 year old had the amazing ham and cheese panini, I had the seasoned pulled pork with rice, beans and plantains.  Wife had the market salad.  They had a juice bar next door, but we were to full to try.

My experience there last night was awful. My boyfriend and I were told habatchi was full for the night at 7pm on a Monday...it was busy and we usually like it there so a table was fine. It took the waitress a minute to come over, then a minute in between each trip with one beverage at a time. I had to ask if I could order. 55 minutes later, still no sushi rolls, we ordered 2. Two girls that were seated just a minute before us we're leaving at this point and we had gotten nothing still. The waitress said she would get the manager, he said rolls are coming right out in a minute and on the house. 6 minutes later still nothing. We left and will never be back. Not even once did someone say "We're sorry".
Excellent Greek food with panini's, salads, and pizza! Affordable cuisine and very pleasant staff.

I come here quite often with my church friends either before or after an event. There's more than enough space to accommodate large groups and the food is always plentiful. The curly fries are scrumptious. The chicken/lamb gyros are always stuffed with juicy meat and French fries. And the grilled chicken salad....holy do they give you a ton of food! And they give you pita on the side! So if you want to skip out on the calories but still end up full, get the grilled chicken salad. So worth it. (And treat yourself to a side of curly fries while you're at it!)

Stopped in for a drink.  Bartender was sweet and whipped us up some great cocktails.  I tried the guacamole and chips.  They were good. My friend tried the pastor tacos.  I was disappointed with all the great reviews on the pastor (marinated pork) I was expecting a party in my mouth!  And Nope, no party no nothing.  Best pastor tacos in Indy are in Los Portales Restaurant.  Sorry Nada. In the other hand your place is decorated great the service is great, your bartender is great, and your cocktails too! But not your pastor. I will return and hopefully try something worthy to recommend other than your cocktails and nice place.

Arpeggio's food is always consistently good. I especially like Michael's chicken, the Spring House pizza, and nutty shrimp. The hummus is always fresh, complemented by steamy freshly baked pita bread.

Came here for lunch on a whim (of course after confirming with Yelp that it was a decent place!) and as usual, Yelpers did not steer me wrong. I was solo and when the sweet hostess seated me at a 4-ppl table, she was very accommodating when I asked to be moved to a more secluded booth. Ian my server was fantastic, personable without being overwhelming. I had the mushroom pizza and wow! It was devious. As I told Ian, I would have eaten the whole thing if I were in the confines of my own home, but in public, I felt like I should take half of it home to enjoy later. Will return!!

This place was terrible. The service was decent, during a Saints game so a bit loud, but not bad. The food was really sub par, but the real shock was, after ordering off of a very abbreviated "Brunch" menu, the bill came for $75! We had 2 bloody marys at the "bottomless" for $18 price, 1 bloody mary that was ordered ala carte, chips with queso, and 2 carne asada breakfast burritos. SEVENTY FIVE DOLLARS before tip! The carne asada tasted like they scraped the grill with a dirty brush, and used the charred grease scrapings to season the meat. There was cold pico, scrambled egg and black beans inside this dry breakfast burrito, all of which were devoid of flavor, besides burned grill taste. All of this would not have bothered me that much except when the gotcha bill came. Never again.
Great beer, clamiest clam chowder ever.  Good food and service.  Pleasant decor. Would I come back? Yes
Love the food and the environment. The service is usually great and the prices fair. The portions of food are usually pretty big and you always get soup or salad & breadsticks with your entree.
No slip and fall injured are happening here. The floor seems to be coated with a really effective non-slip substance. Slow service makes up for the glue on the floors. Food was typical toxic bell.

I ordered delivery from here for lunch.  I got chicken parm which was ok.  My husband had wings and jalapeño poppers.  Everything was just ok.  The portion size on the chix parm was good I think it was 2 large breasts so that was a plus.  Every now and then I want a good chicken parmigiana I can't say I found it here so I will have to keep looking.

Really delicious, innovative food. Decent service, but pretty expensive. I definitely intend to go back here for a night of margaritas, but first I've got to save up a bit! Great place for a small/medium meal, but you might not get totally full here. Have some tasty vegan options and staff that seem to know what they're talking about.
Service was good. Food was meh at best. Risotto side was undercooked and crunchy. Got seared barramundi and it was over cooked and way too salty. Way overpriced for what you get. Go somewhere else.
The macaroni and the crab cakes are always my favorite.  The red beans sent me into a food coma.

Browns has a great menu. I know this from eating at a couple Browns already. So we thought we would try this one for brunch. I was torn between a steak for brunch or the Chilli Lime Fish Sandwich. I decided nothing beats a steak and Ceaser for brunch. Then they tell me they are out of steak. Wtf! Out of steak! But the fish sandwich was decent. It wasn't amazballs but it was good. The server was friendly, the bartender took forever. All in all it was a decent brunch but I prefer the Manning or Sherwood locations

Just here to help cancel out the review about still being open. Am I supposed to have starved or saved up enough food to make it through the entire fire? Like come on some businesses have to stay open lady. Thank you guys for staying open.

This used to be #1 Steak / Seafood house in Reno for me.  I have gone three times in the last two years and have been disappointed each time. The first was on New Years Eve.  Staff was rude, and we had to wait approximately 2 hours and when our food came out it was over done. I vowed to never come again on a holiday. Second time was ok but nothing spectacular and the last time (which was about 2 weeks ago), we discovered that they had remodeled the beautiful interior and taken away all the beautiful wood work to squish massive tables together. The bartender was completely RUDE and acted as if we were bothering her. The food and our waiter was excellent. Why why why did they have to remodel???  That was the charm of Rapscallions!  I am SO disappointed.  Don't change the charm that had worked for so long!  Now the table are squished together in the middle which is absolutely horrible! I won't go again, unless it is in a booth. The change was NOT for the better.  P.S. Change the bartender.

The beef bowl was okay, but nothing to shout about.  A little bland with soft, almost greasy meat. Would be better if they offered gochujang as a condiment. 

Glad I was there on an uncrowded evening - the layout inside seems awkward - potential bottleneck to get sauces and pickled cucumbers.

I visited Cynthias's once last month to buy a hallmark ornament. I had a cash coupon.  5 off 10. They said they can't be used on ornaments and told me they would get in trouble for using it. They let me do it anyway. I go back again today and they refused me using a different 5 off 10 coupon for a different ornament. Three different clerks came up to me and refused to let me use the coupon.  
They were very unhelpful and condescending to me while I was there.
Just visiting philly and this was close to our Airbnb and it did not disappoint! Incredible food and beer selection!

This location is closing in early January. Nice size store with plenty of product left. It's located basically in a strip mall. My visit was rushed as I was on a 30 minute break from work and my commute was longer than anticipated... thanks Waze. 

Came here to get last minute material in an attempt to make a tree skirt last minute because paying over $50 for one was not in my holiday budget. The material I choose was 50% off. I purchased 2 yards of 2 different fabrics for under $10. The lady who helped me was very knowledgeable and engaging. She explained to me the one of the yards she had purchased about 4 years prior and made a friend curtains and the material was 5x the price I was paying.

If your in the area give it a whirl...

I just visited this location in the past week and I was very impressed at the size and display of the location but the staff were very unpleasant and the change rooms were somewhat difficult to find in behind the registers. The selection was very big.

I love the unique menu, I just wish there was more of a selection. I feel it is a little pricey for what it offers. The bar is quite amazing I must say. Fully stocked and lots of options. While I love so many of what is on the menu, I just wish there was so much more to choose from!!

This is a great restaurant that is fresh and fast that I think is under patronized. Great service that explained everything on their menu even gave suggestions on what they thought was the best. Also got onion rings which they fried fresh for me, and I watched them put together my Hot Dog and burger in front of me. Great quality and I didn't think a Hot Dog would fill me up so I also ordered a burger and wish I only chose one. DJ's is a great bargain for the quality and speed. The Hot Dog meal with keep you full and has many different options. The location was very clean and obviously well kept and staffed with caring employees.

This is an awesome spot! Juan's Flying Burrito was recommended by our friend who lived in New Orleans, and I definitely see why! We're from Baltimore, and this place definitely had a hipster vibe that reminded me of my Hampden neighborhood back home. The artwork was funky, and our server was very welcoming and attentive. My husband and I split the flying burrito (wet style) and flying enchiladas (these both had chicken, shrimp, and steak), and I had a jalapeño margarita. The food was so good! I really loved the sauce on the burrito. Juan's was a laid back and tasty way to start our day in the Garden District. Highly recommend!

My husband and I came here with both of our parents after seeing a show at Walnut Street Theater. The decor and vibe of the restaurant is awesome. There are so many intricate details in the design. We sat at a round table (which was awesome for a group of 6) and our waiter could not have been more accommodating. He was so pleasant and described everything on the menu. We opted out of the tasting menu as we weren't overly hungry and instead chose to order various items from the menus. The flatbreads are amazing and definitely good to share. The scallops are the biggest ones that I have ever seen and were served in a beet sauce. I definitely recommend this place for a group. It was a little bit loud, but we were able to hear each other just fine.
Delicious spot for lunch during the week. The pineapple fried rice, the chicken pho and the red curry chicken are my favorites. Gets busy but worth the wait.

I absolutely love that Salt + Smoke has gluten free items marked on their menu. It made me feel a lot more confident that I was going to have a meal that would not make me sick. I ordered the brisket sandwich on a gluten free bun and it was absolutely heavenly. The restaurant uses the "No Wait" app, which puts you in line for a table, since they don't take reservations. Expect a long wait, especially on a weekend night. I always thought Salt + Smoke was some upscale, pretentious, pricy place, but I couldn't be more wrong. It has a very chill atmosphere, the servers are friendly (and knowledgeable about gluten free), and the bourbon list is a mile long. As a Kansas Citian, and therefore a bbq snob, I wholeheartedly recommend this place!

This review is based on the experience we recently had at our holiday work party for about 80 guests. Actually we've had our party here for over 5 years now & there's a reason for that - they are just that good. I've been working with Sarah (the Special Events Manager) over the past few years & it's been an absolute pleasure.  She works with her team to deliver a great party - always reliable & accommodating.  Ryan & the entire bartending team & wait staff were terrific as well. The food is so delicious and service is spot on. We get so many compliments from everyone, including our out of town management team.  If you are considering having an event at FireStone Roasting House... do it!  You will have zero regrets.

Came in on a Sunday around 12 with my family for lunch. We were immediately seated and our server was very knowledgeable about the menu! I had the catfish and pulled pork with mac and cheese and potato salad. My family had the smothered pork with green beans and dressing. The food was delicious and quick to arrive. I don't normally like pork chops but they were amazing! The owner came by the table and we had a nice chat too! Totally worth the trip to come and eat here, so do yourself a favor and give them a try!

Negative stars!! Do NOT go here. I was a few minutes late to my appointment and they refused to take me. They did not call or give any warning. Very disorganized with bad customer service. In addition, there were no other clients in the entire salon. This not only is a personal red flag, but also made no sense why they refused to take me. Save your money or go down the street to the other salons!

We were regulars here until today. Why? The quality of the food is too often overshadowed by really bad service. During this visit, our server first forgot to bring us water, then silverware, then coffee, and then completely disappeared, leaving us sitting and wondering what happened to him. I had to find another server to help us pay the check. We never saw our original server again for the rest of our time at brunch. It's really disappointing, because the food is so good. But, it is so frustrating to get such bad service that we leave with a bad taste in our mouths. It's just not worth it to go here anymore. Sad.

A very personal staff with beer that is fully explained in the experience crafting. Try the Mufasa  or the Teddy Bear. There is also a few ciders and non-alcoholics to choose from.

Best of luck not getting lost in conversation with the workers. The space is the right side, with fixtures that fit the vibe.

This store is great. It's neat and organized. Doesn't have all the years of cluttered laying around everywhere. The cashiers could seem like they like their jobs a little more and speak English when communicating with one another. Other than that, this is my go to place.

We went here on a saints game day, so that is the only reason they get 2 stars, we were able to have a bar seat and watch football before going to the game. I worked in the restaurant business for 20 years so I am very forgiving with people being busy, I have been there, but this was bad. I hope that management reads the reviews because I want to help. 1. Have designated rolls for people, the bartender is the only one behind the bar and stays there. There should be a waitress (or two) that doesn't get any of their own drinks, including sodas. The waitress needs to wait on the tables. 2. The manager should not take over for the staff, rather make sure the food gets out, bartender has ice, customers have silverware, anything to make the experience better. Set the staff up for success. There was too much confusion when the tables were shared and maybe that is why there were so many food mistakes. 3. Your kitchen could not handle the food orders, or your wait staff could not handle putting in the orders. On game day you need to only make 4 different pizzas, order by the pie or sell pizza by the slice. Make a menu just for that, limit the food choices and maybe put a few drinks that are easy to make or bottle beer to sell more and expedite the order. Trust me people will be happy just to have a drink and a bite to eat even if they wanted a sandwich instead and to have a drink fast. 4. Explain to the bartender how the metered pour works, that was just painful. I have more things to fix but that would mean that I should be paid a managers salary. To sum up our stay, one table left because they had been here for hourS, yes plural, and their food was never cooked. Some of our food came out, some did not. Other people ordered food and It took forever. The manager was rude to his bartender and was arguing with her for half the time we were there. Also the bathroom smells like a fish tank, get a plumber.

No idea how this restaurant has so many stars!  I was totally taken in by the reviews and made a reservation here for our first night in NOLA.  Honestly, the worst meal of our stay.  The oysters were so small I am not even sure they were whole.  The "Corn Broth and Gulf Scallops" turned out to be more a very disappointing watery corn soup with baby scallops floating in it.  The crawfish beignets had nothing in them.  When my daughter requested a straw for her water glass, the server hand carried a straw to our table and then put it down on the table.  No napkin, nothing.  Generally, shouldn't that come wrapped in a napkin so it is clean?  Just yucky ... Bathroom was also not up to any standard that I was willing to use. Seriously, skip it.  So many other choices.
Joe and Jason do it right. If you want great service at a decent price, this is the place to go.

We are new to the area, and my husband picked this place for my birthday dinner as a surprise. As another reviewer stated, I also got a "weird" vibe from the staff - no one was friendly at all, except for the bartender, who was only slightly so.  Our waiter was okay, but again, not friendly at all - more "robotic" when citing the specials, taking our orders, etc. My husband spent a small fortune on drinks and dinner - which were good - but not really worth what they were charging.  It's a beautiful place, if only the staff had a bit of warmth in their demeanor.  Overall, I was disappointed and I'm not sure if we will be back.

We came here for brunch and absolutely loved it.  The service was awesome, the Bloody Mary and mimosas were delicious and the food...oh my gosh the food!  My boyfriend got the sausage and waffles and added fried chicken to it, which is his favorite brunch dish, and he was thoroughly impressed.  I got the three eggs breakfast and a biscuit and while it's more simple, it was still delicious.  We're from Chicago so we're no stranger to delicious brunches and this one was truly such a treat.

I really like the idea of the Christkindlmarkt but I don't think it was executed that well this year. The wine was good but I was disappointed they didn't have anymore souvenir cups. The market itself was fun to look around but there wasn't enough to make a day of it. I saw everything I needed to in about an hour and it was a 45 minute drive to get there, from the south side.

I think adding more seating and adding more booths to the area would have made it more enjoyable. I loved the IChe skating rink in the middle, I think it made a great focal pointe. 

Parking wasn't as bad as I thought it would be and the lines weren't that bad for a Sunday afternoon. 

I hope they continue to host this event and work on adjusting it because I think it can be an awesome event !

If you like waiting in long lines for donuts then this is the place for you. It's a tourist trap. If you've never been I do recommend you try it once. Otherwise, you can get the same thing without the wait in about 100 other places in New Orleans.

Without a doubt, Goody's lives up to its name.  My buddy and I were just visitin' (he from Memphis, me from New Hampshire) which meant that we just HAD to order what seemed like half the menu, featuring the Slinger of course.  Had to have it.  It was probably THE best breakfast of my entire life (well, at least this side of Helen's Restaurant way "down east" in Machias, Maine - absurd [local wild] blueberry pancakes!).  We both waddled out of there, completely stuffed to the gills, and couldn't even look at food for the next 12 hours.  Before I sign off, I have to mention how nice (and fun) ALL of the people there were, from our fellow diners to the folks who worked there. Thank you Goody's for an unforgettable experience!!

The classes here are so fun and every day is a chance to push yourself and learn more. The teachers are always super nice and there is always a positive atmosphere. Prices are very reasonable and we always have new students. I have advanced so much in such little time and I encourage everyone to sign up for a class!

Oliver is a fantastic electrician. I'm addition to the work he did on my home, I've also witnessed several other tasks/projects that he's completed and he always does a great job. I have worked with several electricians and Oliver is my preferred choice. He is skillful, yet also crafty. He can handle small jobs, high end jobs, or even something as small as trouble shooting. If you have electrical needs, don't waste your time calling someone else, call Oliver instead!
Great place to dine anytime. I've went during lunch and dinner, always left stuffed. Great sushi and sashimi and they have all you can eat sushi
Delicious ice cream. Generous portions. Unique home-made flavors. Super friendly people. Skip the places with gimmicks. Get the real thing here.

Stopped by here while visiting New Orleans. Was nervous at first seeing the ambience, but the pizza...was phenomenal! We ordered "The Godfather" and it was so good we stopped by the next day! 

Things to note:
Customer service is not that great. 
Only late night menu (pizzas only) is available after a certain point and they might tell you all you can order is a large. This happened to us the second night!

DJ's Only thing better than a Kansas City Dog is the staff! 96th Street has a great Team and treat their customers great! Between all the choices of Dogs, Sausages and Burgers you will find something byou love.Custom made and same time in line as a McDonalds - can't beat that! Thumbs UP!

I frequent Fat Cat Tavern. It is right around the corner from where I live. A great place to catch a game, enjoy a wide variety of cold beers and other drinks, sing some karaoke or partake in bar trivia. Don't be fool by the people that have had ONE bad experience. This place is the real deal, and I keep coming back every time.
I used to think best in city but recent quality has decreased. Thought it was a fluke but last few times I was disappointed.

Food ordered- 

Egg biryani - 8/10
Pav bajji -8/10
Egg hakka noodles -8/10

2 people 

So good!! It was perfect for a snowy and child night! Nt husband and I loved the good and the convenience ood where it's located! 

If they start delivering,  we might just bed in trouble!
excellent wine selection and good place to eat

Saw the reviews and have been wanting to try this place out for a while. Brought some out of town friends for dinner and the menu was underwhelming so I got a burger which was good but not the best burger I've ever had. Ended up getting some desserts to go. I did have the apple cider bourbon frozen drink which was delish but maybe not $12 delish. A little steep for a small glass of it. Came back the next morning for some pastries and coffee. The barista was not friendly and was rude when I asked if they had a particular item that morning. Needless to say I'll just be here for their desserts & pastries in the future.
Simply the best pizza in Philadelphia. Amazing thin crust. Sometimes they're sold out and you can't order it on a whim but if you have the time to reserve your dough...it's the best.

This McDonald's is very conveniently located at the end of Vets near the interstate. The parking lot is easy in and out.  I usually use the drive thru so I'll speak to that mode.
