Today at lunch the line was relatively short and moved very quickly.  No issues at the payment window and just a short wait and confirmation of my order at the second window.  

There was a little traffic jam as I was leaving because someone had pulled up to wait for their order and was blocking the exit.  

For the most part I was happy with my visit. I find this McDonald's to be one of the better locations.  The staff is polite and friendly, and that means a lot when you're talking about most fast food chains.

Turning Point offers some unique breakfast and lunch options with plenty of cool drink choices. 

They've got great pancakes- the strawberry chocolate chip is my go to order- and killer omelets. In addition to regular menu options, Turning Point typically offers seasonal items which can be found on inserts in the menu. 

This location can get pretty crowded during peak hours. To avoid long lines you can call ahead or grab a seat at the counter.
Not a very modern mall. Could use a few remodels and better / more urban stores added.

P'sghettis is good all the time, every time and any time.

I usually eat a Prince sub. Gotta get the garlic cheese bread. 

Everything I've had from there has been GREAT and the staff know what they are doing. I appreciate their efficiency and team work.

This is a very well run restaurant with thoughtfully prepared dishes that are interesting and painstakingly crafted. The location is tucked away; if possible, in the middle of the Green Hills madness but the food, drink and service are second to none

Bravo!

I've eaten here multiple times and they have always been busy. It's not hard to understand why and it is totally worth any wait. Myo omelet with the spicy feta is absolutely amazing. The potatoes are really good too.

This is a new hotel with modern amenities. Nice size rooms and the shower is modern glass enclosed and spacious. The TV has two features: Internet TV and regular TV. It was nice to watch movies from my own Netflix account.

The parking is valet only as there is nowhere else to park besides under the hotel. This place is within walking distance of the beachfront stretch (two blocks) and they have a golf cart shuttle service that will drop you off and pick up if you desire or have a lot of stuff to carry.

Staff is really friendly and professional and the complimentary breakfast had a nice selection. This will definitely be our hotel of choice when we return next year.

Great food.  
I read complaints about wait time.  I can understand that concern, but it is because they are busy and the cuisine takes more time than standard fare to do properly.  Here is what you can do to have an enjoyable experience despite longer than average waits for entrees:  

Order 2 appetizers, the price is really reasonable and they will get those out to you fairly quickly.  I recommend Goma ae, the gyoza, and the shumai.

Have a miso soup, also very quick and cheaper than a soda.  

Have a sm salad with ginger dressing.  
Quick and affordable.  

* depending on the crowd, the sushi takes -longest-, despite being raw , so don't think of that as an appetizer.

Budget 1-1.5 hours, have a Sapporo beer, some appetizers and then you can enjoy waiting for your wonderful meal that they prepare thoughtfully.

Place used to be decent and had a few classics on the menu. They poured money into a new room and a new menu, but not the execution of the food. We couldn't order the old favorite as it was removed from the menu and tried to order a comparable carbonara dish. It was dry as could be and fairly flavorless. The manager asked how things were going and was completely disinterested in our opinion of the new menu.

Just bought coffee so can't speak on house brews but the barista was helpful talking me through bean selections (which they had about 6 different bags). I bought a natural Costa Rica bean that was complex and rich. Will come back again

Had an amazing time at V street today! Had no idea Vegan food can be so so tasty! We had a 7pm reservation but the previous guests took longer than anticipated. We had to wait for 20 or so minutes but it was no trouble, we sat at the bar counter and chatted away. The staff was so courteous and really apologetic because we had to wait. We got the desserts on the house, which they really did not have to do but we really appreciated it. They also gave up a complimentary appetizer. The Dan dan noodles are fabulous and spicy (careful if you don't like spicy food). We also got the Mee goreng which was delicious. The Harissa grilled tofu tacos were so tasty as well. We got the Rose Lemonade and Imli Soda which were great, a bit on the sweeter side though. The soft serve of the day was really good. All in all, the place is great, good food , ambience and excellent staff.

My boyfriend and I recently moved to the area and sought out advice on which restaurants to check out. We could not have been happier with not only the service, but the environment. In addition to great staff and atmosphere, we ordered several things on the menu and were satisfied. We will definitely return!
Excellent nachos! Bloody Mary's are just as great. Awesome location and perfect to catch a game on the TV or to grab some drinks with friends.
Sandwiches are good, and we like the peppers that you can buy in a jar to take home. Good little sandwich shop.

My fiancé and I were brewery hopping in the area and decided to stop into the Raven to try the craft beer. At first the host wouldn't seat us when the restaurant area was almost empty. We were confused and finally Chase (a server) came over and said he would take care of us. I am so glad because we were going to leave. He gave us some of the best service I've had in a long time. Very knowledgeable and friendly. The food was amazing, I got the Ruben and fries my fiancé got the burger and salad. The Ruben was so hot I couldn't even eat it for a few torturous minutes. The fries were delicious and crispy, the corned beef was so freaking fresh it was ridiculous! My fiancé's burger was amazing and fresh as well! The beers were super good too! 
All I can say is that management needs to handle things better because if Chase hadn't stepped in and made sure we were seated we would never have had an amazing experience here and discovered this gem. We will definitely be back when we are in the area to try more wonderful food!
Amazing and huge portions. You could easily split a meal with two people.

I love the staff here, they are incredibly kind and there's a sense of community amongst the customers and staff every time I come in. The sushi is great, very fresh. And if you're lucky you can watch Chef Kim make it for you on the spot. Great prices too, awesome lunch special.
Slowest. Drive-thru. Ever. The manager needs to get with the program and train the employees better. No reason there should be a ten minute wait with three cars in line each only getting one drink.

We were traveling through town and Soup Kettle Grill came up as Gluten-Free.... not only do they have GF bread, the soups are also ALL Gluten-Free, even the Lobster Bisque we had! Great taste and fresh made food! Thank you!

Legit order takeout from here or eat here once a week. If I ask my friends, "what am I gonna eat this afternoon?" They'll say ramen. I love their food to the point it's getting unhealthy. I love the food, the service could be better. They're quick with the food when you order. I just wish they'd expand the place bigger, because it's very popular in Chinatown. 

Also... I hate that every time I eat there, there's this one white dude cook that stares at me 24/7 and I feel so uncomfortable. This is why I prefer to order takeout! 

Overall, love it! LOL

I took my daughter here to have her ears pierced for her 10th birthday. We walked in on a weekday evening without an appointment or calling ahead, so I was prepared to be put off or wait. I have never been to a tattoo place in my life, so I was a little intimidated (though I didn't let it show to my already nervous and excited daughter). I needn't have worried. At first, the woman who greeted us said the person who works with kids wasn't there, she kindly checked with a young man who agreed to do the piercing. As soon as he heard it was for her birthday, he said he would. He was patient, professional and careful. As soon as he saw how well my daughter was taking it, he relaxed visibly (it was kind of cute to see this young man, also a dad, show so much concern for my daughter's comfort). He even told her she did better than most adults. Lol. My child walked out proud and smiling. She is now healed from the piercing and doing great. I do not hesitate to recommend this place to other parents.

A friend of mine took me here for brunch the first time I came to visit Philly and it was such a good place! The atmosphere had a great vibe and the decor is pretty awesome. It's such a hidden gem. Our service was a bit hectic since we had a couple of people waiting on our table but the gentleman who looked like a manager seem to fix everything accordingly . I def would go back , and I would recommend this place to others.

I am absolutely obsessed with this place! THE most fresh food I think I've had in Tucson and the assortment of flavors combine beautifully! Not to mention how fairly priced they are & all the employees are so pleasant! Recommending to everyone! 
** update I went back about a week ago and ordered to go & because of the wait they where so kind to give me a free bowl of soup that was of course delicious! I will continue to come back and tell all my friends about this wonderful restaurant
Superb French Cuisine!!  I had the Caille aux Raisins and Truite Meunière.  I would definitely go back...Mahalo Nui Loa!!
We loved this place! Beautiful decor, delicious food, excellent service! Will definitely return during our next trip.

My family has a fun tradition of going to this Macy's for the organ and Christmas light show and the  Dickens Village on the 3rd floor. My parents are Philly natives and both grew up doing this and now we drive up from Baltimore to do this as a family. So much fun and very well done!

Waited in the drive thru line for over 20 minutes, with ONE car in front of me. You can go through the drive thru at in-n-out on the opening day of their new locations and get through their long lines faster than you can get through the drive thru here. Unfortunately I crave their greasy tacos on occasion, but I'll never be back to this location.
Amazing service, the manager was so friendly and came up to our table multiple times to check on us! Foods great and live music was awesome!

Very nice environment. Cool vibe and good location with great parking. Killer hostesses and waitstaff. Food is generally excellent but two entrees came lukewarm. I hate that. It's a bad idea to send food back for that reason as it will come back either overdone or out of sync with everyone else or both. So that's my only complaint. It's just negligence on the part of the kitchen staff or servers or both. I can't give it five stars for that reason.

We were traveling from Phoenix to New Orleans, staying at a Hilton Group Hotel every night.
The WA was the one stay with the most obstacles.
We selected a room next to the pool in the APP check in. We got the same room but the floor below.
We wanted a digital key but that did not work. APP said to try later. It never worked.

At checkin we had to wait over 5 minutes although only 2 people were at 2 open  counters infront of us.

We had a reservation for 4 people, but only 3 shower towels were in the bath.

The bathroom TV remote did not work and could not be fixed while our stay.

The toilet seat is loose and the toilet itself is mounted crocked angled compared to the wall.
One of the water faucets sprays a tiny water beam sideways.

Every hotel along the route had free breakfast for Diamond members, here not.

All together I question why we should stay at a WA ever again if the quality is worse than at cheaper stays and the greeting and personnel is less welcoming and friendly too.

This is a wonderful place for brunch on Saturday or Sunday. It's quite and relaxed with a great menu, delicious food and attentive service. This is the kind of place where time stands still. The French food and decor add to the atmosphere and make for a memorable experience. 

The quiche and salad are a wonderful choice along with many egg dishes. The salads and salmon were favorites for our group. 

If you want a quite and enchanted  place for brunch, choose Chateau West.

My morning needs are simple: a damn good cup of coffee and free wifi.  Cue in Kaffeine with their precision to brew one of the best cups of coffee in the northeast quadrant of downtown Indy.  If you haven't paid a visit to this spot I suggest you hurry and change that fast.

If I could give 0 stars I would. AVOID AT ALL COST. I got a pedicure and asked cost with gel polish. Was told it was $25 total- after picking number of polish color. I asked for extra massage and didn't get it. It was literally less than a minute of "massage" with rough scrub. Then she threw lotion on for less than 30 seconds. Water freezing and told them at least 4 times that it wasn't even warm. Tech then took the poker that she just cleaned my toes with and poked a hole through the plastic liner into the drain to drain the water (disgusting.) 
Completely unsanitary!!! I go to pay and she tells me it's $40!?! I was like why? She says gel and I said weep that is $15 upcharge for gel polish? She couldn't speak English so the owner, I guess? Decided to chime in and confirm it was $15 for gel on toes? What??? One bottle of the polish costs $8! Which I said and the response I got was "it's international mall honey" um so I guess that means you can lie then rip someone off? I will never go back there.
If you want to give a reason that's it's a mall so that why you completely rip people off then at least give a good service and follow the law when it comes to sanitation! So rude should've obviously checked out yelp before going there.

My first ever review, but I had to tell the world about Sweet Biscuit Company! This place is a totally fresh take on the biscuit trend, with a constantly changing mix of savory and sweet biscuits that will knock your socks off. The staff here is so sweet and genuinely wants you to have a great meal. If you run into the owner at the register, ask her to share the amazing Sweet Biscuit Co history. During a four day stay in Mt. Juliet, my fiancé and I had to come twice! Don't miss the hash brown casserole or the Roxane coffee. If we didn't live in Texas we'd be regulars without a doubt!

This is AMAZING! Such a wonderful experience for any age (although it is walking). If you've ever wanted to walk through a winter wonderland, this is it! They truly did an outstanding job! I don't really understand what the Newfields is but I can't wait to see how this continues to evolve and become even better year after year! Such a fun, great use of the space! Loved the lights show to music, heating stations!, and Girl Scout s'mores camp as well! And lastly, I can't say enough with how helpful and friendly the staff was. They were everywhere and everyone seemed so interested in helping and making it a great experience for us which is really nice to see.

This place is honestly the most breathtaking/beautiful venue in the Boise area! We hosted our engagement party last year in one of the Chateau's smaller rooms for around 20 guests. We were so impressed with the professionalism of the wait staff and management who ensured our guests had an amazing time. From the delicious food to the deep rich colors of the walls with matching decor, everything about the night was perfect. 

Having lived in the NYC area for the past 10 years, we didn't think we could be impressed with a venue back home in Idaho. However, the Chateau far exceeded our expectations and is the BEST place in the state for an event. The place honestly looks like a European mansion. From the marble floors to the matching artwork to the doors and lighting, the place will make you feel like you are transported to Paris for the night. The Chateau gave us beautiful pictures and memories for our special occasion.

Aside from the venue space, we also came back on a separate night to the restaurant and ordered numerous items with truffle on the menu. The quality of the food,  the fresh ingredients and the ambience of the place were all impeccable. The brie dish was also AMAZING and something I crave all the time. 

Thank you to everyone at the Chateau for making our engagement party a memorable night that we will cherish forever. We look forward to coming back on future trips to Idaho!
I wanted to like this place but the food wasn't good. My husband's burger was well done even though he asked for medium and my French dip was very salty with very little cheese. I do not recommend!

So, my girlfriend and I have been here twice so far. The first time was when they had the food trucks. I must say that's the best night to go there. We tried something off of each truck, and it was amazing. I believe they call it Brews n Bites.

The second time was yesterday. Both times it was busy and the server was with us in about ten minutes. Both times they were courteous and earned respectable tips. The food served by the actual Sail wasn't the best to be honest. The Cuban Nachos we got were lukewarm, soggy and the chips were very generic. The Cuban Sandwich I got and the burger my girlfriend got were OK, but I've had better. Where The Sail really shines is their drink menu. My girlfriend had a drink called The Sail Phone. I can't remember what I had but it was amazing too. Lastly, the view is amazing. It was basically the best view I'd ever had of the water around Tampa.

My final rating is a 4/5. The only drawback is the actual food The Sail serves. I recommend going for the drinks, but I wouldn't recommend eating there unless it's on a Brews n Bites night. Plus, again, the view and atmosphere is amazing.

Loved the sushi here! It was fresh and delicious and very reasonably priced. We tried every roll here except for the California roll and garlic roll. Great atmosphere and the wait staff were very attentive and food came out in a reasonable amount of time even though they were quite busy.

Our favorite place for charbroiled oysters.  Hands down the best.  This time the service was slow and she had to be asked three times for drinks and water.  We came for the oysters and will continue to visit every chance we get.  Kudos for the guys at the grill, always love chatting with them.

Really hungover on this fine Sunday late morning/early afternoon and looking for something besides my typical greasy Mexican breakfast (my go-to). Hopped on Yelp and typed in "ramen". Now, Lee House does not have Ramen but they have some amazing Pho. We ordered online (through Yelp) and for $27 we were well on our way to receiving Pho Tai, Kung Pao Chicken, and Pho Dec Biet (I'm butchering this). They do not deliver to my area, even though it's Brandon, but we saved on the $3 delivery fee and got some fresh air! Walked in about half an hour after ordering and the woman was very confused and said they did not have any outstanding takeout orders. After a few minutes, we were able to clear this up that we had ordered online. About 10 minutes later, we were on our way with a ton of hot spicy food! I like that you can order the Kung Pao to your spiciness specifications - we went with Medium just to try it out. The to go Pho was packaged in three separate containers. One for the broth, one for the meat/noodles/onions, and one for the bean shoots and other fixings. The Kung Pao was a rather large portion that also came with white rice. For $27 we have several meal's worth of food, which is great. With so many great options in our area, we really need to get out and explore more and I'm very glad that Lee House made the cut! They have Thai, Chinese, and Vietnamese options so there is something for everyone. Looking forward to trying some dim sum next time!
Rude cashier, gave me the wrong doughnuts (I only asked for 2), told me a drink was discontinued that actually wasn't and this was after waiting 10 minutes while he sat there playing on his phone

I am fairly new to Tucson and was very nervous about getting overcharged on a windshield replacement for my Toyota Camry.  I'm so thankful to have come across Wisecrack Auto Glass.  His quoted price was way more affordable than Safelite and I was able to get an appointment for the next day.  He was on time, speedy, and very professional.  I highly recommend going with Wisecrack Auto Glass.

We were actually just walking by when the absolutely wonderful manager Robby, invited us in. At first it was because of his warm and welcoming friendly personality that we decided to stop in. The ambience and decor give the establishment a sleek modern vibe. However it fits in wonderfully with the New Orleans culture. We had a few craft cocktails that were absolutely divine. And it it is definitely a place we will visit again in the future.
Food was basic at best!! Atmosphere is awful! One big room where everyone sits! Caters to older crowd for sure!

Favorite restaurant of all time (and best brunch.) Everything I've had here has been delicious-- and I've probably tried everything in the menu at this point. The tempeh tacos are highly recommended. V Street is a great treat for any occasion, but when I'm feeling really fancy, I like to hit up it's fancy counterpart, "Vedge."

Amazing!!! Top 5 BBQ joints anywhere...ribs, brisket, sausage, turkey are all to die for but the sauces are extraordinary! From the white sauce to the Texas got to the coffee bbq.. I couldn't get enough to compliment my Meat Daddy plate!  Last but not least is the corn pudding and baked beans!

Overpriced, but good. Have tried twice now and both times have been delicious and consistent. 

The brisket is super satisfying, being strips instead of ripped to shreds and swimming in sauce. 

The fried pickles are fried spears, not chips, so you get more bang for your buck with this item. The batter on them is so light and flavorful; they can definitely stand on their own without the dipping sauce. 

The best thing, hands down, is the banana cream pie milkshake. Heaven in a cup. 

If the prices weren't such a ripoff ($18+ just for a brisket sandwich and milkshake), I'd go more often.
Fantastic food, great drinks, awesome wait/bar staff. Tried several mason jar drinks, all were great. Good choice for a place to grab some food and catch a game!

Excellent dim sum!!!  They are very generous with their food portions. The chive and shrimp dumplings was delicious.  The salt n pepper pork chop was really good.  Great place. Will be going again soon.

Best shopping center in all the area. People come here from all over.
There are about 150 stores! You can find here everything in most known brands: clothes, sports, toys, and make an eat-break. 
Very recommended for coming for a whole day.

We drive by this place and it's always got a bunch of cars.  Decided tonight to stop in for the first time for a Saturday dinner.  Sat at the bar.  Greeted promptly by Tanya.  Extensive menu of your typical bar food. Ordered the wings and fries.  Wings were the best I have ever had from any of the wing places.  Service was excellent. Tanya should have jumped over the bar and choked a customer who growled at her for messing up his order (I heard him order and she got it right) but instead she just smiled and apologized.  Then he ate his steak only to complain it was underdone AFTER he ate it.  Again Tanya was accommodating when the customer was clearly wrong.  She deserves a bonus for just putting up with the jerk.  Great food.  Great service.  What more could you want?
Great shop! Great latte! Great vibe! Nice baristas! Def coming back. Particularly like the patio out back. W large fans it wasn't too hot out there.

It is good to have your dependable middle of the road pizza available wherever you go. You know it is not great pizza, but it is good, familiar and fairly priced with convenient pick up and delivery options. Their steak&cheese is a whole other issue. It is edible. It is not good in my opinion. The steak tasted as if boiled in beef bouillon. The cheese must have been absorbed into the soggy bread. It was difficult to locate, enough said!  The ziti dish was surprisingly flavorful and good.

I made an appointment online and was surprised they were open on a Sunday. However... no where did they say that you can be seen for only certain things on a Sunday!  I wasted so much time, waiting for the appointment and getting there only for them to tell me I couldn't be seen. ( can't fit for contacts on a Sunday). Ummmm, that would have been nice to know before I wasted a Sunday!  The girl at the desk, not the Dr. Had no expression or wmotion and had nothing to say. Horrible customer service and needs to find a "work from home" job. Not working with the public that they let down.  Go to a reputable eye doctor, NOT lens crafters!

Bad!

I now understand why this place has 4.5 stars, which is far more than just about any Italian eatery. I picked up food to-go, and it still managed to be super hot & delicious! It was even packaged well with saran wrap so it didn't spill. The portions are huge, so I'm looking forward to having my other half for lunch tomorrow. The sauce is sweet and dark like I love! And they had brucioloni! A) That's hard to find and B) Gendusa's is the bomb! It's so tender, garlicy, and completely hit the spot. We lived in Kenner & moved about 15 minutes away & never knew this gem existed til we found it on Yelp. Wish we had known about it when we were even closer, but we'll be back. Open on Sunday til late, gelato & cappuccino, AND the food is amazing. Yes yes yes!!

Nada is a unique experience, in that it's the fanciest taco shop you'll ever encounter. Their margaritas are delish. While the food is good, the portion sizes are just sad. Very small, even for street tacos. And they're not cheap! Personally, I just don't like when the twist on classic cuisine is to completely change the flavors - why do you want your tacos to have Asian BBQ flavors? I could do without the sweetness in many of the dishes I've tried here as well. I just want really good classic tacos. I'd recommend Nada for the atmosphere and for cocktails.

Basically this food was god awful and I was hungover at the time. A piece of toast with butter would have tasted like a delicacy.

Ordered chicken fried rice, won ton soup, and vegetable egg rolls. The won ton soup was good. 

Worst chicken fried rice I've had in my life. I had about four bites just for the sustenance. It was literally only rice and chicken. And the chicken was scarce and scrappy. I've never had chicken fried rice that doesn't also include at least peas and carrots. But even still, the rice and chicken were disgusting. I asked for light oil. That request was ignored and in spite of that the dish still had no flavor. The vegetable rolls are about pinky-finger sized. They look and taste like the frozen food aisle variety.

Take out. The host, who I assume is Kerry, was extremely friendly and pleasant. Everything is a La Carte, so, I didn't get a salad and I was cool with that. Food was good, but the chef was heavy handed with salt. Pasta was cooked good. I'm happy, but I'm not happy. They didn't give me any bread to mop up the white clam sauce. I'm happy because I could do without bread. Regardless, unhappy with no bread given the price point. Most likely give them a shot again and see if there is an improvement.

Wow! So I stopped in here to get a snack! I ordered spin dip and jambalaya! I asked if they can put it in one box so it would be easier to eat while I'm getting my pedicure! So she went to the back to place the order, and I clearly heard the lady in the back talking mess yelling about putting stuff in one box the back! Saying who the hell want shit in one box, and a few other thing I  can't post on here! I wish I could give 0 stars!

I primarily love this place because Stephanie, the owner, is so awesome - such a kind person.  

Now, I should admit that bars and nightclubs are not my first choice for a good time.  On the other hand, I really love metal, alternative, etc type music, and sometimes, I wish to feel the music.  Not to mention, Surly Wench has Burlesque! Love!

Plus...amazing food and drinks, hence a fantastic time when out and about.
Great pizza. There's a charity pizza for Ben's Bells where they donate a portion of the price. Great vibe of the building. The entire Broadway Village shopping center is fun to explore.

I was very nervous about our recent move due to a bad moving experience 13 years ago, where the moving company damaged many pieces of our furniture.  However, I am happy to say that New Horizons exceeded all my expectations! From the initial contact with Andreas, who assured me his company would do an exceptional job, to Amal, who repeatedly reassured me up to the big day. On moving day, Eddie and his crew arrived on time and were polite (and funny!), respectful and careful of our furniture at both our homes, and took great care to make sure all our anxiety was alleviated. Even though we purchased extra insurance (because of our fears), the move went amazingly smooth, and I could not have asked for a better experience. I would HIGHLY recommend your company to anyone in the future. Thank you, New Horizons!

The best chargrilled oyster i had in nola. I tried several other famous places in french quarter also, they were good, but Drago is outstanding. The amount of butter and the texture of garlic and other seasoning were just so right. They also have more consistent oyster size, you would not get those super small baby size oysters, which you would get in other oyster bars.
Definitely recommend this place.

I applaud the effort to offer more options than the most basic halal carts around the city.  Unfortunately they don't fry the falafel per order so it's not as fresh as others I've tried.  That plus the lack of red onion in the salad 

The good:
The Lamb, probably about average for these carts
The chickpeas were in some kind of sauce-y mixture that was interesting.
Cucumbers for the salad (some carts don't have them)
Pickled veggies on top (pickles and red peppers)

The not-so-good:
The falafel is not fried fresh per order.
No red onion for the salad.

Great atmosphere! We were seated quickly and the service was fast and friendly. The menu was small but had a great selection of appetizers and entrees both vegetarian and non vegetarian. Creative and yummy dishes! The prices were very reasonable. Definitely a great spot to grab a drink with friends or go out to dinner.

Very good service. Minimal wait for the sushi rolls and they were very fresh. I will most definitely be coming back. The waitress was also friendly and considerate of us and our toddler. It was an overall pleasant experience.

Came here with my best friend to get two pedicures and it wasn't that impressive. We both decided to "upgrade" and get the deluxe pedi that came with a hot stone massage and it was not worth $40. The guy who did my pedicure definitely rushed through it and gave me the shortest massage and ran the hot stones up and down my leg for less than 30 seconds. He then at one point left me sitting in the chair while he went and started another pedicure across the room. The guy who did my friends pedicure cut one of her nails too short and actually cut her toe to where she was bleeding. I will for sure go elsewhere for my pedicures. The only plus to why this got 2 stars was the chairs were nice and massaged.

We got swolled up by a party that just kept growing. I was bumped and pushed several times where I was sitting. People from that party were standing everywhere and the manager wouldn't do anything about it. Petty sure the fire Marshall would not have been happy. Won't be back
Good poke, fresh ingredients, but extremely stingy fish portions. Really slow service for fast causal. Waited 15 minutes for my order even though the place was empty.
Love to always come here I get the falalfel and hummus and the chicken shrwarma wrap. Service is always great and friendly.

As someone that has studied in Europe and holds a degree in German I can say that the 'feel' of the event is pretty legit. It's perfectly designed for the upper echelon of good ol' Car-mel. And I say that not as a dig, but as a props for the event knowing their audience. This simply wouldn't have worked in another part of town. 

First of all the items sold (except for some local restaurants selling food items) are from Germany. Even the lebkuchen I purchased was imported. This also means that purchased goods will set you back a pretty penny. My mom had her eye on lace Christmas ornaments (she lived in Germany for years) but decided to restrain because compared to buying it in Germany was vastly more expensive! 

The decor on the vendor stalls and even the shed housing the zamboni where perfectly 'winter alpine chic'. Lots of picture options!

I will have to agree with other reviewers that there wasn't a wide variety of things to purchase, nor at a wide price point variety. BUT.... America is the land of variety and other countries simply aren't. You get a few options and that's it. And when it comes to a German Christmas... well, it's tradition all the way and that holds down variety. Sorry, America. You are lucky some of the lebkuchen was decorated in English.

This next paragraph is intended to be a total b!t$h fest about the wait times for everything from skating to local chocolates, but I have a bigger complaint for the next paragraph.

WHILE THIS LOOKS LIKE AN ADVENT FESTIVAL, IT SIMPLY ISN'T. IT SURE LOOKS LIKE IT BUT...

Advent festivals have a heck of a lot more singing, activities, bands, etc. And those things are alllll day long. Things the entire general public can enjoy together at no cost. 

Good first year effort though. Enjoyed the authentic items, photog moments and people watching. Little else captured my attention after I washed down my boot of gluhwein.

The soup was great! We were looking forward to a good meal. But 45 min after the soup came out (at lunch). Our sandwiches which looked so good in the menu came out. So disappointed! Fast food would have been better!!

They flame the orange twist on the butterscotch latte! Double espresso with tinker flats coffee. Lots of interesting drinks on the menu I'd like to come back and try. Homemade baked goods and a spacious comfortable chairs really was what sent this place over the top. 

I normally order the most unique thing on the menu, since there were ingredients in the latte I hadn't heard of, I went for it. I was nervous to try it, since I'm never a fan of butterscotch candies, but it's nothing like those. It's not too sweet, with tons of aroma, warming and seemed spiced. The baristas are kind and fun and it's hard to turn down a homemade croissant. (I had the chocolate croissant cold and it was delicious!)

I couldn't figure out the style of the place with of contemporary bright colored furniture and wooded walls. But so many coffee shops are cramped these days, so I stretched out on a bench with an outlet and I thoroughly enjoyed my time here.

We stopped here on our way home from chasing a movie. We found Healthy Garden in a small street mall. What a great surprice. Great food, big portions, fair prices, low salt and great flavor. The waitress was nice, we did wait approximately 30 for the food but is was totally worth it, we will definitely be back.

No service on our visit. My husband and I decided on Rosati's for lunch today. We sat down and after 10 minutes, the waitress had not stopped to say hello or take our order. She was at the table next to us 3 times in that 10 minutes. She was the only waitress on, but it was not yet busy. As evidenced by her having time to stand by the kitchen between helping 2 other tables.
We left - went elsewhere for lunch.
Not impressed.

This place is amazing. Everyone who works there is so friendly, and the food incredible. It has become my new go-to spot far more often than I'd like to admit. The curry is absolutely delicious, and their noodle dishes are always perfectly cooked. Everything tastes like the best kind of home made.
Update. The lease has been cancelled and they are closing December 15.  Get it while you can

Slider house is nothing special. I loved the veggie burger but everything else was simply okay. The burgers aren't very flavorful and the service is quite slow. Overall, it was a very vanilla experience. I meant to write a review sooner but I forgot about it. That's how much I enjoyed my meal there. Sorry, Slider House! I won't be returning.

Stopped in for lunch on a Monday. Not crowded. Sat no the 2nd floor, listened to some good music. Pulled pork sandwich with a side of onion rings and pork loin with Cole slaw and potato salad. All well cooked and delicious.

Just walking into this bakery was an experience. The smell was enough to convince me that we had made the right choice. We ate the mint brownie cannoli, which was phenomenal, and then had to take a few extra treats home for later.

Great location, Great service! Early check in with a smile with my advanced chosen room and digital key ready upon arrival! Typical high standard Hilton facility, with bar/restaurant, room service, pool with a beautiful lake setting in back. King sized bed in room with all expected amenities. they have a shuttle you can use to and from the local airports.

The food is good. It's a bit pricey. One thing I love about this place is the building. It's a very unique atmosphere and in the summer I love to sit outside on the top deck and look over Main Street. My only complaint is that every now and then the service is meh.

I went here for a bachlorette group and had a great time! Everyone is so friendly- we made friends at the bar while we waited for everyone to arrive and enjoyed some delicious drinks. This is a great casual dining spot with great portions and great food for a solid price point. I loved the colorful decor and coziness. Say yes to alligator cheesecake, shrimp etoufee, and boudin balls!

Finally, a really fantastic vegan/vegetarian restaurant in the Franklin/Cool Springs area! Several restaurants close by have maybe one vegetarian appetizer or entree, but when I go to Mysore Palace, I have many more options. The lunch buffet is fantastic with dishes clearly marked "vegan" and some are also "gluten-free." The food is consistently delicious and I should know since I go there at least once a week. Highly recommend this restaurant if you prefer vegetarian/vegan/gluten-free food!

Service was absolutely awful. Took 15 minutes to order our drinks and another 15 to get them(we only ordered water). Once she took our food orders she had to come back and ask multiple times what we ordered even though she wrote it down. 

Don't go. Not worth it.

Okay so I used to live in downtown Indianapolis with my brother and we LOVED this place. Hands down the best Thai food we ever had. Well unfortunately we both moved to bigger cities with better food but no Thai food matched up to Siam Square. We always raves about the Pad Thai...other places used to make it sweet and mild. This place was
Totally savory and when you asked for hot...it was too hot to handle but still every time we
Ordered it it was "Thai hot please!!" We would sit at home with stacks of napkins to wipe our runny noses. Water and milk to soothe our mouths it was too good. After 3 years i came back with my husband today because it was on our way home. I was so excited to have that same pad Thai I have been craving for years. 

The pad Thai turned sweet. When I asked for hot l got tres mild. I'm Indian and I absolutely love HOT AND SPICY but this was yuck.

My husband ordered his favorite, the drunken noodles, that is supposed to be a savory dish but that unfortunately was sweet and not
Hot either.

I don't know whether their chef changed
But I am still on the search of that pad Thai I had years ago. If the chef did leave can I find out where he went please?

My husband and I had a wonderful lunch at Little Greek it was my first time eating there the prices are reasonable and this is real Greek food not processed Greek food. 

One of the best things is that you can see the kitchen and the cooks cooking the food just like carrabbas.  

The service was really great and fast and the food came out good and hot.
The food is good or whatever, the staff just doesn't take direction well. They just make what they think you said

I love the pizza, especially the tomato pie. There is a huge selection of pizza by the slice. There is also sit down section and bar inside. The restaurant also has good home made tasting Italian dishes. A hidden treasure inside of a mall.
Have been here 4 times...each time service gets worse...food is fine but will think again about coming back due to poor service.
A different kind of place to eat. Order the bread howl of your choice and fill it up with whatever you want. Awesome idea, alright food. Carb loading at its best.

Really like the food here, be warned that there may be a line out the door if you show up between 12-1, but it goes fast. I've had burnt ends, brisket, pulled pork sandwich, sides, and beer. No complaints in 3 visits and I really like the guys serving the food.

Was craving chicken Saturday night and thought what better place to go. Downtown was very busy due to nice weather and the big 10 championship. The wait was quite long (2 1/2 hours I believe) but since I was solo I was able to get at seat at the bar, which I would recommend if there's just a couple of you. I was waited on by a very nice bartender named Robin I believe. I basically left my dinner and drinks up to her as who should know best what's good. I had a couple beers and she recommended the chicken sandwich with a side of garlic mac and cheese. Excellent choice by her. She was like a machine behind the bar making drinks and still taking the time to make sure I was taken care of. Sometimes places become so popular that the employees forgot why they are there, become rude and what not. But with people like Robin there I'll definitely return.

This is our go-to take out place for Chinese when neither of us feels like cooking.  We always do take-out and the order is ready for pickup in 15 minutes.  Accuracy is great, the food is good.  We've been eating from here for several years now with no issues.    I wish they would automate just a bit so that I could place my order on line and easily pay with a credit card when I place my order.  I've paid over the phone with my credit card before and while it takes a little longer its usually be ok.  Tonight I was told they no longer offer that service.

If I could give it 0 stars I would.  Just had an extremely disappointing meal at Bonefish Grill in Exton.  Service was non-existent and I had to physically go up to the hostess stand twice to request missing items that we'd ordered.  

The restaurant was 75% full on a Sunday night at 5:30 PM and grossly understaffed.  My king crab legs (the special of the night at $45) arrived ice cold.  My asparagus was extremely overdone and the potatoes were soggy.  The ice cold "butter" that accompanied my crab was 80% water and did not taste anything close to seasoned drawn butter.  

My wife's lobster tail was delivered without any butter whatsoever.  We asked the hostess for butter and she summoned our waiter - who we hadn't seen in over 30 minutes - to deliver tea light butter warmers with ice cold liquid butter.  To top all of this off the bill came - the wrong bill including bar drinks and entrees we did not order.  

Recap: Non-existent service & bad food.  

Never again!

Food is amazing -- service is awesome and it's truly a friendly, neighborhood atmosphere.  Love that we moved to Cherry Hill and found our new pizza place!   (as well as sandwiches, yummy pasta dishes and catering!!)

Every time I come here I am dissapointed. This will be my last time giving them another try...
This is the worst chain Restraunt in the area...The portions are always SMALL and expensive. Everything tastes bland and previously frozen.. nothing I have ever gotten at Applebee's has ever been good .... 
don't waste your money here !!! You will not be satisfied .

This was a tough one. A LOT of good things, and one major fault, which was quality of food related.
Let's start with the positives. Service was very professional, attentive and quick (possibly too quick, as I feel a fine dining establishment should be a bit slower overall, compared to a regular restaurant). We had a special occasion, and everyone, from the hostess, to the server, to the manager acknowledged it- which was very nice. The mixed drinks were very nice. The biscuits with honey butter were excellent. The scallops were good, not great, and the mac and cheese was very nice. The wedge salad, was actually very impressive, with a very rich, and flavorful russian dressing. The key lime pie was also very good, with strong flavor and a beautiful message written, for our special occasion. We also liked the ambience and decor. Beautiful old building, nice decorations, music was good, and we sat in a nice booth. 
Now for the bad. At a steak house, you'd think the steak would be a highlight, but it unfortunately it wasn't. It was decent at best, but not great, as one would expect. I'm not a big steak guy, but I've had better filets at both Capital Grille, as well as Flemings, which I was not expecting. Mine was cooked very well, with a beautiful char crisp exterior. But the quality of the meat wasn't up to par, in my opinion. The meat did that weird thing where when you cut it, it sort of flattens and separates a bit, with it still being sorta still together. I have no idea what it is called, but it wasn't good. The better filets that I've had in the past cut like butter, and the meat stayed nice and firm, and together, as you cut it.  The flavor of the meat was nice, but my prior experiences with nice filets, have been better. 
It's a shame, as pretty much everything else was very nice, and the service was excellent. It feels very nice as a customer, for all the staff members to acknowledge a big event in one's life, so that was nice. My partner was also very impressed, and happy, which was nice. Just felt it fell short, on the steak, and that was a major disappointment for what was supposed to be one of the top steakhouses in Philly.

We stopped in here today for lunch, because my daughter wanted pizza. They have a kid's menu that's the expected stuff (pasta, mac and cheese, burger, etc) Her kid's cheese pizza was $7, and it was a really big pizza. It would have been to much for me as an adult, so a pretty good deal. I got a cup of French onion soup, my husband got the clam chowder special. Mine was really good, not to much cheese like some places. We also split the grilled cheese which had bacon on it and  came with fries. It came on thick Texas toast type bread, not flat bread like the menu says, but I liked it that way. All in all, a very solid decently priced lunch in Olde City. I'd definitely go again.

This is my new favorite brunch spot. Bottomless mimosas and a great buffet. BUT - If you order off the menu, get the chicken and Sopapillas. It's their version of chicken and waffles and it is the most fresh, perfectly seasoned chicken ever. And the portion is massive. Come hungry and leave happy. It also helps that we had an amazing server who happens to be new here. Her name is Holly and I hope she stays! Ask for her. She'll make sure you're taken care of and KUDOS to the chef! A++++

I refuse to give his Denny's any stars but to post this have have to give them at least one however they don't deserve any they are so rude. It took them 15 mins to sit me when I was the only one waiting to be seated, they did not welcome me in fact I had to ask them to be helped and when I was seated it took another 15 mins for a server to come and take my order when everyone else was already eating it's not like they had other customers in front of me. Also almost every table was dirty from the time I got there to the time I left. Maybe they where understaffed but that doesn't give them a right to be rude just because I asked to be helped. No stars

I stopped in here on the way home to pick up a few things, and compared to some other Acme stores I've gone to, the layout is pretty easy to navigate, and things are easy to find. I was only going for a few items, so it was a pretty quick trip.

My wife loves the fried chicken at Acme, and they often run some pretty great promotions on seafood, especially on their canned crab meat. We've bought that multiple times, and it's quality stuff.
One of my favorite pizza spots in Indianapolis. Great selections, tons of toppings. My favorite is the Tchoupitoulas (add Cajun chicken).
Good food.  Clean.  Fresh bakery items available.  Staff is always very nice. Sundays around noon are super busy.

Food tastes great, until 8 hours later when the food poisoning sets in, your gut is in knots, you are puking, and miss your sister in laws wedding rehearsal dinner. Both myself and another in our party ordered the brisket taco and we've been sick since. Try at your own peril.

I'm sorry I just have to get this off my chest while I'm sitting here eating a chicken wing platter with mac and cheese and collard greens. This place is absolutely delicious. I've eaten here several times and have yet to be disappointed. Please please please if you live close or just want some great soul food please come to Ms. Sweeteas!!!

I finally decided to purchase the Groupon  because I love Diners Drive-In and Dives. I was sadly mistaken in making this purchase. I ordered the trash can nachos. They tasted so bland and have this weird sweet sauce mixed in with the cheese. The nachos looked so unappetizing and the barbecue wings also very bland and had zero seasoning. The chicken alfredo was subpar. I ended up spending an additional $20 on top of what I had already purchased for the Groupon. So overall I would not return to this restaurant. The waiter was definitely not attentive I had to ask twice for a refill on my drink. The diner is located in a very smoky Casino. I would not recommend this restaurant.

Guess I should have checked Yelp before I signed up for Comcast.  Evidently my experience with them is not unique...  I had a phone and internet service plan with them for several years, and they were continually adding absurd "special fee" charges out of the blue.  I would call them up, and they would eventually agree to remove the charge, but then the same charge would pop up again on the next month's bill.  The vast majority of these charges were for amounts under $20, but it's the principle of the thing.  Also, my sense of all of this is that they figured people would get tired of spending an hour on the phone each month trying to recover $10-$20 and so would eventually give up and let them pocket the money, which amounts to quite a lot when you consider the number of Comcast customers out there. 

To make things worse, at a certain point, my phone started developing really bad static and would continually drop calls.  I was never able to talk for more than about ten minutes without the call abruptly cutting off, which basically meant that I could not use the phone to make any business calls.  This went on for nearly six months.  I'd call up Comcast technical support every week or two - sometime several times a week - to try to resolve the problem, but they clearly had no clue what to do.  They also sent technicians out to my home three separate times.  Each time I received a bill for over $100, and two of the technicians actually made the situation worse; the third did nothing.  I eventually did what I should have done years ago: switched to a different provider.  The new company is not perfect, but at least my phone works.

First time visitor here for brunch with my husband.  Wow, the food here has such great, complex flavor that you do not miss meat or dairy (if you eat those)!  For brunch, we shared the Za'atar Fries, West Indies Scramble, and Pho French Dip and loved all 3. We have a pretty low tolerance for spice level and found the Scramble and French Dip both a bit spicy.  Our server was super friendly and welcoming.  It was not too crowded or loud for 11am on a Sunday.

I like the atmosphere but that is about it. The service was horrible and the food was a-okay. Our group of 6 came on a Tuesday night around 5pm and at first the service was great but shortly after things started to go downhill. They forgot our beverages and when it came time to get our food my pastitsio was burnt~! it was not that great either. $14 for burnt pasta. bleh! The waiter even set the plate down on top of my friends flowers and got the flower petals in the food. Not sure why this is rated so high in terms of food. You should try the Greek Place by the foothills mall! 5 stars for that place reviewed separately.
I love this place! They massage you while your nails dry. It is a truly relaxing experience. Very clean and attentive too!

I used to go to their Malvern location 2 years ago and was thrilled to stumble upon Dixie Picnic in Center City! Just as good as I remember and they have online ordering. So excited to add this to my lunch rotation!
Amazing food. I had the turnip greens, mac and cheese, and fried catfish. Everything was wonderful. The best part of the meal was the chocolate chess pie with meringue, best pie I ever ate.

A surprise for my New Orlean visit. It was not the season for crawfish so I didn't got to have it in french quarter restaurants. But luckily my boyfriend found this place and we gave it a try. It was just so good. We got  3 pounds and when back to eat at the hotel with nice movies. Very nice as late night snack.

They need to cut the tendon out of the chicken tenderloins they use.Dat shit ain't edible yo! Ordered a salad with three chicken tenders on It and bit into the gristley tendon on every one. Mac and cheese game could be improved. Other than that the food was good.

Dip in here every time I'm in Reno. Great industrial/hipster venue with even better beer. They always have quality beer on tap and their taps appear to run into the cooler on short lines, so I've never had a skunky beer here(can't be said at a lot of places). They always seem to have a real German beer on tap too. So you know they always have something worth while.
This place has a lovely atmosphere.  We went for the Saturday brunch.  Had the Croque Madame, a muffin, mimosa, and Bloody Mary.  All of it was mouthwatering delicious.  Highly recommended.
Great food, always a great beer selection and hot or miss service. If you are okay with semi-abusive service, hipster clientele and good bar eats, this place is a gem.

I really wish I could have had a positive experience with this place, as I am always searching for a really good pizza delivery option in this city. Several problems:

1) They messed up my order. I ordered an "Italian sausage" specialty pizza, which is supposed to have: "pizza sauce, mozzarella cheese, Italian sausage, white onions, fresh mushrooms & green peppers". I got a sausage and pepperoni pizza without any of the veggies. C'mon. 
2) You call this thin crust? No. This isn't thin crust. It's just regular hand-tossed pizza dough stretched out. A real thin crust pizza shouldn't be this doughy. I would have expected better from a Chicagoland small pizza chain. 
3) Sauce. There was barely any on the pizza. Might as well have forgotten it entirely. 
4) Sausage: Small little sausage balls that look and taste like what you get on a $3 frozen pizza at the grocery store
5) Delivery service itself: I paid online with my card, and never got an opportunity to add a tip when I paid online. I was hoping I could add a tip on my receipt when my driver got to my building (like any standard restaurant receipt procedure). But, apparently, the order already went through and I wasn't able to add any tip. Making me feel guilty about not tipping a driver isn't the best way to start my pizza eating experience.

One positive: The cheese. Ample and delicious. But it won't be enough for me to want to order from here again.

Absolutely fantastic! We went last night for my birthday, we had reservations and were seated within 5 minutes. Our waitress was in training but very attentive. We did the 4 course experience with the wine flight (must try). 

Appetizer - we had the Wisconsin cheese. Bread selection was eh-OK. We had some cheese leftover so they brought us more bread to finish it up :) My husband loved his salad, i opted for a fruit plate. Main course...spot on. They have plenty of choices to pick from. Dessert - flaming turtle. HIGHLY recommend. And then to top it off they gave us each a free glass of champagne for my birthday! 

Absolutely couldn't be happier. It was a Wednesday night and it took us exactly 2 hours from seated to out the door. So I'm guessing on a busy Friday/Saturday night, you'll need 2.5hrs easy for the 4 courses. Must try if you have a special occasion.

We had the garlic double burger for $4 and the cajun double burger also $4. They both came with skinny fries. I added cheese to mine for 49 cents. OMG! The entire meal was fantastic. It's the best burger I have had in a VERY long time. And I am not even kidding. So, the food is 5 stars. 

When we walked in it was busy. 2 waitresses for the entire place and they were overwhelmed. Ours was polite and did a nice job. 

The restaurant was a bit of a disaster. Napkins and trash on the floor in the wait station. 2 manager looking men were helping. One at the register and one was walking around. Neither one picking up the trash. When it's 'your' store you should care about it's appearance. Sure, the wait staff should have picked it up as well but given they were both running around like crazy the management should have stopped and helped them. 

The one odd thing is you have table service but then you have to pay at the cash register on the way out. Tipping is lost in this process. 

I will be back. This was one of many favorite meals in Dunedin/Clearwater. The cooks did a darn fine job with everything. 

3 stars for the restaurant due to the mess on the floor. Otherwise it was fairly clean. Waitress' always cleaned off the tables as quickly as they could.

Great service and atmosphere! The location is spectacular and the employees are very kind. The Wi-Fi is strong on the inside. The only problem for me was that the Wi-Fi wasn't very strong outside. Other than that, perfect.
Went on a Sunday afternoon for a ladies lunch. We all enjoyed our meals and they graciously cut a cake we brought.  From the salads to the pasta every palate was happy.

This is a perfect place to go off of South Street for a nice experience to celebrate the holidays.  We came here for the weekend lunch and ordered the prix-fixe.  I had the escargot, joues de porc a la bourguignoone, and gateau opera.  We also ordered the Peggy potatoes on the side, which is a family recipe. It was a perfect meal to celebrate the holidays and everything was fresh and flavorful.  We had one of the last reservations for lunch and never felt rushed through our meal.  The waiters were very attentive and always made sure our glass was full. I would definitely want to return to try other items on the menu.
Great sushis, fast delivery (ordered through Yelp while visiting new Orleans) would recommend !

Authentic Indian food in malvern area . I liked the Kerala porotta /appam and chicken curry here . Kulfi was also pretty good . Try having South Indian dishes in Manam when you visit. I feel the South Indian dishes are better here.

A bit disappointing.  We did not have a reservation but "Derek" fit us in early.  We arrived after a long day of shopping early and still had to wait at the bar.  Our seat was in the way back and our waiter was a charming: "Tomas" .  The appetizer was an awesome calamari.  Amazing.  Then soup and the dinner which I ordered was lovely, however, my husband and friend ordered "Linguini with clam sauce" .  That was disappointing.  It was a fettuccini instead of linguini and there was shallots!  Lots of shallots.  Unfortunately for the madre de we know the difference.  Derek expressed that it was a regional differential.  I don't agree.  Fettuccini is NOT Linguini in any region.  I feel "Derek" got very loud and disrespectful to people who know Italian food well.  It was not a very kind way to handle possible future regulars, so I'm feeling we won't be going back. 

As an edit to this review.  Two out of three of our party became very sick last night after our visit to this restaurant.  I think the calamari was not cooked enough.  One of us is still very sick today.  I would never recommend this restaurant, certainly not as an Italian restaurant.  The dimly lit restaurant hides undercooked food and the management is very rude.  After $150 meal for three people I don't expect to be treated so disrespectfully or be so sick.

Bowling only: we bowled in the vip section which is more money. You would expect some ounce of better service. Our lane broke. We had to go up to the desk 4 times. Don't press the service button on the consol to get help that does nothing. We wait for 25 min for someone to fix it (we had the lane for 1 hr). Finally fix it and offer us 5 min back. Spent over 150 bucks to go bowling. Awesome
Supreme Kreme is a great new local thai ice cream spot. I love it, its so freaking cold though. Kinda pricey, me and my fiancee could've shared a bowl since it was nice size.

0h may gawd real amazing flavors SO GREAT! I had gumbo with half and half shrimp and crawfish. The portion is perfect but the flavors made want a second bowl! Their nosh apps we had the Crawfish hushpuppies were also amazing and the flavors really are top notch. They offer a nice selection of "Liquid Courage" and on tap local and Louisiana beer. Absolutely great for lunch or dinner open 11am -10pm Fun staff too

Me and a buddy of mine stopped in this past Friday night. Ate in the back bar room with the huge pergola thing. (See pic) Service was good by a friendly and knowledgeable frauline. We ordered the Butcher's Feast for four. This came with every sausage on the menu, a nice sized pork shank, smoked pork chop, two slabs of bacon, kraut (with decadent hunks of braised pork) and potato dumplings. (You can skip these... I think they are like putting a spring of parsley on a plate.) everything was delicious and it truly feeds four big eaters. (We had to pack up half of it and bring it home.) this is a great value on the menu at $75. Had a couple drafts from the beer menu. Overall great. The front bar area is a little more hip and there was a live band with younger 20-30 y/o hipster types. The back bar area was a few families and a number of couples on dates in a more quiet setting. Very casual, love the food here and the service is quite good. Can't wait to come back and have a few more things on the menu. The only downside was we were talking into trying dessert and it was pretty meh. I'd skip it and stick to the charcuterie and meats which must be their specialty.

I had a very positive experience at Tarpon Animal Hospital when I brought my dog, Lola, in for suspected ear infection.  The reception was welcoming, and the animal care techs and the veterinarian were all very friendly, comfortable, and confident while examining Lola to make a diagnosis.  They then demonstrated to me the method for cleansing her ears and instilling the antimicrobial ear drops.  I was very favorably impressed with all the staff.

We grabbed some bagels here on the way to the outlets.  The bagels were tasty, we had a Swiss melt with olive cream cheese, a scooped bagel with chicken salad and a jalapeño with chive cream cheese. All were great.

Only reason I don't want to give 5 stars was based on the smell of the inside of the store. We didn't eat there so it wasn't an issue, but a really weird smell.

Great hotel. Stayed here one night and the room was clean, check in polite and easy, the handicapped accessible room I required for my mother was perfect, and the complimentary breakfast was delicious. We will definitely been staying here again!
Great service. Was in and out in 10 min. Free coffee is a nice touch even if no time to drink it!

A delicious French restaurant set in a row home in South

I went with three other people and we shared three of the first or second plates and then we each ordered a main course. The first and second plates range between 15 to $20 and then the main courses are between 20th and $30 a person excluding the beef.

For starters, we ordered the poached Lobster, the foie gras on fish, the escargot, and the beef tartare. All the dishes are pretty good, but the escargot was particularly delicious and creamy. We even asked for more bread to soak up the sauce with.

For the main course, I ordered the seared duck breast which came over a bed of risotto. The duck breast was cooked to Perfection and melted in your mouth.

Leslie and for dessert, we shared the chocolate souffle and the Apple Brandy creme brulee. The chocolate souffle came with some sort of pour-over sauce, it was delicious creamy and chocolatey. The Apple Brandy creme brulee was unique in that it wasn't overly sweet with the caramelized sugar on top. The Brandy Apple flavor was refreshing with little bits of Apple on top

Actually I'm not a fan at all. Last time I was there they overcharged me for a small kaiser roll seeded onion roll with very small steak and fried onions, very disappointing. The most disappointing thing is that people rave about Donkeys but I'm not a fan at all. I've had better. They smell pretty good though but they're not all that for the price that they charge

I know this place doesn't need my help but they deserve a great review. We had a wonderful experience at the Parc. The bread basket is AWESOME -- baguette, sourdough, and cranberry-raisin all were outstanding. My tuna carpaccio was killer. Daughter's half-chicken was generous and juicy. Bouillabaisse, pasta bolognese, deviled eggs, chocolate pot de creme -- not a single miss. Loved my Romarin cocktail too (elderflower, fennel, grapefruit) -- delicious!

An inadvertent fire alarm was handled well too! Kudos to the Parc!

PS for fan's of Starr's bistro food, I heartily recommend his Le Diplomate in DC!

We came before Garth Brooks and left with food poisoning! Good news first: there was a wide variety of options on the drink menu. The Blueberry Smash was delicious! Sadly, there's a lot of bad news: there was a lot of food on the floor under our table. The place just didn't look clean. My husband and I split several appetizers with friends and he and I split the Meats pizza. We didn't finish it as it didn't taste very good and was possibly undercooked. I ordered the Chop Chop salad which came out with looking like a bagged salad - very few ingredients and brown lettuce. Six hours later (after the concert, thankfully) my husband and I were violently ill and up all night gettIng sick. Our friends did not get sick and what was the one thing we had that they didn't eat? The Meats pizza. My advice? Skip this spot! It's just gross.

We went here for lunch, about 1 hour after they opened. We got a dozen of oysters for 14.99 which was very good. I also had baby lobster linguine. It's kinda butter-y.., not many lobster, taste ok tho. My boyfriend ordered clam strips, and 20 minutes later, the waitress said there was no clam strips yet! My boyfriend was upset cuz what he came here for, beside the oysters. He ended up have calamari, he said it was just ok.

I first went with a Groupon and became a client. Sarah is very knowledgeable and listens to what you want. The salon is easily located off of Ridge rd, and comfortable atmosphere. Very happy to have found a good hair stylist.

I love S&S Taco. They are a Ruskin staple serving good quality, consistent, Ameri-Mex. The shop is clean & casual, with a couple tables as most folks order take out. I usually order a Wet Burrito with jalapeños and a sweet tea, extra salsa. It's a mainstay for us true locals. If you and your family want taco night and you don't have time, this is the closest thing in town to what you would serve.

This is a beautiful place.  The menu is a bit limited but I think most people will find something they like given that it is latin/mexican and everyone likes guac and chips and tacos!  The margaritas are surprisingly good and strong.  I'm not saying I need a super strong margarita but I have found that so many places just load up on mixer and it gives me a headache.  These margaritas had just the right about of delicious tequila.  i will definitely be returning!

Great inaugural Christkindlmarkt in Carmel with food, crafts from Germany, live music, skating rink, etc. Parking is exceedingly easy, free, and very close to the market (or markt).

People love it, as you can tell from many reviewers bitching about too many people. If the event sucked and no one were there, people would bitch. If the event is great and there are too many people there, people bitch.

If only event organizers were skilled enough to thread the needle and create the Goldilocks event that doesn't suck but is not great enough to attract too many people so that people who go to this hypothetical mediocre event would not feel like too many other people are there and can still have the large personal spaces that their central Indiana townies are used to. One can only dream the impossible dream.

No, it's not as large as Christkindlmarkts and Christmas markets in much bigger cities like Chicago and Toronto. But metro Chicago has 5x the population of metro Indy and metro Toronto has 3x so you're comparing apples and watermelons. Having been to those larger ones, this one is still very much worth checking out and is the best one in all of Indiana.

Now this is a Philly Cheesesteak. I haven't had Gino's or Pat's and I don't think I need to. John's is just too damn good to pass up the next time in Philly. So glad I listened to the rec from my old boss because I might've passed this place up based on looks alone. But it's got that old drive-in kind of vibe and when you see the line and how packed it is on the inside you won't regret it. 

The mushroom cheesesteak was amazing. Perfect beef with sharp provolone drips with deliciousness. And I love the over-the-top amount of sesame seeds pressed into the roll. When they toast the roll the sesame seeds get perfect and nutty providing little pops of flavor for the crispy bread all working to compliment the meat and cheese. And let's not forget the namesake roast pork. You can skip the steak line and get roast pork or meatball sandwiches in a separate line so listen up when they yell out. The roast pork was flavorful and green delicious. The broth that sogs up the sando is flavorful despite being pale in color. It was so much better than DiNic's in the Reading Terminal which was mostly bland, forcing you do add more and more horseradish and peppers. Here at John's the horseradish and peppers and pickles serve as welcome acidic accoutrement rather than being emergency flavor backups. Definitely hit this spot with the requisite respect and confidence and you'll be headed to flavor town in no time.

Admittedly, we don't indulge in Indian cuisine as often as we should, however, our experience at IndeBlue was so impressive that we have added this restaurant to our ever-growing rotation. 

My Love and I visited along with another couple on a crisp Saturday evening. The restaurant wasn't busy when we arrived, however within 20 minutes of our arrival, every table was accounted for. We are all adventurous eaters and opted for the Tasting Menu. The only stipulation when choosing this option is that your entire table must be on board. You choose two beginnings per table, one tandoori small plate per table, two entrees per table, and the dessert tasting (which includes three items). We opted to let the chef recommend our selections while we sat back and anticipated the culinary fun to come.

The amount of food we received was incredible. We were stuffed after the appetizers! The Stuffed Long Hot Peppers and the Crispy Cauliflower were a hit at our table. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was equally as tasty, and the Chicken Tikka Masala was excellent. There is nothing worse than dry chicken, and this dish was moist and flavorful. Everything we tried was well-balanced and satisfying. The Naan, Lasooni, Provencal, and Garhwali were out of this world and I could have eaten the entire damn basket myself. I love that they presented us with vegan, vegetarian, and non-vegetarian selections. We literally "tasted the rainbow" of their menu!  

IndeBlue receives an extra star from me for having such kind servers. And the fact that I had lunch for the next two made me feel like breakdancing.

Great BYOB option in Collingswood - give it a whirl!

We have traveled all over the country and are SO lucky to live next to this Mexican restaurant because they are hands down the best we have had yet (I'm not kidding, we try a new Mexican place every time we leave St Louis). Best Margs, the chips and salsa (and cheese dip) is great. Don't be afraid to try anything on the menu bc it is ALL great. We try not to eat out much but we come here almost once a week bc everything is priced great and very fresh and healthy. Homemade salsa, they always have great specials ($1 tacos, free chicken or beef nachos with any marg pitcher, depending on the night) and the service is great. Leo is always friendly and takes care of us. Very friendly environment and you never wait long for your food. This place is the best!

Wife and I went here for lunch and had an overall great experience. We started sitting outside and with a fried calamari. Wish we had a bigger portion but was still tasty. My wife had sushi and she said it was fantastic. I had the cheddar burger with seasoned fries. Burger was very juicy and flavorful. Only thing we would want different is a faster pace with our meals being cooked. Place was not busy so if you have time and want flavorful food, this is your place. Worth every penny.

One of the best Indian restaurants I've ever dined at, excellent service and food was delicious! I had the moilee which had jumbo shrimp and lump crab meat in a coconut and mustard curry, soooo good. If you are a novice to Indian food you should definitely go here to try it.

These donuts are national treasure caliber. Coffee and cream was a perfectly fried and unsweetened raised dough, rich cream filling, and deliciously sweet coffee frosting. Hard to imagine a better donut has ever been made.

So. Ok like but. The cheese cake was good but cold. Maybe suppose to be? And the Jambalaya was cold ? Not suppose to be!. Snails special in cheese yet weird & Luke warm saved the day.. a 2 star.. Get over this place hippie wanna whatever's! Jerry dead !

We tried three tours in New Orleans recently. Melissa Vo0doo tour quite good. She's very knowledgable. Moved along well. These tours aren't really that much walking. We stood is same spot for quite a while say 20 minutes at least a spot. Kayla, Culinary Tour also well worth it. Slightly more walking. Kayla knows her stuff and she's very nice. Both were good ways to learn about the French Quarter. Ghost tour with Mikko, he knows a lot as well. All tours pretty much started on time.

I've been coming Edson's for over 2 years now and believe me it's the best barber shop in Tampa. Edson's shop has that classic barbershop feel with a mix of old school bullfighting and Frank Sinatra pictures with Real Madrid posters throughout his shop( Hala Madrid!). Before I went to Edson I got a boring ceasar fade but I trusted Edson and he's groomed my hair to a perfect combover fade that I couldn't be happier with. I always leave Edson's with a smile on my face after a precise haircut full of laughs. You won't regret coming to Edson's barbershop!
Bar has been up tempo my last few trips and some of what they brought back are old favorites like the fajitas.  Presentation much improved... give it another try if you haven't been in recently

Amazing atmosphere with an extra proactive staff! I will be eating at here again! Very modern local restaurant with an easy menu. This is a family friendly location with local specials served fresh. I would vote this a most dependable eatery in the Nashville area if it was my choice!
Jen was an amazing server!! Food was great and cocktails are great!! The Brussel sprouts were really good, it's the perfect place for snacks and drinks!

Customer service is distasteful!  Food is oily, instant heart attack.  Basically, junk Chinese food with premium price, to go along with insincere, disrespectful, distasteful service!

Located in a grungy neighborhood!  Staff cares more about making money than providing good service or quality Thai food.

Don't waste your money!
This is my new favorite restaurant ANYWHERE. The food is amazing, the service is fantastic and the prices had me sold. Definitely try the pizzas!

No I didn't take pictures of my food. I just ate it. These were the best fish tacos I have ever had anywhere. I've had a lot of fish tacos. If they recommend the Mojo fries (pronounced moho) listen to them. These people know their way around avocado, cheese, and fish. You will leave full. Very casual. You know, sticky menus and wood everything so if you don't like that you may be turned off. Island life feel. Reggae playlist. Friendly. Extremely fast service considering the quality of fish. Highest recommendation.
This is the only place my mom and I go for nails. Things are even better now that they take appointments. It took me a while to find a salon that I loved, but once I did, I won't go anywhere else.
Virginia is beautifully personable and a friendly owner! They do excellent work and in a timely matter. Affordable also!

The Pho here is subpar at best, the brisket is over-cooked, the thinly sliced beef wouldn't cook fully due to the broth not being hot enough. 

The customer service is alright, witnessed one of the workers completely ignore a lady asking to order something to go. 

The spring rolls were bland, just full of lettuce. 

The vermicelli smelled good from the tables around me, maybe that is the go to move here but might just stick to my usual place at 999 Pho.

We came on a busy Thursday and had a great time with our Chef Yoshi and our server Li! We had a somewhat rambunctious group and they were both entertaining and attentive to taking care of all of us. Li made sure our drinks were full and our orders correct even though we were a bit confusing! Yoshi cooked our steaks perfectly! If you want to have fun with an awesome dinner go to Kobe and ask for Li and Yoshi!!!

I visited NOLA with some of my friends who are natives. So far I've been to over 10 restaurants in New Orleans over the course of 4 days(Yes I know I'm a fatty) and this has been my favorite by far. The service was phenomenal! Our staff knew the ingredients, food preparation, and other food knowledge (like the history behind some of the dishes!) The food was absolutely mouthwatering and affordable as well. I ask our server what was the most popular and what they them self love the most.
