Then we ordered those (potatoes breaded fish and fried chicken) and two other things on the menu along with two appetizers. It was absolutely delicious! The New Orleans decor and vibe have the place ranked as the most authentic I have visited. I recommend it to anyone be they a native or a visitor!

Great venue if you want to be able to sit and listen to good music. There are tables in the back where you can hear the music great without having to stand in a crowd up front. This puts Bamboula's apart from most other places on Frenchman where there is minimal seating. Drinks are good and reasonably priced. Didn't try the food but it looked like they have a nice bar/snacking menu.

Atena was great but Trans Siberian Orchestra was horrible. They thought they were the Rolling Stones with running around, jumping etc.  omg, the thrashing of his head and hair was sooo annoying!  

They constantly would play one side of the stage then ask for clapping and cheering running to the opposite side for the same. 

A long 2 hrs of my life never to get back.

We visited from out of town and this was BY FAR the best meal we've had in a long time. When we first arrived we weren't sure what to think but the food was seriously INCREDIBLE! I'm new to a gluten free lifestyle and they were able to accommodate me very well. Our girls even tried (and loved) the calamari! My salmon was cooked well, and the crab and lobster cream sauce was the perfect addition to top it off. It's been a week since we ate there and we are STILL talking about it! Can't wait to visit again!

Saying the food here is delicious just doesn't do it justice. Every dish is like an adventure of flavours. The lamb and duck are both to die for. This is the type of restaurant I could see some people just not getting - a small, sparse interior and an equally spartan menu - five or six appetizers and the same number of entrées, dishes on the small side, but so rich and flavourful they seem just as filling as much bigger servings at other restaurants. They seem to elevate food to the status of fine art without any airs of pretentiousness. Honest, refined and artful. It's a beautiful food experience.
Always a learning experience when I go to this wine shop. Great selection of aged wine at reasonable prices

Came by with two other couples for a 1230 pm Sunday brunch. We have driven past many times while in the area and decided to give it a try. 

The Inn is approached via a long driveway from PA route 202. A sign marks the entrance. There is a stone building on the right and a large barn on the left parking is straight through. Beautiful grounds, plenty of space. We entered the Inn and were greeted by the hostess and accompanied to a waiting/sitting area. A very old building typical of the area. After a few minutes we were seated in our private dining room. There were other areas where diners were seated but we had a separate room.  

Pat our server, came by and explained the menu.  Two courses and dessert. You could pick whatever you wanted to eat and the "chef will make as much and as many of every dish you would like".  It is prix fixe $35/each, and a BYOB. The menu was not extensive but had some interesting choices the Waygu Bivette was great.  The Boar sausage was very good. Others got different dishes.  All of us enjoyed the food. They also had a few standard brunch items on offer such ad Eggs Benedict, Smoked Salmon, etc. All the food was delicious. 

We were also offered Mimosas to start as part of the brunch.  We had brought a few bottles of champagne to share.  

Service was very well paced we never felt rushed or that we could not find our server.

We tried to get a peek at some of the rooms in the Inn but unfortunately the last couple had just checked in and all the rooms were occupied.
A very nice brunch in a fabulous setting in Bucks County, PA.

Mark & Nancy.

Great place!

Ordered:
- Fried chicken (white meat)
- Boudin balls
- Alligator Cheesecake
- Jambalaya
- Creme brûlée

Came on Saturday night (party of 2) and were seated in 30 mins. The environment is quirky, artsy, and wonderful. The waiter was attentive and informative. We had a great time. The bill came out to $61 and was well worth it. We even had leftovers for another meal. The meals were all cooked well and the cornbread and salads kept us happy until the courses/appetizers came. Alligator cheesecake is a must! It's not the standard cream cheese cheesecake but is more like a quiche. But...my favorite meal here was the jambalaya. The flavor was complex and the consistency was perfect (the rice was fluffy, not soggy). It had a nice refreshing zest too it as well as a deep savory flavor.

This is my favorite Chinese restaurant in Tampa. The clay pot spicy fish and the Szechuan chicken dish very authentic. The hot green tea is freshly made from tea leaves not bags. In short this Chinese restaurant is just as good if not better than any Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. This is not a place for the alcoholic drinking crowd, only quality food served at this place. If drinking is your preference stick to the restaurants in Hyde Park.
I highly recommend this place for casual Mexican food. The food is fantastic and price is right!

Great bbq pork with a wonderful crusty bark on the outside and tender, juicy pork on the inside. Chop it all together and it's a perfect mixture. The sausage was very tasty with a little spiciness that I like. I had the Carolina sauce which more mustard based than vinegar, reminded me of my favorite joint in Mississippi. My sides of bbq beans and potato salad filled in all the empty spaces. I was stuffed. Servings are more than enough for a big hungry man like me. The owner was friendly and helpful. I'm gonna be back to try the rest of the very reasonably priced menu. It ain't fancy dining but they don't charge you for it either.
One of the better spaces I have been to in the country. Was skeptical about the Nola yoga scene, this was the first space I tried and I am impressed.

This place was a great find!  A business colleague wanted to meet for coffee and suggested Hub Coffee.  

Parking was easy and the place is clean.  The staff was incredibly friendly and the restaurant feels like something you would find in the Pacific Northwest.  

I ordered a mocha and was offered a pastry or one of many other things on their menu.  It was one of the best specialty coffees I've had in Reno.  

I will be back and this is a great place to meet with clients.  It's right next to the river but out of the dirty downtown area.  I would recommend it to anyone in the area that wants a place to stop.

The only downside is the Internet wasn't working right and keep dropping off.  Hopefully they will be able to fix that.  There was plenty of seating and there is an upstairs area with tables that is very unique and cool.

We met some friends for dinner here, and we were so surprised! The food was delicious, some of us had pot roast and it was better than grandma's!!!  The desserts were amazing, and our waiter was awesome !!  We will most definitely be back.

I've been to every shop in Reno and Sparks that sells boba, and this has been my favorite so far. I usually get a fruit tea with a jelly and everything has been great. However, I wish their menu was a little larger and they had more food and dessert options. I'd also love to see longer hours on the weekends so this place can be a hang out spot

To reiterate several of the comments on this thread, this nail salon offers one of the best pedicures I've ever had. It's very thorough with an added hot stone massage and heel treatment included in the $30 price. However, the gel manicures are fairly sub-par and quite hit or miss depending on who you see. After 6 months of visiting this salon regularly, I can recall very few occasions that my gel manicure lasted well. From chipping polish to broken nails to color fading, some of the work hasn't been great. Overall, I'm not inclined to pay $35 regularly for a simple gel manicure that lasts 1.5 weeks max. Also, as a few others noted, there seems to be some  inconsistencies/ unclarity with pricing and specials. Should you visit, definitely check out the discounts and pricing they advertise on their website and cite those once you arrive for your service. I recall just a few occasions where I had to correct the service receipt, including $5 fees for removing gel in order to give me a new gel manicure. Not only did the manicurist fail to mention a word about this during the service, but we all know that you can purchase a bottle of acetone for less than $1.... Why would I pay $5 to remove some nail polish when I'm already paying a premium price for a full gel manicure (and ironically, if you continue to get gel manicures there, they don't charge you for gel removal)? Overall, it's a clean and nice spot with great pedicures, but I would be wary of paying extra for gel manicures that aren't guaranteed to last.

**Update**
A couple of weeks ago, I visited the salon for one of their awesome pedicures and decided to give the gel manicure another try. Even after going to one of the more experienced manicurists, my gel manicure only lasted 1 week before it began peeling and chipping. Recently, I decided to visit another nail salon literally 3 minutes away & got a gel manicure for $25 ($10 less than RHNIII) that looks great and lasts. Sure the new spot isn't as fancy (and appears to be much more busy/crowded), but I can go without the image of luxury for more affordable manicures that actually last.

My boyfriend and I left for a frigid midday shopping excursion and wanted to grab a bite. I was seeking something kinda classy but still quick, and found myself craving pasta [which I totally don't do every other day of my life]. This place absolutely KILLED IT. First of all, the bread was so fresh I was honestly amazed. Have you ever made bread at home and eaten it fresh out of the oven? Yeah, it was like that. The olive oil and cheese (I think Parmigiano reggiano) they keep at the table was the highest quality I've ever had at an Italian restaurant in the U.S. Next came our salads which had arugula, endives, pistachios, and a white wine vinaigrette. It was genuinely one of the best salads I've ever had at any restaurants, particularly because the ingredients were as fresh as they could possibly be. Next came our appetizer, an apple butter bruschetta with microgreens on the aforementioned bread-of-the-gods. Something--possibly the bread--had a deep, smoky flavor that meshed perfectly with the sweet apple butter and crisp greens. Once again, this dish blew me away. Finally, we shared the garganelli which had an aromatic herb sauce with braised beef and green olives. It was totally unlike any pasta dish I've ever had before, and I loved it. Notably, the pasta was so good I told Derek it had to be fresh as rehydrated or thawed pasta cannot possibly have that good of a texture. Turns out...it was! They make all their pasta in house. We also shared the house red wine with our meal which was a great deal at $16 for 500mL, or three glasses. It was very earthy and went great with the tart but savory pasta. To finish things off, we each had a little gelato which was also probably the best I've had in the U.S. All in all, I was completely blown away by Pastaria. I went in expecting nothing more than a casual pasta place, but it was truly great food by Italian restaurant standards or any other for that matter. I will absolutely go back, and you should too!

The Fox is my favorite theater in St. Louis. It's absolutely beautiful and holds so much rich history. It's truly a place that should be cherished it brings so much to our community. I have had season tickets in the past which are reasonable and a great way to see sold out shows such as the coveted Hamilton next year. This trip I accompanied a friend to The King and I. The experience is always good from the staff as soon as you walk through the door. The ticket scanned welcomed me 'back to The Fox' assuming everyone who comes once always comes back again. We were directed to an old fashioned elevator operator that took us to the third tier and we were escorted to our seats. The atmosphere is everything you could want from a theater experience outside of a major theater city. From someone who has seen many shows on Broadway I still appreciate the beauty of the Fox.

This was my second visit here and I was not disappointed at all... Ribs were very tender and the glaze in my opinion was just right... The big beans also very good... My wife had the pulled pork nachos and it was as tender as it could be... we tried the fried pickles and they had a great kick to them...this is one place that you will not be disappointed, but will return anytime you're in the area and it is just off of I-44...it deserves the five star rating that I gave it.

This is a pretty small Panera. We went for dinner on a Sunday night and it seemed they were a little short staffed and the line moved slow. Once we got to order everything went smoothly and the workers were friendly. We get the pick two combination, I'm a big fan of their turkey apple cheese sandwich on the cranberry bread. My partner enjoyed his frontega chicken sandwich. I had chicken noodle soup as my side since I was sick but it was nothing remarkable. I'd like to come back and try them for breakfast sometime.

Who knew you could have fun buying a car? Who knew you could find a delearship with clear transparency? We found just that by making a 95 mile drive to Fishers after quite a few phone conversations with Sarah, the voice of Honda Fishers. Apon arrival, she greeted us in the parking lot and introduced us to Rick Shewmake who expeditiously provided a test drive for a CRV while our Camry was appraised. Our questions re: the vehicle itself, the warranty coverage and financing were all answered again exactly as answered on the phone; No inconsistencies; no seeds of doubt about what other dealer offer.  It is without reservation we recommend this dealer and especially Rick Shewmake. You will enjoy working with this guy. Plus you'll have a few laughs and meet Keebler.

Overpriced, so-so coffee + food and rude baristas who respond to "Thank you!" with "Yeah." 

No room for this nonsense in New Orleans.

I walked in and sat towards the back near the kitchen.  4 employees in the back cooking.  Not 1 glove.  Even watched one employee plate food with his bare hands.  All 4 of them handling raw and cooked food cross contaminating with bare hands and no one washed hands.  For obvious reasons I didn't stick around to try the food.

Very fresh and tasty food, friendly service. Cold and tasty local beers on tap. We tried the gumbo, the fried shrimp with fries and the boiled crawfish. All were perfectly seasoned. I would eat here again in a heartbeat and my kids agreed they would too. You can't go wrong.

Great therapy for the worn and weary! Kymberlie uses a well proven neuro muscular technique which is awesome for any athlete. Very good location in the heart of Media and ease of booking using Mind Body Online.

I'm shocked I've yet to review this place! Been going here since it opened. 

Beautiful and fun ambiance, amazing tacos, and delicious drinks!

 If you want a good place for a business lunch or night out with friends, go here!  

Staff is also nice and good at explaining the food and drinks. 

"Lunch Box" is the perfect meal with 2 tacos, side, and a donut dessert. 
Great place!

A perfect blend of top-notch Mexican comfort food and hipster dive bar. And the music playing throughout further sets the tone for the latter - it's an eclectic variety of garage, rock, funk, etc. I don't know how many conversations I've had get ruined there because we were chatting then have to stop mid-sentence and just start belting out singing because of whatever great tune came on next.

Last time I was there was for my birthday. We called ahead to see if we can get a table and they told me they can't do that, but then asked how many people, put me on hold, came back and said they would work something out for us so there wouldn't be a big group waiting a long time on a busy Saturday night. HUGE props (do people still say that?) to them for doing that. 

They are run by the same owners as the Cantina Los Caballitos on Passyunk, which is just as good. 

Final note: get the blood orange margarita. It'll do wonders for your night out.

Worst tacos I've ever paid for, but the chorizo cheese fries were good.

I had a dry flavorless Al pastor and a dry mahi mahi.
Stopped in for brunch on a lark. Everything we had was good, but Santa's Breakfast was bomb! Great service, atmosphere and food.
It's December and it was freezing in the bar. I will not be back this winter. Please turn up the heat inside !!
Always give a ton of protein scoops and is consistently fresh! Worth the price.

My first attempt at vegan food.   All in all - a very nice place and the food was surprisingly satisfying.   I had the root vegetable soup special and the green curry dish.  The soup was great the curry fairly bland.   But my wife had the tempura and udon noodles.  That was excellent.    Coffee was very good and the cranberry upside cake was tasty.  

No bar or liquor license and it kinda felt like a cafeteria.  But a nice experience overall.

By far the best Mexican in Bellevue! So good everything I have tasted great and I really try to explore the menu. They have chimichanga supreme which is 4 chimis with shrimp, ground beef, chopped beef and chicken! Their cheese dip is excellent! I highly recommend!

Day after Thanksgiving is typically filled with recipes creating wonderful dishes with Thanksgiving leftovers. Well, in my family we do distribute leftovers but we traditionally will go Black Friday shopping and stay at a hotel in downtown Indianapolis and eat out for dinner. This past Black Friday we visited a sweet little join just south of the Circle City Mall called Nada and after scrolling through the menu decided I must try this: Crispy Pork Belly Tacos.

This dish has a lot going on and if you've ever been to Nada before you know that everything is pretty much al a carte style so the sides were all bought individually but an order of tacos does come with three tacos so that's cool. If you wanted to get some friends together and share some tacos that's a genius idea and I definitely recommend it as they have a wide array of tacos and other sides from the menu here:

Back to the critique of my meal, let me quickly write about the side dishes. The chili-glazed crispy potatoes were my favorite. The sweet chili sauce reminds me of the sauce my mom uses on her egg rolls (or lumpia to stick to my Filipino roots) and it's sweet and spicy and crispy but a dabble of crema does good for those who don't like "spicy" things. The beans and rice and the cucumber salad were good, but nothing jumped out from the flavors standpoint but they were very complimentary to the dish.

The crispy pork belly tacos themselves were salivatingly tasty! If you've never had pork belly or not sure what it is...in short, pork belly is the part of the pig where we get BACON. Pork belly is ideally cooked two ways...smoked in a BBQ pit or simply deep-fried to be crispy and tender. When this plate came out the fried pork belly strips jump out and the pickled peppers and onions are a nice contrasting color. The rectangular plate is a nice touch and does make handling the plate itself easy as sometimes the plates even for tacos can be scolding hot at other restaurants. The dishes the sides come in are pretty sleek...very shallow, but of good size and easy handling.

The pork belly was definitely crispy which is how I like my bacon and so that's how I like my pork belly. Not really any smoke flavor which is always complimentary to pork belly but that's OK as crispy is still really good and Nada does it PERFECTLY! There's a crispy crunchy first bite with a good healthy amount of "chew" to the pork belly. As your tastebuds navigate through the pork belly they encounter a sweet and tangy flavor from the pickled peppers and onions, and then a little bit of a hit and from the guajillo peppers and cilantro for an amazing bite each and every time. I like the flour tortillas because of a smoother texture, but if you don't like flour tortillas they do offer their tacos in corn tortillas, but I think it'd be too much of a gritty type of texture as the crispy pork belly has that to it. 

The downside to this dish and specifically to the crispy pork belly tacos, besides there only being three of them, is I wasn't too particularly fond of the size of the tortilla's. I get that they're "taco" sized tortillas, but I think they could be a little bit larger. Tacos are meant to fit in your hand and these definitely do, but they do way too easily in my opinion. I think if they were to increase the tortillas it'd be a nice touch and probably get people fuller faster!

SUMMARY

At the end of the day...the crispy pork belly tacos at Nada are full of intense and complimentary flavors. If you've never experienced pork belly in this form (bacon is definitely good, but pork belly is like 1/2″ thick cut bacon strips) this would be a great gateway to eating pork belly and enjoying the glorious flavor that cut of meat is.
This place has a great environment with delicious food. Their mimosas are well priced and mixed just perfect. Came here with three other friends and they all were also very happy with their food.

It's been over 6 months since I been to this location but I absolutely love the renovations. I would rate that a 5 by itself. My tour of Italy was good along with the soup. The reason why I deduct two stars was due to the incident with the appetizer. I ordered the Smoked Mozzerella Fonduta and when the waitress placed it on the table half of the crostinis fell on the table. I understand while serving things like that can happen my issue was she didn't ask if I would like more bread to replace the ones that fell on the table. I had to ask her upon her return for more bread and by the time it came out with my meal the dip was cold.

Had a fun night!  Found out they have Karaoke night
on Wednesdays.  Great food and live music!

Colleen and her staff are the best! I've been a regular client for about a year and my skin has never looked better! Everyone who works there is great, especially Monse and Denise. And Colleen is the best! I swear I look years younger with regular facials. The staff are very knowledgeable, professional, helpful and generous with their time. Best spa in town!
It's an okay place, good food, 4 stars, but not worth the price. At this location area, there are many option to chose from when it comes to Mexican food.

Food is always good at olive garden.   We tried the new appetizer parm crusted zucini balls this time and we got few that were lacking on zucini and strange mushy texture inside.    Soups and salad are yummy as usual.   Ministrone is our favorite.   Pastas were also good.   The server was super attentive and nice.   Usual food usual service.   The restaurant smelled bad when we entered so that's all.

Never got a pedicure before because I have a couple embarassing nails but the staff here were very nice. My technician was thorough and quick. I got their more expensive $37 Spa pedicure and it was really nice. My feet were so dry but now they are brand new! They also have drinks, snacks and give you a free pair of socks. The facility is very clean amd nicely decorated for the holidays. I would recommend this place.
I love the setting, it's very hipsterish and cute! The food I thought was okay but I'm giving them 4 stars because the decor is pretty cute

The wine servers are always so inviting and friendly! I love love love the chocolate cherry truffle dessert wine. It's so delicious. I tried the Pinot noir and it is very berry and light. I always come back to re-stock up on my favorite wine!

I came here with high hope for the crepe cake, but when I got it. It wasn't as fresh and good as people made it sound. Not only that, but the green tea crepe I had gotten was suppose to have Oreos but all I had inside there was crepe and red beans!!! And THERE WAS A LOT OF RED BEAN and a lot of matcha powder. So if you don't mind eating that or beans then get it. The flavor of red bean and matcha powder was overwhelming.

Among Indian food fans in the Philly area, there has been competition between IndeBlue's 2 restaurants and another chef who also has a restaurant in Philly and Jersey. Overall, I fall into the camp of IndeBlue's competitor, but I think IndeBlue does a few things very well - 

IndeBlue pushes the boundaries on the menu in going for Indian fusion and incorporating less traditional flavors, especially in their appetizers. You get really interesting and flavorful dishes that are great for someone looking for less traditional Indian food. The same applies to desserts, where IndeBlue has a couple inventive and really tasty options. I love the spinach chaat, liked tandoori wings, but didn't love the shrimp roti tacos. 

Unfortunately, there's a big mismatch with the entrees. Their main course menu is what you expect from most Indian restaurants - some of the classic North indian dishes, with many popular South Indian dishes as well. By comparison to the appetizers that you've just had, the more "traditional" dishes fall flat, but on their own, they also don't compare well to other upscale Indian restaurants. If you are someone who always orders the tikka masala / makhani, then I think it's not the best restaurant for you. The price is what it is, but I wouldn't call it great value for an upscale Indian spot.
Who doesn't love Ikea? Cafe had good options. Can't beat the prices. Spent at least 3 hours here.

We met some friends here for lunch about 1 p.m. on a Sunday. We had been in briefly before during one of the monthly wine walks. We knew that we wanted to come back to check out the food. The interior has an industrial trendy feel to it.

It was not extremely busy and we were seated right away since we had reservations. We thought it was a nice touch that they had live music playing.

We reviewed the menu and placed our orders. Two of us ordered the pork belly mac and cheese, one ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and the other ordered the meatball sandwich. On Yelp there is an offer for a buy one get one Bloody Mary on Sundays. So, two of us got that.

Our food was delivered in a timely fashion and looked and tasted amazing! A toffee cake was ordered for dessert.

Overall it was a very good experience. 

Literally the only downside to our experience was the level of sound of the music from the live entertainment. The music was very good but we really struggled to carry on any kind of conversation.

The vibe is homely but the food is excellent. I love the flat enchilidas because they remind me of my Grandmas. The Miilenesa is a fried steak that hangs off the edge of your plate it's so large. The margatiras are good but the sangria is even better. Both the rice and beans are good too. I love El Sur
I love coming here, it's like my second home! Lots of delicious food and amazingly friendly service!! The cutest location inside and out!
This place was o'k ... Please hire more people the LINE is OUT OF THIS WORLD.

Just saw this restaurant on Food paradise...soooo much butter!! I should never eat here BUT I am pregnant with our first child and my hubby wants us to have a total of four kids (4!!) I told him "let's see how the first two go and then decide"...if I ever become pregnant with our fourth child, I'll have him bring me here and I'll try that cornbread!

Food is okay, the Jazz is great but if you're searching for a good meal, I would go somewhere else. Sounds harsh but there's much better food to eat in the area. Grab a drink and enjoy the jazz but skip the food.

We moved out of Nashville but were glad we used Fox. They loaded us the day before our closing in Nashville and unloaded in Mobile right after our closing down here. It took some research to find that the big van lines usually have more than one household on the truck, so they don't guarantee a delivery date.. They were friendly and respectful of us and our belongings.

The don't mind giving out a sample.
To help make your decisions on what to order.
I ordered vegetable plate 
Yummy 
The waitresses are so sweet 
I will return 
Next visit fried pork chops 
Head to the east side for this hidden gem

This was one of my favorite spots. But not anymore. This time around the waitress come back with a pitcher. Doesn't say one word on what it is. Decided to pick up my cut, I look at her and said that is sprite. Is that sprite in the pitcher? She then said that it is and then asked me if I'm okay?! 

Really?! Am I OKAY?! What would you think of if you were in my situation?! I thought it was water. 

Point is don't assume people know your language at the place you work. Cause you will definitely get the wrong impression.

I did complain to the manager to let them know what had happen. She was waiting for me to come up. So I did and she did not deny any of what I said. 

You have this style of workers, just going to loose business one way sooner.

I have mixed feelings about this target. It's a good location but the stock is extremely limited and seem to have a lot of clothes but not daily essentials. A lot of items are marked up that it just makes sense to go to CVS or Whole Foods or Rite Aid which are a short two minute walk away. The staff at this location were poorly sourced and seem to not really cater to the customers and are all around very bad- it's almost like shopping at walmart. The apathy of the crew members are terrible and which will ultimately lead to the downfall of this location.

Fantastic new addition to Old City.  Just a chill spot without the usual nonsense that comes with Old City bars.  Fun and attentive staff who have all been in the business.  Rotating drafts span many profiles and good cocktails.  Kitchen is upping their menu weekly.  Fried chicken sandwich and mushroom sandwich are both incredible.  Wings have a unique flavor and the carnitas tacos are delicious.
Don't listen to these snowflake millennials reviews. The sheep (millennials) are brainwashed with this place. This place is so over rated! The pork taste like rubber. You eat like a dog

Undercooked and doohey.... what I would call cheesey bread not pizza.  Got the chicken dumpling app and it was soogy and had hard pieces of something in it.  Way overpriced!  
So many better options
The food was nasty and was unnecessarily expensive. There r better places than this and would recommend to not get the beef.

Not great! Just ok... ordered sweet potato fries and a never ending flow of long islands lol.  Fries were ok not greasy but a bit over done for my taste.  The long islands were great!  They did not skimp on the liquor . However I did get my drink in a plastic cup thumbs down for that I'm not sure if it was because they were extremely busy or what the deal was aside from that I'm not sure if I'll be coming back any time soon.  This review had been sitting in my drafts for a while.  This visit was from Sr. Patrick's Day.  I have been back since and the service was good the food was just right. It does get busy and crowded.

Bottom line: Great beers, fun atmosphere. 

Drawback: menu is overly complicated and actually takes away from enjoying what should be the main attraction: the beers.
The coffee and beignets are as delicious as when I first moved here in the mid 90s.  I hope that I can always rely on the Cafe Du Monde for a delicious and traditional New Orleans experience.

I'm new to the are and was in dire need of a haircut and highlight. I called to schedule an appointment and saw a girl named Jordan and let me tell you, I am IN love!!! Not only was Jordan super personable and friendly, she was super receptive to what I was looking for and gave me EXACTLY what I wanted!! I love my hair and I LOVE Jordan!! Thank you, Jordan. You definitely have a new regular client!

Alright guys, this place is way too legit. If I could give it 6 stars, I would. First off, there's so much to do. It's great for all sorts of ages. Obviously there were tons of kids there, with their unlimited energy. Trampolines are an insane workout, and Flying Spider is very aware of this because they offer classes to get your heart pumping. But I've seen teens, adults, and middle-aged people here, all having a blast; that's because this place is so fun. If I ever have a 1st date with a girl, I bring her here. It's way more fun than dinner and a movie. They have zip-lines , dodgeball, and tons of different trampoline types and areas. Not to mention the prices are extremely fair. But on top of all of this, the staff are so great. Everyone is extremely friendly and have a genuine positive energy that makes this place better than anywhere else. 
 When I eventually have kids, I'll be bringing them here, this place is great.
Price/quality on check.   Customer service excellent.   Take out was great, yummy heat.  Biryani... Can't really go wrong!
The drinks are delicious and super creative! Reminded me of a speakeasy with the low lighting and fun old time drink ingredients.

Great beach tiki bar, we ordered conch fritters and a few drinks while watching sunset - had a great time! Live music and friendly staff!!! Great views.... also they have beach volleyball !!!! I will be back!

The rooms could use a remodeling, things in the room are just placed in the wrong spots plus there was no microwave in the room which was a huge disappointment. The hallways smelled like a generic motel, the room door looks like it was built 1900s. The sink wasn't in the bathroom, it was strategically places outside of the bathroom like what genius thought of that. 
The hotel elevators were broken when I checked in. I had to lug heavy suitcase up five floors, i was so tired when I reached the third floor I had to bring out my inhaler because my asthma flared up.  By time I reached the the fifth floor, i was crawling to my room barley dragging my luggage along with me. At the end of my stay I had to check into the hospital due to the elevators being broken and me climbing the stairs. Hyatt Place will be receiving my hospital bills!!

We tried the one in Clayton. We were super excited based on the reviews but found it a bit underwhelming especially in a city with so much stiff brunch competition.

Service was adequate at best. Granted I remember bartending on a Saturday morning and not being in the peppiest of moods! We had to ask for plates to be cleared, drinks to be filled.

Food, definitely the most important, was just ok. I had the breakfast fried rice but the house made sausage had no flavor at all. It was decent. The Brussels has zero seasoning. Even a healthy dose of salt didn't do much and I love Brussels. After breakfast I ordered the donuts. They took 20 minutes and were served fried, cold with unwarned, coagulated chocolate sauce on side. I asked the bartender if that was normal he said yes lol.

It's a cute place and the coffee was good at least.

So. After years eating their pizza, followed by years avoiding their pizza, I came back for another go. Time crunch + proximity + devil may care attitude = Three Baz carryout pizzas to take to a party and all three were great. Redemption!

This is a fun little place to hang out.  I'd recommend coming here during the day on the weekend rather than at night.  it gets much busier at night as you can imagine.  They have a ton of great games, and they try to rotate new ones in on occasion.  Their native brews leave a lot to be desired, but their guest taps are usually always on point.  I love that pretty much everything is just a quarter, so a little goes a long way.  It allowed me to finally beat Time Crisis!  I really hope that one day they will find an X-Men arcade machine and then my life will be complete!
They have an amazing selection of bagels and always have Pork Roll!!! Enough said.....

Hands down, the best burger I've ever had! Service was top notch and the owner took the time to tell us about how these fabulous burgers came to be. The RIP fries were delicious and the vegetarians in our group said the veggie burgers were great as well. Go there...NOW!!

I heard the wings here are incredible, so even though I'm not a huge wings fan....I am now! The wings are FANTASTIC! I've had wings at other places famous for them, but this place stands out.  They are super crispy with just the right amount of crackle and flavor. Their craft beer list is extensive, especially for local beers. I'll come back to sample other food!
The food's not bad here the stuff is really friendly and it said ice cream place to which they have great ice cream they have a nice bathroom and the whole restaurant looks like they keep it clean
Try their tuesday lunch special everybody who comes there to eat are regulars the decor is colorful and u feel welcomed and the fried pork tenderloin is huge and full of flavor

I ordered the spicy noodle soup with sausage, brisket,  and pigs feet. It was the most disgusting food I've ever eaten. The soup had over any inch thick layer of red grease. Don't get me wrong,  I don't mind a little grease, especially since I was hungover, but this was not edible. I would give 0 stars if I could.
Very friendly and informative. Some of the best tofu I've ever ordered at a Chinese place.

Just got back from working Hurricane Harvey relief in Baytown, TX and I was excited to see that the Saltgrass had opened. The wife and I went with a couple of our friends. We were greeted and had our drink orders taken very quickly. The bread and our drinks came out shortly thereafter and we ordered the Range Rattlers and Artichoke and Spinach dip for starters. The appetizers were great.
Myself and the other hubby ordered the rib-eyes, my better half had blackened redfish, and his had the tenderloin medallions. My steak was a perfect medium-rare. Our hostess (I apologize for not remembering her name, I am horrible with names), was very attentive. Filling our waters, and asking if we wanted drink refills before our drinks were finished.
I believe the steak was far better than that "other" steak place, at a considerably lower price.
Will definitely be going back here again and again.
Highly recommended!!

Wow. This place make fast food restaurant look like they need to close there doors for good. And here my reason. I went in this diner and was seated in seconds . Then with the next minute my order was taken. Then with 3-5 minutes I had my order on the table piping hot. This with a full restaurant . You had try this place out. And of course the legendary chicken.

Been back here a few more times and I see now I was hasty in my previous review.  The prices are more reasonable than other similar venues and the food is far superior than I had imagined earlier.  Next time at Roberto's, try the burrito, stuffed with your choice of beans, beef,  cheese and/or myriad other choices for between $3.45 - $6.95.  Add $1 for  large drink and you are set.  I ate only half at the store and took the rest home, it was that filling.  Better yet, it was great tasting, well-cooked with a fine dark red chile sauce.

The tacos are first rate, especially with sour cream, and the enchiladas are consistently satisfying.  Service is fast and because of location next to UNR campus, nothing sits around for very long.  Only real shortcoming is lack of seating when it's busy.  I live very close-by, so that issue is moot, but with the colder weather, who wants to eat outside?  However, for the money, the value is real and tasty.

I look at the reviews and all I can conclude is that, "haters gonna hate". I was promptly greeted and sat at the bar. Was offered chips, salsa and bean dip with the option of queso or guacamole. I ordered the Cadillac Margarita, excellent (so I enjoyed another with my entree). Next, I ordered the carne asada, again, excellent. Well seasoned, cooked perfectly and I really enjoyed the rice and beans. A solid 4 Star effort. I only give 5 stars if I'm totally blown away in extraordinary fashion, so for me this was a most excellent experience and one I hope to enjoy again.

Great spot for a taste of new Orleans! Cute, quaint and great variety on the menu. Staff was very attentive and food was prepared fairly quickly. We had the breakfast poboy, grits, and the special of the day Nutella French toast. All great and very flavorful!

I haven't been to Uncle Bills in a long time, but decided to check it out on a recent visit to St. Louis.  I ordered the Buckwheat pancakes, and was frankly quite disappointed.  The cakes were dried out and not very flavorful and the syrup was not very flavorful.  Our waitress did a GREAT job, however, being very attentive to all her tables, and getting us anything we needed right away.

Found this using Yelp while we were in the area on a Sunday afternoon.  The food was so fresh and delicious! We split a soup, a burrito and a bowl between 2 people and almost had too much food! The service was also excellent. If you are ever in the area stop in for a healthy bite.

I recently tried the Central West End Veterinary Clinic, as it is much closer to my home than the vet I have previously been using for my precious doggie.  Like most people, my dog is my baby, so I am very picky about where I take her.  I have to say I was very impressed by this place!  The staff was super friendly and nice and the facility was very clean (cleanest vet I've seen, in fact), modern, and comfortable.  There was plenty of parking and I walked right in during my scheduled appointment time, instead of sitting in a waiting room with tons of other animals until they're ready, which is always stressful for everyone.

Dr. Walker was very nice and was obviously very knowledgeable about animals and medicine.  She thoroughly explained the health issue with my dog in a way that I could understand and treated my pup like gold.  My old vet seemed to "run them in and run them out" as fast as possible, so it was a nice change to have her get to know my dog and me and take the time to investigate my pup thoroughly to make sure she gave the correct diagnosis.

I was thrilled with the service and care and will be switching over to this vet clinic permanently!

Didn't care for this place the first time in 2010, but subsequent visits since then have changed my mind. Really enjoy "The Don" and the Greek salad, which the regular size will easily feed 2. Easy take out set up as well.
Disaster. Dirty fridges in the front. Cash only. Greasy film ion everything including the tables. The cheese pizza with hot sauce was good.  $4 for a slice and a bottled drink is good for the area.

This is the 2nd time we have stayed here and really like it. The rooms are a great large size, and the breakfast is wonderful. I'm a fan of the Managers Reception but the "snacks" are pretty lame really.... 
Beds were pretty comfy, but counter top in hallway area was really dirty like it hadnt been wiped off, and there was a fingernail in the sink. Gross. 
Staff is wonderful!

Obviously we were really excited about going to Guy Fieri's restaurant specially after being his fan for many years. Let me tell you being in Chester it could be a little scary but the Casino area is very safe. The food was really good with HUGE PORTIONS! Either go extremely hungry or share a plate.. The nachos were amazing you will definitely get some cheese on every bite and the Philly cheesesteak was really good. Highly recommend is you are in for a night of poker and horse races.

We visited Palace of Asia for the first time today, for their lunch buffet.
The restaurant is very large, very nicely decorated and very clean.  The staff was pleasant and attentive, a very welcome change from the staff at many other small Indian buffets in this area, and there are many.
The food was very good and very varied.  Everything was fresh and well seasoned with a good selection of condiments. There was also a hummus and pita area, which seemed a bit odd, but it was good.  The only complaint I had is that - once again - the food was not hot.  It was lukewarm.  Still, we'll definitely go back and give it another try.  And maybe not for the buffet; we saw some very appealing meals being served, smoking and aromatic.  We'll try one of those.

I really loved this venue. It's right on the boardwalk across from The Bay. I went for lunch with my friend and although I ate light she had the Piri Piri Panini. I ordered the Mista Salad and Vegetable Puree soup. Both were lovely vegan options. 

The tables were a bit long between us. I was far enough to make me feel a disconnect in our conversation. The ambiance is warmly lit with dark wood tones complimented by accents of lighter yellow. 

The staff were effecient and pleasent. The food was savoury. I wasn't sure the salad and soup would be enough for me. However, it did satisfy my appitite without leaving me feeling too full. 

It was a nice place to have lunch.
Terrible customer service! They will yell at you from across the store! Don't go here!

Ok I'm basing my review on all the other BBQ I have eaten. I'm always looking for great BBQ in my travels. I asked for moist brisket and they gave me lean. So not impressed with it at all. The Ribs were Great and the burnt ends were very good the Burnt ends were moist and had tons of flavor.  Ate at another BBQ place yesterday and it was so much better.

Wow. What a nice surprise! I just had some terrific curry chicken stir fry made with just the right amount of heat. My husband had Pho Ga and it was delicious as well. Wish we lived closer as this would be my go to place. Reasonable price and excellent service also. Worth the drive from Weeki Wachee.

I finally made it to the Hattie B's just a few steps from my couch, which is a very convenient yet dangerous distance. The inside of the new restaurant is vastly different from its former tenant (The Hook).

I'm happy to report that the food at this new Hattie B's is just as delicious as it is at the other locations I've visited. I went with my standard: the "hot"-level tenders and fries. The chicken was cooked perfectly, although it was slightly less hot than I was expecting. But I'd take that over the it being too hot. The fries were good but a bit soggy once I started eating them. The delicious honey mustard was a great dip for both the chicken and fries.

This would have been a five-star Hattie B's experience, but the service was slightly subpar when compared to what I've come to expect of this Nashville staple. The employee taking orders was slow (which may have been a tech-related issue) and not very welcoming once we got to the counter to order. And the employee who delivered our food seemed to be inconvenienced by my request for the honey mustard that was left off the tray. Both of these exchanges were harmless yet noticeable. But they certainly won't keep me from being a frequent customer of this location.

Hattie B's will always be my go-to hot chicken joint, especially with it now being so close. It's another great addition to the Melrose/8th Ave. restaurant scene. Welcome to the neighborhood, Hattie B!

We have never been deep sea fishing so we opted to go out yesterday afternoon. There were 11 people joining us this afternoon so we had plenty of room once we got to our fishing spot. 

We used the boat's poles and they gave us a a quick tutorial of how to catch some fish. We stayed out for 2 hours and they moved the boat as soon as we stopped catching fish. 

It takes an hour to get to the spot and an hour to get back. So, sit back on the top floor and catch tom rays or grab some food and a drink so you have plenty of strength to reel in those big ones you catch. 

We caught 4 kinds of fish - bass, white grunt, snapper and perch. router we wanted. We were looking for that grouper but when we got back we saw the boat beside us caught the gWhen we got back they cleaned them for a small fee. There are 2 local places in the same marina that will cook up what you caught. One is a 'dinner' and one is 'tacos.' That way if you don't really like that fish smell you don't have to take it home with you other than what you get on you while actually fishing. 

Which brings me to say you can get as messy or stay as clean as you want. There is staff available to take the fish off the lines and bait your hook if you want. I opted to bait my own hook but given the lack of pliers I let others remove my fish. That was also for my own safety as well as everyone else around me. Those fish start shaking back and forth and you can catch your hook in someone skin WAY TOO EASILY. So since I wanted to avoid that I just let Boomer remove the hooks from the fish. 

We had a wonderful time. The price was right. We checked into other days and they do fill up completely on certain days so check online and give them a call and schedule ahead of time to make sure you don't miss out on this fun time. 

And if one of you likes fishing and the other doesn't, thats ok! You can stay up top and catch even more sun and listen to the gleeful fisherman below you.

Jackson's Bistro bar and Sushi is a great place to dine with a variety of options. Quoted wait time around 8:30/9p on a Saturday night was 30mins, but was luckily able to be seated within 10/15 minutes (for 3 adults).
Started off with ordering some beers/cocktails.  Didn't have my Jack Honey which I was craving so had to opt for something new. Decided to try a Pear and Elderflower Collins for $12. I was pleasantly surprised how well made as you smelt the nose of pear, but tasted the citrus/flowerer elderflower liquor. It was very tasty, thinking you could have quite a few as it almost didn't taste like an adult beverage. 
We attempted to order an edaname appetizer and then our meals. The meals came out but unfortunately not the appetizer. The waiter was very apologetic as he assured us he didn't hear us request it. Maybe the music was too loud, or restaurant to busy to hear properly.  Luckily the meals were a good size and very filling.
Friends ordered the Shellfish Scampi and Lobster Carbonara. Both looked very delicious to the eye, presented well.
I ordered the Maine Lobster Tempura Sushi Roll. It was again very nicely presented and tasted great. The tempura crunch was on the outside of the roll vs inside or so it seemed, with rice; cucumber; maine lobster; small baby seafood roe with a spicy mayo and eel sauce drizzle, accompanied with wasabi and ginger. It was sliced into 8 equally sized pieces which were able to be eatten with chop sticks without falling apart. All for $14 which I would say was a fair price considering its a waterfront dining local.
This location has 3 larger separate rooms away from the dining room offering different genres of dance music. In addition to outside dining option, unfortunately not available for us that evening as it was reserved for private holiday party.
All is all a very nice location, dress it up, dress it causally nice and its a good time had by all. When in this area again, would definitely consider eatting here again...and trying out one of the dance floors!

I had dinner at this restaurant to give a tried about vietnamese food and Im disapointed about it cause they dont have the pho with everything the size is smaller than other restaurants so If you want chinese food here is good but vietnamese I recommend other place

What a pleasant surprise! They let us sample as much as we wanted, given that we had never been there. I decided to buy one serving of cookie dough for $4, and added 1 serving of ice cream for $2 more. Turns out that 1 serving is 3 scoops! Surprisingly, I really, really liked the Smores cookie dough! Those serving us were very kind and helpful. As I was checking out, they said the proceeds went to feed locals in Tampa Bay. That made my heart happy! If you are going to eat cookie dough and ice cream, you might as well be helping a good cause! ;)  It is cute inside, and there is some outside seating. Also, you can ask for a lid to go. The Butter Pecan was really good. Next time, I will have to try a cone! It wasn't until I left that I realized their play on words for Donation! Good one Dough Nation! :)

Just a Delightful shop with a great owner. From the light jazz music to the smiling baker, this place is not for the weak willed.  Baguettes galore, some of the best sourdough I've ever had and assorted cookies and pastries. At the end of a small strip shopping center, this place deserves your business. Bravo!!!!!

An amazing experience for the first time trying Ethiopian food. The dishes are beautifully severed and tasted amazing.
The service was also very good and helpful. The prices are very reasonable also, I will absolutely come back again and recommend it to anyone. New favorite restaurant!

Unimpressed. I called ahead to place my order only to arrive 20 minutes later and find out they had forgotten to make it. Not that they hadn't gotten to it yet, but that they had forgotten about it altogether. No apology. No discount. Not even a free drink. Nothing. The baked ziti was cold, the sauce diluted, and the cheese barely melted. The portion side was also extremely small for the price. I wouldn't go back.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  The place is horrible.  I recommend bear hugging a cactus over going here.  I recommend sticking Exacto knives under your fingernails.  Both scenarios will be more fulfilling and less painful than trying to ship something here.

Twice when I went in here I was told "we don't make no ____ing money off of drop offs when you already have a label!"  And that's my problem? Another time I arrived almost 25 minutes before close and they were locking the door.  I walked up to see if they were really closed as he was on his way out and was scolded "No, no, no - absolutely no way.  We're closed!"  What an interesting way to say hello!

If you're so fortunate as to make it inside this palace of failure, you'll find a team straight out of the 1980's workplace conduct training videos everyone enjoys so much.  You'll encounter everything they tell you to avoid from sexism and racism to pure incompetence, demeaning customers and even a dose of blaming management and corporate.

I wish I could rope this place off and sell tickets.  It's a full on sideshow.

Before I'm met with the "under new management since November" answer, I had a run-in with them 3 weeks ago in November.  Try again.

On my way back to California stop by to have some Mexican. My daughter had the caldo de pollo it was flavorful and was enough for two. My husband, son and myself had tacos and they were very tasty. Service as well was excellent.

Our tour guide Jagger  (I hope I'm spelling that right!) Was amazing and very informative. When I originally heard about the tour, I thought it was just going to be Bloody Mary's collection of haunted items, but we were in for a big surprise. The museum sits on the bottom floor of Zack and Addie's apartment. Yes, THAT apartment! If you don't know, you must Google this or don't and be surprised. But you must go and see this museum!

If your looking for grilled oysters this is the place!!
But our Entree was not very good. I was very let down. I had the steak & lobster. The lobster was maybe an inch long over cooked and dry. Steak was very small and not great. My husband had the stuffed lobster and it was horrible!! Was a lobster cut in half and covered in pasta. Did not taste good. Don't think they know what stuffed lobster is. My husband had been their many times and always said it was great. Just seems like they have gone downhill. But we will be back ONLY for the grilled oysters.

The food here is consistently good.  Enchiladas are delicious.  The green chili could use a spice boost and more green chilis.  The albondigas cured me of a cold, I swear!  I've never had anything bad here.
The wait staff is always attentive and pleasant.  Always accommodating to any customer's wishes.  Gene remembers our drink and food preferences every time.  This place has been here for decades and always delivers.

It is hard finding a good barber shop in Reno and this place by far is the best place there is in the Reno/Sparks area. Two friendly barbers who knows what they are doing. The price is about your average haircut price.

This review is not for beer, Yards has great beer. They should rethink their restaurant vision. To begin, we were stopped at the door and told to get in line outside in front of the building. People were smoking pot in line, it was a little awkward, really strange....why can't you go inside at 5pm? Is there a lack of stafff? Not enough room?  No explaination, no signs disappointing and COLD

Once in, staff was great! Very attentive, super nice. 

OK so the bathroom sitch...ughh
The bathrooms are in the back which is fine, EXCEPT, so is the kitchen, the wait staff ANDDD the computers sooo you are dodging wait staff right and left just to get back through a narrow hallway to pee. Once there it was a mess!!! Broken glasses all over the sinks, overflowing trash cans and paper all over the floor!  Why? It's the beginning of dinner hour on a Friday,  management should be on top of that easy peasy. Not.

So we ate expensive apps that were fair at best, and decided to go sit at the bar for one more beer.  Many seats just opened up, and we left one seat next to the service bar open. A manager came up to us and made us move over one seat towards the service bar. 
We were literally ON TOP OF THE SERVERS WITH EMPTY SEATS NEXT TO US!  At that point we got up and moved to the other side of the bar. REALLY?  I mean, if that was all that was available I understand but in all my years (it's alot) I never had someone tell me where to sit at a bar.
I am a local but I can only imagine how people from out of town view the city if this is an example, jeez 
Get it together people, I can drink your beer in finer establishments cheaper, especially at happy hour.
Stoped by when visiting the city and luckily found this and let me just its delicious!!! Quick stop, fast service, good spot to consider !

I have been sitting in the waiting room for 2 hrs. They say they accept walk in but I now know to schedule an appointment.  They will take every appointment that comes in before any walk in. I will say that the woman who took my blood was very good and did it on the first try which does not usually happen for me.

We love Tate's and have been customers for years! We love their pizza and are never disappointed. They also have a great outside dining area - so hard to find around here. If you're looking for a good, casual pizzeria, this is it!

Overall I had a fun experience here, in this unassuming strip mall storefront that opens out into a very nicely furnished pub area. It's not what you expect from the outside at all - the menu is actually upscale (as are the beer selections). Wouldn't hurt if they could update the building exterior. Maybe add a nicer-looking sign from the highway. Little things.

The food, a strong 4.5 stars. My friends had good reports back about crab chowder and the crab enchilada special. While in the middle of my two delicious beers I lit into the special burger of the day, which came with bacon, Gorgonzola, mushroom gravy, and something else I forget. I asked rare, it came out nice and just on the medium rare side of rare, which is really what I wanted. Heck, Courtney (our waitress) asked if I wanted it Pittsburgh rare (similar to "blue"), and so I bet they will do whatever you ask.

Side note: Courtney was awesome. She was a great sport and took everything in stride. She made me feel like the only patron even as she waited on my other 10 friends and other tables. I did have to ask for her once or twice but heck, that's life in a popular establishment. She got all of our orders right, only forgetting one beer on the evening (but not charging for it, and it wasn't mine so who cares!). Kudos to Courtney. If you know her, remind her about The Fest in Gainesville.

Anyway, if I can point to one main culprit for the slide to four stars, it's dessert. I had my heart set on the caramel cake, but apparently it was discontinued (Courtney mentioned that they should remove it from the menu, so it seemed like more than just being out). I tried the chocolate stout ice cream and it was unfortunately sitting in a sea of liquid. The texture of the remaining ice cream was rather icy. The other ice cream ordered did not appear to have these problems, so I'm inclined to blame it on the alcohol from the beer, but TSP may want to check their freezer temperature just in case. Food prices are a bit high but not outrageous enough for a star deduction, not to mention beer prices were very reasonable for the craft selections.
Great Place to Explore the Arts! I like the fact that this place is open until 9. So if you need an art fix, come on by. The staff is extremely knowledgeable. Musuem Hospitality at it's best!

I've given this place a couple of tries now and I just can't recommend it for anything more than a "quick fix" for a meal.  It's quick, it's safe, it's not unpleasant,  it's just some of the most boring food ever - so bland!  Admittedly, I make some mean Asian inspired meals, so I can be a bit harsh in critiquing such and I never expect meals to be traditionally flavored when dinning out...but this might be some of the blandest food I've ever had.  Unless your in a pinch, go elsewhere.  Especially since there are better places relatively nearby.  Sorry Hot Wok.
Favorite spot for coffee when I am in Nashville. Can't go wrong with the Foggy Haze! Service is friendly and attentive plus it is just a really cool looking place!

30 - 40 minute wait on a Wednesday night @ 7:30 seemed reasonable. Good news they just took our cell and texted us when our table was ready so we were able to go across the street for some music. Sat in a booth back by the kitchen, the service and the food was great. Catfish fish fry, Brussel sprouts (amazing), beet salad and some beers and we were very happy. Sides are large so share them we had plenty of leftovers. Will definitely visit again...amazing! Prices very reasonable.

We came into town several days before attending a New Year's Eve wedding. My husband did a bit of research and found Indeblue. 
What a fabulous find! The atmosphere was sophisticated and quiet. The wait staff was knowledgeable and service was timed perfectly.  The food was delicate and very tasty.  Each dish had its own unique flavor and the portions were generous but not overbearing.  Highly recommend this restaurant.
Ikkyu is great! The Tuna Don is very poular. Good ingredients, friendly staff and very reasonable prices. Thier ramen is highly addictive too.

I'm happy to have more Indian food available in downtown. I'd even been driving to their west location, this is so much more convenient for those of us nearer the city centre. Their 10% off pickup is a great incentive. The staff I've met so far have been super pleasant!

This place is definitely not a luxury inn by any means. The bathrooms are old and full of soap scum, the beds are uncomfortable, there is only a continental breakfast, and there are no complimentary items such as toothpaste. Instead you have to purchase them for way too much out of a vending machine. 

The front office man was nice and had a routine but was not the most professional looking individual. 

All im saying is that for the price of $180+ a night, I expect a lot more clean cut appearance, luxury ammenaties, and rooms that match the price.

the special (five-spiced prime rib with a wasabi potato cake) was so good that i tipped the chef directly for maybe the second time in my life.

hope to come here as often as possible.

As an event planner I understand firsthand the kinks and quirks of the first round of an event that you'll never know until you give it a try. Leading with this in mind, I thought the Carmel Christkindlmarkt did a fantastic job of creating a cozy and warm environment on the plaza of the Palladium. The German wooden booths combined with the ice skating rink in the center, raclette sandwich booth with Amelia's baguettes, gingerbread, hot cocoa, mulled Guhlwein, brats and sauerkraut from Joe's Butcher Shop and festive decor makes for a lovely winter wonderland. I loved seeing the integration of several Hoosier businesses like X'Chocal Art, Joe's Butcher Shop, Winzerwald Winery and Urban Chalkboard. Carmel has had an impressive increase in local and diverse businesses in the last few years and this event offered a taste of that.  I imagine next year they will spread out the space and add more food vendors to help with the flow and wait lines for eats and drinks. 

My only complaint would be the placement of the porta potties and the proximity of the smell to the funsies. All learnings for next year. Great work!

Just don't come here. The restaurant is dirty to start... literally every other table needs to be bussed. Our chargrilled oysters had too much Parmesan and then our crab dip literally came with chip pieces..apparently they don't serve whole chips. Sad to see former gem of New Orleans turn to shambles. Needless to say we didn't even order entrees. Oh yea I forgot to even mention we were told there was a 20 minute wait so we grabbed drinks at the bar. They couldn't be bothered to hold the table for us to finish our drinks so we had to wait an additional 25 minutes to even sit down. End of story we left hungry.

This little museum was a nice treat and located right on the University of Tampa. It was really cool to check out the local history. Went with my partner and our newborn. They did not allow us to take the stroller inside which makes sense since the museum is really tiny. So advice for parents with babies, BRING A CARRIER! There was also an audio tour that comes with the price of admission and it was very cool to get visual and audio stimulation. Had a little corner for kiddos to write to santa too!
Good food & atmosphere. It's large inside & out so you don't feel cramped. Delicious long islands!

Hands-down the best bread in St. Louis. My favorite fast-casual spot to dine-in or carry out. Friendly, family-owned with a wonderful product. Favorites include: Turkey and Swiss, Salsiccia and the Prince. Their catering division is wonderful as well-they did our wedding welcome party and our guests loved the Chicken Spiedini!

This is a great store in terms of size and inventory, but it's my second choice in local Dollar Trees, after Broomall. 

CONS:
I have found items at Broomall that the Media/Aston manager didn't know existed (luckily I could get item #s online). Also, the staff here is a lot less helpful or caring about stock inquiries over the phone, which is off-putting.

PROS:
Even with the chaos of 5 points, this location is easy-in / easy-out, and parking is always available (parking is a downfall for Broomall). Media/Aston does have a frozen section, which Broomall lacks. I don't use it though, so this doesn't help my rating. Last, the layout of Media/Aston is more spacious, and a lot less cramped than Broomall.

All in all, its about the stock to me. I'm going there to get what I need, and I am usually a little better satisfied at Broomall.

Great beer selection! I did the mix n match 6 pack. It's pricier than what I'm used to though. I love the selection of gourmet meat sticks. I'll definitely come back here to sit and have a beer some time!

Easily the best shrimp poboy I've had on either side of the river! The employees are very nice and work very quickly even when they have a ton of orders.  The fried eggplant is also pretty amazing, not over cooked and melts in your mouth.

I had a problem with my heating unit working properly. I couldn't get my regular guy out to look at it at the time so I called N.E.I. to come out. A man came out to look at it. He said I needed to replace some wiring. The charge was $250.00. (a bit high) I came home from work and had the same problem. So I waited for my other technician to come out and check it out. My mother board needed to be replaced for $150.00 (reasonable) I called called N.E.I. back to discuss it to see if I could resolve things and was told I would get a call back in a couple of days after he had a chance to talk to the technician. I waited for a week and no call back. I then called back myself. The guy said he replaced two contacts NOT ALL THE WIRING. This man was very rude and basically told me there was nothing he could do. So I basically got screwed out of $250.00 for replacing two contacts in my wiring. Highly disappointed! I don't recommend this company at all. (I'm leaving one star because you can't post a review without one.)
Relaxed atmosphere great staff a fantastic place to visit. You'll dig the Alice and Wonderland theme

I haven eaten here dozens of times over the years.  It has solid good food with nothing that is particularly special.  The service is consistently good.

The salad bar is basic but plentiful.

I eat here pretty often. I would recommend it for anyone in the area. Well kept restaurant. It is clean and has a nice atmosphere. The prices are a little high but there are limited food options in the downtown Gretna area so its not that much of an issue.

Normally I love Scheels but this last deal is getting a little depressing. I got fitted for new Irons and was told they would be here in a week to 7 days. Here we are 3 weeks later now they're saying 2 more weeks. I understand they have no control over the vendor but they should have done a better job researching it before they gave me time table. Customer service lady told "oh well, we'll have to contact you when they arrive " I would have waited till the spring to order them.

Great service and yummy food, and spacious...great decor inside and out. Very happy to have them in Germantown. I had the vegetarian bone broth and pork belly bao buns ...both were delicious. ....and of course the iced coffee :)

Our second visit, food was good, service was fast, fried chicken was very tasty, shrimp and grits were great. Seating is with others so expect that. Open design is a little bit loud but still a nice atmosphere.

I'm giving this 2 stars because my massage was great. I made an appointment for a deep tissue massage but when I paid apparently I got an aromatherapy massage. Regardless of how weird that was, it was a good message. My facial on the other hand was awful. I specifically asked the aesthetician if she did extractions for milias and she said yes- after an hour of just what get like getting my face washed and what I figured were extractions she told me she got some on my right cheek- the rest weren't ready and it's illegal in Pa to remove milia? So basically she picked at my skin and got nothing and left marks? Also the legal thing That's not true at all, my normal place does it and if it were illegal I'm positive they wouldn't advertise it. I told her I get welts, who doesn't know not to try and pop a welt? It stung and I said something but I she was nice enough so I just left. Waiting for someone to call me, I can't believe I paid for that but I also wasn't going to say something in a room w 3 people.

Excellent service and updated pricing.

I know what I love about First Watch: the open kitchen area, the green booth seats, the iced coffee, and the trifecta with a lemon ricotta pancake.

This time I had a server with bubbling personality. I wish I could remember her name, but she just radiated with joy. She suggested the hacienda hash for my mother, which was so good, I kept "tasting" it. I still ate my trifecta, but my meal was more expensive than it was at other First Watch locations.

 A trifecta with upgraded pancake and iced coffee was always ~$14 in the past, but this time the same items were ~$18. It might not seem like a big difference, but for $4 I could have had a fresh juice or millionaires bacon. The host tried to explain, but next time I'll just ask how much the upgraded pancake will cost before deciding.

We went on dec 4 th lunch time, and ordered from the menu, instead of taking the buffet.
Poori was flat like a chapati. Poori should be fluffy, blown up on both sides.
Chutney for rava Dosa was watery, tasteless. 
Traditionally chutney is supposed to be made with coconut. 
The other red chutney was watery, cold and tasted stale.

This is now our favorite Mexican restaurant in town! If you're looking for fresh flavors that "wow" you, great service in a serene atmosphere, this is the place.

We walked into Verde early on a Saturday evening and ordered shrimp and chicken dishes, not expecting too much. (They had warmly greeted this reservation-less couple which I found refreshing.) The restaurant itself was beautiful and incredibly clean, with eclectic music playing which we liked. Our waiter was super attentive and brought our drinks, and recommended items from the menu. But..it was the food that just blew us away! Chunky fresh-made guacamole with lime and our simple shrimp and chicken quesadilla dinners bursting with flavors. 

We have already rearranged a family gathering to meet here over the holidays. Verde -  Flavors of Mexico lives up to its name and is now our go-to for Mexican!!

Associate, Gabriel, actually is the one to get the 5 Star Review.  He took his time to thoroughly and patiently explain to me how to downsize from my antique tower computer and set up to a very streamlined computer/monitor combo.  He gave recommendations about a small printer and the pros and cons of each.  He introduced me to the art of streaming (yes, I am antique) and even wrote down for me all the steps I would need to take to get out of my old system into a new system AND WITHIN MY BUDGET.  When I am ready to purchase, I will definitely go to Officemax and ask for Gabriel....and you should too!  GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE and a feather in OfficeMax's hat for hiring him!

Went in for dinner and never had a problem before.   Tonight is my last visit.  They put the wrong name on my order and after 25 min i asked where my food was.  They were calling the wrong name and my food had been sitting out.  When i said i wanted it prepared again, i watched him nuke one of my plates.  This was totally unacceptable.  I got a refund and left to never return

The Cherry Hill Mall is the biggest Mall in the area. With it's array of stores and never ending updates, it's a destination spot for most shoppers. 

In addition to the many stores, Cherry Hill Mall has plenty of great food options. Most of these can be found along the outside of the mall, but there are also a few good spots inside. 

While the Mall is easy to navigate and well maintained, the parking lot is not. Your best bet is parking at one of the department stores then making your way to the rest of the mall.

Pin Wei is consistently excellent and one of our favorite restaurants around. The flavors are bold and ingredients always fresh and well portioned. I would say it's a notch above Han Dynasty and I absolutely love Han Dynasty. It's that good. The staff are wonderful and we have always had a great time when dining.

Update after trying more items! I had to change it to 5 stars instead of just 4... Not only are they extremely nice but I keep finding more and more food I love! The falafel wrap as usual is still amazing. I've tried their mudardara wrap which was flavorful. Today I decided to go back again and try out their beef shawarma wrap, and it was amazing. I'm usually not keen on eating meat often and I don't like ordering meat from restaurants, but I saw good things about it, so I decided to give it a go. It is SO flavorful, it's not lacking whatsoever and it was delicious. I also got the baba ganouj, which is also very good. This place just keeps getting better the more items I try off of their menu! My new favorite place to go.

I came here about a month ago, although I didn't find my dress here, I had a great experience! My consultant Amanda was very helpful and friendly. This boutique is very nice inside and I'd definitely recommend looking here!

I absolutely love this place and I actually forgot to leave them a review. I come here at least once a week. I haven't found a place with the service or toasted subs like they provide. This place was my replacement from the Quiznos that was closed across the street...out of all the options in the one mile radius of me (limberlost and Oracle) .They are always numero Uno!

I live about 80 miles away.  I have now bought two cars from this dealership.  Robert and Jason were great.  Robert stayed late to show me how the self-park feature works.  So glad he did because I needed it.  Jason did everything to get the car right.  And, they still have free donuts.

First time eating here, the salsa is fabulous, so good we got some to go. Wonderful fast and friendly  service. I had the flautus, yummy and my boyfriend had a cheesey chicken with beans and rice, excellent.  We will be back soon. Fabulous Mexican food!!!!

Really nice place! The food and flavors were solid and the experience was great. The bread and butter started the meal off nicely. We had the short ribs, copia, pompano, bacon veg, sunchokes, and brown butter tart. All were very good! Highly recommended!

The staff at the bar was very friendly and prompt to getting our drinks filled. Then we were seated and greeted by a very rude server, she made it seem as if we were one of six stables and we needed to hurry up with our order and was not very friendly about answering questions. I had the bone in ribeye and it was delicious the wedge salad and vegetables, my wife and son had the fish with vegetables and it was amazing. All the food was cooked to perfection, this would've been A five star review if the waitress was not so rude.

I had an absolutely divine hamburger experience. Everything about it was delicious. Of particular note was the fried Honduran cheese and the sweet plantain that were included in the sandwich. 

The tamarind juice drink made me shake my head in amazement. I had no idea what I was doing with it at home. This was excellent, I wish I could reproduce it. 

This place will be my regular refueling spot after landing in New Orleans.

Overpriced, Horrible staff, trained to rip you off, not help.

Asked about my motor not working. Off the bat it was "replace. $300 please"

Couldn't afford so searched around, talked to Naughton's, they recommended I change the capacitor ($28, good as new). 

RECOMMEND researching before you make a purchase. 

Also, never buy your poles, nets, or filters from Leslies. Go to Lowe's or Home Depot and pay literally half the cost for the exact same stuff
Fun time. The beer selection was great, live music and a food vibe. We shared different appetizers and the service was good... very friendly.

Creamistry has the creamiest, and most perfect texture to their ice cream. Cool vibe in there and you get to watch made-to-order ice cream being created. Really a cool process and something unique. Stop by if you're around lakeside mall. The owner came by the table and asked how everything was too - cool dude. I got one of the creation items: quantum coffee. It was the best coffee ice cream I ever had.  My new ice cream rec to anyone in NOLA.

We enjoy bringing the kids here for lunch or breakfast since it is so kids friendly. The menu is good for breakfast and for their delicious ice cream treats.
