The food is typical chain restaurant diner type, nothing is here is stand out special other than the fun desserts. My kids love the sundaes and the husband enjoys the Birthday Cake Friend-z. There is plenty of parking and the location is clean. The staff is friendly and welcoming and get your order in and out.
The service was excellent but our appetizers weren't great. Very cool bar set up with tons of craft brew choices.

Went for breakfast and was not disappointed!!! Excellent latte, tasty ommelette, and banging hash browns. Portions are generous and prices fair. The staff is friendly and super attentive! We will return for sure!

Hiring Hurricane Drain has been the one of worst decisions I've ever made in my life! I hired this company on 12/14/2017 to fix a broken kitchen drain line located beneath the slab.  Derek assured me that he would be able to fix it.

12:14/17:  He cuts through my beautiful hardwood floors and began drilling several holes into my foundation.  About half way through, he decided that he couldn't do it and abandoned the job, leaving holes in my floor.  He never refilled the holes in the foundation as stated on the estimate.  After this failure, he recommended a sink pump.  

12/15/17:  Derek Simons installs a sink pump under my kitchen sink.  One major problem is he completely destroyed my venting system in my attic in the process! He cut the vent pipe that extends from the roof and capped the end. The other piece of my vent pipe was then used to reroute the kitchen line to my master bath.  Fun fact:  this type of "repair" is unheard of!  Another fun fact: the vent pipe extending from the roof is filling with rain water because, well, it has NO WHERE TO GO due to him capping the end.  The weight of the water will eventually cause the pipe to crash through my ceiling because he didn't have the decency to secure it. 

Oh, but that's not the end.  

He removed a drain pipe in my kitchen, but failed to replace it.  Guess what happened next?  Major flooding!  Did he bother to fix the flooding?  No he did not.  In fact, I mentioned it before he left and he said, "monitor it and call me if it gets worse...It might be your water line".  My water line isn't leaking.  It's the gaping hole you left in my floor!  Everything was worse the following day (12/16/2017), so I texted him the picture and followed up with phone call.  He actually answered that time and told me, "I'm going to my wife's baby shower. I'll check it out tomorrow."  Sunday comes and he never calls nor did he show up.  I texted him more pictures because it's getting worse. He never responded.  I finally call a different plumber on Monday, 12/18/2017. 

The new plumber who saw the contraption in my attic and mess under my sink was flabbergasted!  He said he's never seen such terrible work in his 30 years of being a plumber.  

I regret hiring this company so much!!!  He never actually fixed what I hired him for, destroyed my property, and made everything much worse.  He just took my money and scurried off.  He refuses to return my money and honor the warranty. I not only have to spend more money to fix the original problem, but now have the added cost of repairing the damage he caused.  He kept saying he was helping me, but all he did was make everything worse. Unbelievable!  Please do not use this company for any type of service!
Food was delicious!! Thick patties, generous toppings. Great service too. Would come back if we lived in the area.

A great dinner out with family.  Large selection of draft and bottled beers- many local.  Didn't try any cocktails but many fun options on the menu.  
Some wanted burgers but they were out at 7:30 on Saturday night.  What?  
So we made the best of it and ordered things we may not have otherwise: 
Coconut Tofu!- spicy and sweet.  Fish and fries!- light sweet fish and crispy fries.  
Pork chop & Cheesy grits- creamy and savory. 
Scallops were done perfectly although a little on the bland side and over priced for the serving size.  
Trout Caesar salad was eaten til last bite.  
We started with a mascarpone tart with pickled/roasted onions.  Interesting flavors- served with lightly dressed greens.  Too full for dessert.  Maybe next time.  I want to back for a burger.

I don't know why I never wrote about this place sooner, I have been here sooo many times and I'm never disappointed. This has to be my favorite authentic mexican spot in maybe all of the city. I always used to think why are people huddling around a sketchy looking hut. BUT do not judge a book by its cover because this place has my favorite authentic tacos and quesadillas. The steak quesadilla is a must have. The thing that makes this place stand out the most to me is the salsa. I think it is a creamy salsa verde of some kind I don't really know but it is a GAME CHANGER. 
Not to mention how affordable the food is too. I could spend less than $10 here and still walk away satisfied.
We Love this restaurant. For 35 years we have eaten there. Believe it or not this is a great place for a large tasty hamburger.

Super cute store with super friendly and helpful staff. 

When I walked into the store I was greeted and immediately felt welcomed.

Huge vintage selection and decent prices. Hey

Terrible service. Sat for 10 minutes today and was not even acknowledge by anyone. And it got worse. A pair of young girls entered tjhe place and immediately got menus. So i stood and left that rathole.  Don't be fooled by the publicity, the only plus of the place is how cheap it is.  Service is extremely slow and seems they play favorites regarding service.  Also some of the servers are extremely rude.  I guess with their prices they will survive but they will never see a red cent from me ever again.

Typical of the service you get at Buffalo Wild Wings. I stopped in today for wing night. I don't have kids so I'm at the bar. The bartender is polite but, she doesn't know me so, I got my food and a beer and then she brings the receipt.  I never asked for it. It's not too busy at the bar. Maybe I might have another over priced beer but now it's like drink that and get out. The wings were good but the potato wedges tasted like they had been pre cooked and put back down in the dryer to warm. Wonder why they just sold out to Arbys. Customer service is dead here!

Great service and perfect fits customized for each customer. Shies, clothing, smart devices, earbuds, rollers and more. More expensive than ave. Lots if great events for all demographics and levels to promote healthy lifestyle without judgment. All around top notch merchant

This restaurant is nestled in a quaint little neighborhood atmosphere with lots of great jazz music around. You've got to go here and just sit and watch the people and listen to the music. A New Orleans must do.
We had the 1/2 rack ribs, smoked chicken wings, baked beans and coleslaw. ALL AMAZING!!! THE best bbq we have ever had!!

I came to the Springfield Mall Sunday which is only 6 days until Christmas . I was very very very disappointed to see they had absolutely no christmas directions in the mall , they didn't even have Christmas music playing in the mall & lastly with it being a week before Christmas Santa was gone by 6 o'clock . I will never come back to the this mall again . Their stores aren't even good either . Very disappointed !

It was our last day in Nashville!!!! Great music scene...but was tired of the bar food. And the much anticipated Puckett's was a disappointment...

We stumbled upon the Stillery....not your typical Nashville restaurant. This place could be in any up and coming city neighborhood. The food is handmade...including the pizza dough and CHEESE...yes I said cheese. Amazing!!! 

I had the shroom and hanger steak pizza with white cheese sauce....I thought I could never finish the whole pie...but it was so delicious and fresh I ate the whole thing...within the greasy bar food indigestion lol

Meggan our waitress was from Massachusetts and so attentive. She knew about everything on the menu and her suggestions were right on. 

One of the main reasons I would visit Nashville again...and we went to the Garth Brooks Concert Worl Tour!!!
Consistently good pizza. Always ready on time, this is definitely my new pizza place.

I always love mom and pop taco places. This place uses fresh ingredients and what I like about hem most, is that they give you the autonomy to determine how much spice you want. 

I got the following: 
- Chorizo: crispy and flavorful
- Al Pastor: right amount of pinapple but pork could have a tad more flavor
- Sesina: was a bit extra crispy and a tad over grilled but still very good
- Fajita: doesn't really represent fajita ingredients but was very good

Most tacos are $2.00 and the most expensive is $2.50. This place is priced extremely well for the size of their tacos. I also like how they have a wide variety of Mexican drinks which is great 

Why my 4: The main complaint here is that is that we (group of 3 individuals) waited a solid 35-minutes to have our food brought to the table. At the time, we were only only the 2nd table with people.

The jalapeño wontons were incredible, my favorite part of the meal actually. I ordered the hot chicken and fries and my boyfriend ordered the hot chicken pie. The order of chicken was huge, we easily could've shared it. The hot chicken pizza had a really great white sauce on it, and I would definitely recommend it.
O my went one time but the dishes we tried were great!  Nice home cooked food experience, home in the wall place

Really well-cooked whiting, but DO NOT GET EXTRA SPICY. Mac and cheese could've been a little more flavorful, the greens could've been a little less salty. My girlfriend and I both got Hot fish / chicken (the second spiciest level), and it was pretty tough for us: two spice lovers! So be careful!



Five stars for quality of friedness and spiciness - they do not hold back. And for the wonderful woman working there tonight.

After living in Vegas for a while, my boba standards have become a bit higher; this place does just the trick. My problem with Reno boba is that their boba is not that chewy! They're usually on the firmer side, but Bubble Tea Station Café have perfected their tapioca pearls. The pearls are the right amount of chewy and gooey, making them have a great bite. 

Now for their drinks, they are delicious! The honeydew snow is very flavorful and you can really taste the fruitiness of it. The Thai tea is also good; the only complaint I had with this drink is that it tasted a bit watered down. I'm sure it was a fluke in the making of the drink, and I'll be sure to update my post the next time I have this drink.

What I also like about this boba spot is that you can adjust the sweetness of their drinks! All of the Vegas boba spots have this as an option, so it's great to finally see this option in the Reno/Sparks area.

They also have a variety of sweet treats, from the Filipino Casava cake to Baklava. I wasn't able to try any of these at this time, but they all looked delicious!
Incredibly slow service. Waiting over 25 minutes to get my order. This is not fast food

The hotel is good, but the restaurant is a mess for breakfast. First we were told they may not have space for five. A table for four was converted to a table for five but the leaves didn't lift up appropriately, leaving an angled surface that threatened having our meals slide into our laps. $6 grapefruit juice is actually some unappealing grapefruit "drink."  Two of us were given coffee without asking for it. Food was fine; service inattentive.

Delicious plates and great service. I had the sausage & kale soup and the honey seared tuna, both were fantastic, especially the tuna - completely unique taste with the beer puree. Service was great - sat at the bar and both bar tenders were super friendly and attentive. Food is a little on the pricey side, but worth it.

Can't say enough good things about this establishment. Due to a mistake entirely of my own fault, I neglected to order rice with my butter chicken (I didn't see that it had to be ordered separately). I believe it was the owner (or one of his very nice employees) who drove to my condo to drop off a separate order of rice at no extra charge. I can't believe it - amazingly good service.

The food was amazing as well! Creamy butter chicken sauce with perfectly cooked, large chunks of chicken... I'll definitely be back to Namaste.

Wing night was a great idea. Super cheap, extra crispy. Two of the most important qualifiers in my opinion. Atmosphere was perfect too, just me and the lady enjoying smokes and pitcher of beer on the patio. Good times, lots of laughter.

I believe this place is now closed!

We ate there when it was a couple of months old.  We were left sitting waiting on a waitress for over 15 minutes.  Finally a manager noticed - apologized and sent a waitress.  She continued to give poor service.  That in itself was enough not to return.

Daughter and son in law went after us and said they would not return.
Great food and fun decor. A little out of the way in a strip mall, but plenty of parking.
Knockers! Knockers! Knockers! So good. Wings were average and the beer choices were ample. Lots of fun to watch Sunday night football at.

The sushi is fresh and made to order. I have an allergy to avocado and they are always accommodating to ensure it's not in my sushi. I've been here several times and the food has been good each time from soup to rice to sushi. The rock shrimp tempura is amazing g!! My only complaint is the restaurant is always cold.
I love using the App! I like watching the play by play tracker and the pizza is always warm and fast!

I was in a bit of a hurry so they said my best bet was to order biscuits and gravy. I truly enjoyed it and loved the biscuit so much I ordered one to go. They are pure perfection. I also grabbed some cookies to share with my coworkers and they loved the chocolate chip with sea salt! Delicious.

Love this place!  The atmosphere, menu and aromas are amazing. It is ALWAYS busy so I don't recommend being in a hurry if you have not already put your name in line on the "No Wait" app. You will wait but it is worth the wait. I highly recommend sitting at the bar and watching the kitchen magic! Very entertaining and the fun to watch.

They do everything right..."hello" with a smile as soon as we walked in.   Immediate seating and service.  Server took our drink order, told us the specials, and brought our coffee to the table quickly.
We had very tasty, creamy omelet with bacon, cheese, avocado tucked inside.  Also had the made to order, steel cut oatmeal with banana, pecans, and strawberries...delish.
Service was outstanding.  Food was wonderful.  
When can we go back?!

Well, we went back today, 12/8.  What a difference a couple of days makes.    Started well...seated immediately, drinks right away, order quickly taken.  One frittata with veggies, including onion.  Singling out the onion because you don't expect to have several slices of onion skin included, which this one did.   We compare it to something like finding a hair or two, just not quite as gross.
Also ordered bacon, egg, cheese sandwich with side of well done potatoes  Asked for eggs over medium but still runny.  Got eggs over well, nothing runny about them.  Normal potatoes, not well done.

Pointed out the pieces of onion to waitress who said she let her manager know.  We stuck around for several minutes but no manager came by to comment, apologize, or offer a discount.
Maybe I'm expecting too much of today's managers.  They're too busy or lack the customer service training, or worse, they don't care?
If rating restaurant today, it would be a 3 1/2 star.

I absolutely love hummus and Mediterranean food!  The food was flavorful, fresh and well-prepared!  I loved the tomato and cucumber salad!  The lamb platter was fantastic!  

The Lamb soup was incredible!!!  

My husband and I wanted a low key Saturday evening.  The prices were reasonable.   

We will return!

Had switched over to them from another nail place, nails were done nicely other then the nails being polished like crap, but only last a weeks before I needed a fill in and they did it but not good at all, again didn't last, I have cracking and nails that look like their going to fall off any second. It's sad the guy is very nice and very hospitable but doesn't seem to pay very much attention to work. In search of another nail salon again now. Why can't I find one that's nice and worth it.

Independent Jewelers is the best service you will find in this industry. Their state of the art location is huge and selection even better. Been dealing there for almost 30 years. Will always  go back. Also the selection is unreal. If you can't find what you need here you are in trouble

We ordered the grill at the table. Ribs chicken steak and sausage. The wings and ribs were delicious. We had the baked beans and corn too. It was the perfect amount for the two of us. We also had drinks and desert. Bag of donuts. Yummy !!! The wait for the food was long. Granted Saturday night but still. We would come back!

Mom and dad were in town for the holidays and we decided to give Shells a try.  House margarita was excellent, food was above average and prices are very fair, but our server Sarah was exceptional.  Have been in the area for over 5 years, best service we've had since we've been here.  We will return and recommend.

It's nice to have an option in the middle of the most residential area of Carmel.  Bonus points for it not being another pizza or burger place.

I've only been there once so far.  I thought the portions were of good size; big without being overwhelming.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that I was being picky about the ribs being a bit overdone.

Also interesting are their sauces.  The two I tried had different hints of fruit.  One was like apple and the other like citrus.

Nice little bakery with delicious, fresh breakfast sandwiches in the Garden District. Friendly, prompt service. Excellent pastries. A good place to spend a lazy morning. Very good coffee too. A nice place for locals. Tourists staying in the area are well advised to check it out.

I've used this location for tire work, oil changes, etc. multiple times without incident, and have been pleased with their customer service.
Yesterday, I called to confirm an appointment to get tires switched to snow tires, oil change, and headlight replacement. I asked the technician whether it would be a problem if he could leave the key under the floor mat so that I could pick the car up after they closed at 6pm.   He assured me that leaving the key under the mat would be no problem.
At 5:30, I called to confirm that I would, in fact for sure not be there until after 6, but would the work be done by 6, and would the key would be left under the mat.  
The new manager reacted wirh surprise, and explained she could not allow the key to be put inder the mat after hours because of liability and theft concerns, despite what her employee had told me.
This required that I change my transportation plans to go back and get my car immediately.   I had to call for an Uber (rather than rely on a friend who got off work after 6pm) so that I would be there before they closed at 6 p.m.
I arrived via Uber, with the cost associated with, shortly before 6 pm. Although they were now closed, my car was not ready until well after 6:30 pm. When I explained that my car had been promised to be ready at 6 p.m. and that I thought they wouldn't wait because of them closing at 6 pm, I was cited corporate policy about leaving key under the mat, what a liability that was, Etc.
I explained that now I had waited longer than promised and could have had my friend pick me up to take me to get my car, without incurring extra expenses because of their false deadlines and refusal to work with me by leaving a key under the mat.
I was again cited corporate policy, they were not willing to be responsible for my car theft, Etc. ad nauseam.
All the manager had to do, was to tell me that they could not in the future leave my key under the mat, but that they would be willing to wait for me until 6:30 p.m.  That way, I would have understood their future policy, and had a reasonable solution to come get my car after hours. 
The manager seemed so unreasonable to work with, citing nothing but corporate policy, concern about responsibility for car theft, etc.
I simply refuse to do business with a branch location of a major corporation, who hires "robots" who simply want to cite corporate policy, and won't work with their customers.
I do not recommend having your car repaired at this location, unless you want broken promises and the threat of having your car impounded unless you happen to have a spare key ready to use to pick up your car after hours. Giant FAIL.

I absolutely love Trader Joe's- this location gets very busy on the weekends and the parking lot can be a crazy place, but the staff is always helpful and nice and the food selection is great. On one occasion, I bought zucchini noodles that happened to already be bad, despite the future expiration date (hence the four stars) but for the most part, this location is great.
One of the best authentic Chinese food in Tampa. My favorites are the Beijing double cooked pork and the dong po rou. These are the best version I had so far and I highly recommend people to try it.

Good Spot to Grab some Tacos and Drinks!  The Salsa here is definitely fresh and delicious.  I ordered a Grilled Chicken Taco and the Chorizo Taco. The Chorizo taco is good, but warning the spices will sneak up on you. I also had the grilled Chicken Taco, but I felt that particular taco lacked some flavor. I also was able to sample the Sangria, which was pretty good. The service was friendly and speedy.

At first I was very skeptical about this restaurant, but when I ordered my single slice and tried the 1st bite, it was AMAZING. The crust was very crunchy but not burnt, the cheese was good. I'm very picky when it comes down to the tomato sauce pizza places use but this one tasted pretty delicious. I give them a five star rating

I used to shop at this location quite regularly, however it has been a while as I've found less need to shop in malls for clothing as of late. I do still enjoy browsing in this store location and my most recent visit was no exception, however I didn't buy anything because I didn't truly need anything at the time. Ricki's has historically been a staple of my wardrobe with their relatively affordable fashion. I do miss the times when they used to carry short length jeans, but I do like their pants selection in general and still own a few pairs of slacks from Ricki's, even many years after I've purchased them.

Tonight I had the Lobster roll & Threesum roll. Threesum is supposed to have avocado.. Nope. Nothing on top of my roll at all. Both taste fine, I'm just disappointed. Used to get the lobster roll and it was huge and delicious. Now it's skimpy on the lobster and not impressive at all for $16. Sad :(

Lobster Mac n cheese is worth the $10.95 and the burgers are excellent too! We tried the Hunger Burger and the Fun Guy Burger. Service was fast, friendly and the food is fresh and made to order. We love coming to the Reading Terminal whenever we visit Philly. Now we know where to get the best Mac n cheese. Kudos to the "parties with a purpose" also, it's great to see them participating in positive efforts to end world hunger.
My favorite hibachi and best yum yum sauce. Lunch specials are the best bang for your buck.

I've given this Kneaders location four chances because I really wanted them to be good, but each time was progressively worse, culminating in a 16-minute drive-thru debacle because they wouldn't pull up the ridiculously large order in front of me. Instead they made all of us behind this 4-bag order wait for all that time. Even if their service at counter and drive-thru didn't suck egregiously, the Lilliputian meat portions on all of their sandwiches leave you with nothing more than a big bread sandwich. I give two stars because even though their service is unforgivably bad, they apologize for it. It's as if they know they suck but no one there has the managerial skills to turn things around. It's really too bad because they could do so well in this neighborhood if they put some more meat on the sandwiches and sped up their service times.
They changed ownership to Carmike and are also playing current movies. I enjoy going there with the Mrs. because of the location and the prices.

Love this Pizza. And they have something for everyone. Gluten free crust if that is important to you. Vegan and vegetarian options as well. But many yummy options for meat lovers too ! I am fortunate to live nearby Ozona Pizza so have sampled quite a few of their menu offerings . Always amazing !

I met Mega while on vacation in 1998.  I was in the throes of an MS episode that flared up from my trip across the country.  Having never experienced energy work at that time, I gave it a go.  Needless to say, I found immediate physical relief but more importantly it began my journey to self healing in a significant way.   Proudly, I am free of MS today and have been for 17 years (diet change, healing work both emotional and physical were part of the routine).  Over nearly 20 years, I have worked intermittently with Mega and other healers to help clear deep layers of emotional and spiritual wounds that led to dis-ease in my body.    It is my firm belief that no one heals without their own commitment to doing so, leaning on someone for a miracle is not the way out.   This is a principal that Mega clearly shares with me.   She is grounded (which is not always easy to find in a healer), she is VERY skilled (and I have been to many people), she is deeply caring, she just IS magnificent.   I am sincerely blessed to have found Mega on my path.

Atmosphere was great and so was the service. Beer was just okay, in my opinion. Pretzels were delicious but neither my husband or I were impressed with our entrees. I would definitely try this place again and would recommend to others but would probably stick to appetizers and drinks.

I will never go back to nice nails. I am so glad Cindy Diamond is at Andy Nails
 She is awesome along with the rest of the team. Nice nails has become such an angry place to go
I will be a faithful customer now to Andy Nails

Packed on a Sunday evening, so reservations a must. Shrimp and chips, blue salad, and shepherd's pie were our choices. Only the shepherd's pie was a bit disappointing, much more mashed potatoes than meat and veggies, in a shallow dish (the photo above). Still reasonable in price overall, though.

My husband and I had a great time staying at the Kimpton Canary hotel for our Babymoon! We loved the funky boho-type decor and the hotel felt very clean and nicely updated. It's just around the corner from State Street, so you're able to get out and walk around downtown, but there's not the feel of being SMACK in the middle of downtown. It's a nice escape. 

The complimentary wine at check-in (for my husband, none for me for another few weeks) was a nice surprise as was the complimentary happy hour every day in the lobby with free wine and appetizers. They also had a spread of coffee, tea, and biscotti each morning and different flavored fruit water each afternoon. Also, tiny thing, but the valet opens the door for you every time you enter/exit! Nice touch! The restaurant in the hotel is called Finch and Fork and we LOVED our waiter...dang it! I can't remember his name, but he was so witty and entertaining that we came back to the restaurant again the next night and requested to be sat in his section. He was so sweet to give us a complimentary toasted milkshake to celebrate our baby...you MUST have this when you're there. It's amazing!

We probably enjoyed the rooftop most of all! It was very relaxing, had great views of Santa Barbara, several areas to sit and relax, heating lamps, and a nice fireplace. This is the only dog-free zone in the hotel, so it was a nice getaway to just relax at any time of day.

The only bummer about our stay was that in the room next to ours, there was a very YAPPY little dog who was left in the room all afternoon and barked for three straight hours (probably more, but we had left for dinner by then). It kind of killed the relaxing vibe we had going! But, we notified the hotel during our checkout, and they took $150 off our bill for the inconvenience! So nice and not at all what we were expecting since it wasn't the hotel's fault of course! We just notified them of the issue so they knew some people abandon their dogs in their rooms for extended periods of time. Why even bring your dog with you? Whatever.

Thank you so much for a great stay! We'd love to return someday!
Great furniture, service & value! A pro in the furniture business for decades. Trustworthy & friendly! Low delivery charge. Check it out!!
Frick and Frack running the grill.  Used to be run by a lady named Rose.  She had her stuff together.  These two clowns couldn't dress themselves.  Service slow.  One order at a time

This place is kind of ratchet not going to lie first time going out on the town and little disappointed that this is what I have to work with in my new town.  Boise is such a hidden gem where all the hotties I see during the day? Every dude in here is like 5'4
This is our favorite sushi restaurant. The food is so fresh & the staff is so attentive. The delight rolls are my favorite. Ignore the strip mall location- it's so good.

The tempura shrimp and vegetables was really good. I thought the sauce that came with it was way too sweet. I got a spicy tuna roll and 1 order of salmon Nigeri. The salmon was okay. The spicy tuna was terrible! Such a bad flavor I literally didn't eat it.

We had a GREAT time cruising with Royal Caribbean. 

We've cruised before with Carnival and loved that as well, but definitely liked Royal Caribbean best!

The food is super amazing. The staff is super friendly, attentive, and caring. They remember your name after one meeting and it really blew us away. 

Carnival had a lot more kids on board where Royal Caribbean didn't have as many. We don't mind either way, Royal Caribbean just seemed more for adults. They did have a lot of kids activities as far as "clubs" that they could hang out with other kids, though. 

We sailed on The Brilliance of the Seas which is an older ship from 2003 and it was awesome. We were told if we loved that ship that we should try one of the bigger ones coming in 2018! And we definitely will be. 

The only downside is the all inclusive drink packages are extremely expensive, that's my only reason for 4 stars. The drink package per person was almost as much as the cruise ticket itself. Don't get me wrong it's still worth it if you plan on drinking because single beverages are expensive.

First time having a DiBella Sub. A small meatball sub, cheddar and sour cream chips, and cherry coke. Sub had much more meat than subway. Pretty good flavor with mozzarella and parmesan cheese. I think I liked the bread much more then subway too. Little more expensive. Slightly over 10$ but very filling for lunch. Now I need a nap.
Ive eaten here many times.  Great really fresh food and great staff.  Highly recommended..
Wow! Super cheap to get your eyebrows threaded, and the results last a crazy amount of time. It's been a month and other than minor touch ups I haven't needed to go back.

I rarely give five stars but Cafe Seventy Two was that good. My husband and I went last Sunday for a late brunch and were starving so we started out with the pork roll fries and lemon ricotta donuts with blueberry compote. They were amazing!! Both came out of the kitchen hot and fresh, the donuts were more like balls, a crunchy exterior and light cake filling, and were perfectly matched with the compote. I don't usually like pork roll but the fries they made were delicious, salty and crunchy.

For our main course we both ordered short rib specials. I had the Benedict and my husband had the tostada. They were very different dishes and both were fantastic. The Benedict was served on a piece of Texas toast which was able the support the heaviness of the short ribs and eggs, yet still taste crunchy. I loved the whole combination and it was really nice comfort food for a winter day. The tostada was also very good but a little lighter with a smaller amount of short rib and a nice salsa on top. Not only was the food good but the staff was nice and friendly (we sat at the counter). Even though it's almost a half hour drive we are hoping to go back once or twice a month!  So glad we found this place!
Good atmosphere. Good plate size. Well balanced flavours. Would recommend for nice date night or coming with a few friends.
I'm so delighted with this cafe. It's exactly what Yardley needs. The atmosphere is lovely, and the staff is very friendly (and very hip).

Petco has great grooming g services! I called up on a Sunday as a new customer and Marschelle did a great job of getting us in same day. She really listened to our concerns and did exactly what we wanted with the cut for our pup.  The staff was very caring and friendly.  I would recommend their services as they are very kind and efficient!

We finally gave Ron's a try. It is a small hole in the wall place so be prepared to wait if you have a large party or it's the busy time of the day. We had a party of 5 so we had to wait a few for tables. My mom got the gumbo and a side of potato salad. My husband and son got the fried chicken and my daughter and I got the gumbo and 1/2 a poboy. The gumbo is good. It's not the best I've had but I'd go here again and order it. I love potato salad and theirs it good, especially if you want to try it in your gumbo. The poboy bread is not the typical poboy bread you find elsewhere in the city, it's on the soft side with no crispness. The fried chicken takes awhile to make so be prepared to wait longer to be served your food if you order it. My husband and son enjoyed their 3 piece of chicken. Overall we had a good experience and the food was good. The waitresses we very attentive even though they had a place full of people and only 2 of them.

Very appealing menu. We ordered the wild salmon, sesame chicken, crab cakes and mushroom soup. The salmon was like teriyaki style- very delicious taste and it seemed freshly made not out of a bottle or mass produced. Freshly made. Portions were generous. Crab cakes were crispy and delicious. Mushroom soup was hot and delicious with bits of tofu. Nice flavors and colors. Everything freshly made. I would definitely recommend this place  the menu isn't huge and I'm happy about that. If it was too big then they would have to used frozen food with processed sauces. I enjoyed the food here very much!! Cute chocolate fortune cookies . Old school charms and a statue of the famous lucky cat welcomes you inside. (Maneki neko.) common in Chinese restaurants, I know!!(^^) in glad I tried this place.
All I can say is amazing food!  It was nice being able to find a healthy, amazingly delicious food while visiting Tucson.

Customer service is really lacking. If they stepped it up, they'd sell more merchandise. I left and came back hoping I'd have a better experience, nothing. Due to I was determined I approached a gal that was helping someone else and she jumped in to help both of us.  She was overly delightful and very knowledgeable. 

This is a standard boot barn. If you have one at home, they probably sell the same thing. I have several near my house, but I wanted a souvenir pair of boots. There are many boutique stores in the city, but you have to drive to each one and spend the time. I didn't have a car. I looked in Opryland and they had a great selection of boots, but a bit higher end then I was looking for. This store sold boots in my price range and I was able to find a pair that appealed to me.

Worst meal I've ever eaten. Oysters were old and appeared to come from the deep freezer. Don't waste your time coming here. Also got hosed on add-ons. The manager was unprofessional and rude. Refused to offer discount for oysters that were absolutely inedible.
Shrimp and grits for a savory breakfast was great! Can't wait to come back to try some of the other dishes (that looked really good)!

Dishonest Business

My tires were wearing on the outsides so I took my van in to get an alignment. after an inspection, they said I needed new lower ball joints and wheel bearings and gave me a quote for around 200$. I had it checked out and the ball joints were fine and the wheel bearings just needed a little adjustment. took it in the next day and they were happy and did the alignment. a few months later I notice the tires were still wearing improperly. I ended up doing the alignment myself and in the process, I found that not a single adjustment was made when I took it into Big Brand Tire despite them having given me a results sheet with different before and after measurements.

Whenever I have a guest visiting from out of town this is the place that I take them.  Their burger of the month is always good, even if the description doesn't sound like it should be!  Our office always goes on Monday's to get the buy one get one 1/2 off deal.  They need to put the Crab Rangoon burger on the menu permanently!

I frequent Oishii Poke fairly often but I am disappointed to say that my experiences have been getting worse and worse with each trip. The ingredients are fresh and the food is delicious, but they are becoming far too stingy with their portion sizing and shorting bowls. On my most recent trip, I was quite literally given a half-full "Large" size bowl (see pictures). For nearly $12, this is absolutely unacceptable. I understand that mistakes happen occasionally, but this has unfortunately become a recurring trend with this establishment. Please work on remedying this or you will have lost another customer.

The food here is exquisite regardless whether you're grabbing quick breakfast, coffee break snack or upscale casual dinner. The cocktails are lovely and unexpected in what at first appears to be a bakery coffee house.
Great staff. My boyfriend couldn't stop sayin how nice they are in there! Will be back very soon. Great cheese pizza & garlic knots (need more garlic, we'll just ask for extra garlic next time!)

Hummus Fresh is a great restaurant with delicious food! They offer tons of vegan and non-vegan options. Everything is made fresh and the staff is very friendly. The location is fantastic and is very accessible. If you are looking for a quick and healthy lunch this is a great option!
Although I have not lived nearby in many years, Cajun Seafood is a must go to when I visit. The poboys are delicious and we are NEVER forgotten.

Excellent kind staff .It was crowded.We only had to wait 10inutes .An amazing Menu with daily specials .This California girl is happy ! My husband has Celiac Disease .Only thing .It would be perfect if they had a special toaster for gluten free bread they have on hand .He could not have any toast .
Friendly service - great food and great portions. Can't complain! Will definitely be back soon! Had the tika Marsala and loved it.

Did a haunted tour with Sandy and she was the best one we've had since we've been here taking multiple tours. Her enthusiasm her energy and her jokes were great. She kept the tour alive and I would recommend her.
Clean, quiet.....very nice and prompt staff. Benedict Special was unique, AND very delicious!

This place SUCKS! The waitress was awful. The waitress mentioned Jasmine tea during ordering as if that's what she'd be serving, but delivered community tea in a dirty cup. All 3 orders were placed at the same time. The first 2 plates arrived to the table 5 minutes apart. We had to ask for the 3rd plate. 20 minutes later, I cancelled my soft she'll crab wrap, even though I had been in search of softshell crab since my arrival in the city.  The Manager was unconcerned and unapologetic when she arrived at the table for a brief list of our concerns. I dine out often at a healthy mix of establishments so I know my experience  was completely unacceptable. Now I understand why the place was empty. My table was the only table assigned to my waitress, and she & the manager were still able to create an unpleasant dining experience.
Friendly, helpful staff. Not the kind of place that makes you feel like a noob if you're a first-time buyer. The staff was knowledgeable and they had a good selection. Definitely recommended.

I think ALL the Two Stones locations are over priced for below average food. I have been to 4 of their different locations to "test" my review. 
Unfortunately, I I have confirmed that the food is in fact below average. They seem to have an excellent menu writer. But, any item I have ordered does not live up to the menu description and I am ALWAYS disappointed.
Sorry Two Stones, you're a "0" in my book!
Prompt and professional.  Mark communicated frequently, was reasonable, and cleaned up leaving everything finished.

Worst customer service ever.  There are progressive hipsters, and then there are asshole hipsters.

Nothing but shitty-look-giving folks running this spot

Trust the reviews on this place. Came here on a Tuesday around 5 and sat at the bar. Seating is tight and goes fast, but most good places do. Ordered the blueberry cocktail and you couldn't taste the  liquor (always a good and bad thing). I went with the mac and cheese with hot chicken and let me say I ate every bite dispite being full. Friendly staff with great ambience, this place is definitely worth the visit!
Just shared two burgers the bacon jam and Korean...two awesome burgers and our waitress Katie was very nice and patient with us as First-timers @3kingpublichouse

I returned a toy my wife purchased to the store.  It was most remarkable - the lack of attention to customers in line, the immature attempt to not notice the three customers in the return line.  I understand the individuals that are hired at this compensation level but those employees should understand the way out is to provide a better experience.  Sad, never again.

Atmosphere is nice. It is a great place to go to grab a drink and chat. Food is nothing special. With so many outstanding places to go in South Philly I would choose another place if you are coming for dinner.

Kenza was wonderful. My wife and I were able to put our kids to sleep tonight knowing they were bug and nit free. She taught us what we need to do for preventative measures and how to check heads in the future. We hope to never have to deal with this again but if we do we will call you for sure. We will share your card and number with friends who need it. Thank you Kenza! The McLellan Family

My husband ALWAYS asks to go here.  So today we did and it did not disappoint.  They have great food and beer.  It is a little pricey for food but I will say it's good.  We had an awesome Porter and some cheese steak empanadas with truffle gravy.
At last ! Liquid nitrogen ice cream comes to Philly !!!!! I didn't get a chance to try it when I was Los Angeles recently. So I was super excited to see this cafe. It didn't disappoint!
Housekeeping is fast and efficient and the staff calls me for feedback and satisfaction the day after my home has been cleaned, overall I'd recommend their services.

So tasty!! Came here with my friends on vacation and had the sweet & salty cookie dough with the salt caramel ice cream. The scoopers were friendly and answered all my questions. I would definitely recommend it!

My job these days is one where I can't exactly leave the joint without the drunk babies burning it down so I rely on delivery experiences when I'm desperate for something more than the apple and peanut butter health jam that I packed myself in a moment of fit-spiration. Thanks to Yelp's fabulous Eat24, I discovered Outlaw Pizza. 

My experience is based on delivery only, but I've sampled my way through the menu and had a variety of customer service experiences. 

Let's start with the main hurdle: how is the customer service if you've never actually been to the joint? Well, friends, the customer service is great. Just tonight, I ordered an appetizer they'd sold out of. I got a super prompt, super polite phone call from someone at the shop asking if I'd like to sub in one of the other items from their menu that was the same price. Sure! Let's do it! The suggestion wasn't pushy, either. I could tell that they wanted to make me happy as a customer. I would love to try my original selection (stuffed mushrooms) when they are back on the menu since they seem to be a fan favorite. 

How's the bike delivery, you ask? It's great! Their bikers vary, but all of them are fast and kind. I make a point to tip them really well because I appreciate that they are out there on bikes, often braving weather I don't want to brave. This may result in my food getting a priority in delivery rotations because my orders always come before they are expected. Love it. (Pro-tip: if you use Eat24, you can tip before your order even arrives which will result in prompt attention if you are a tidy tipper.) The single hitch with delivery is that you can't order a pizza for delivery...but you can order a calzone with the same toppings! Probably better! 

But suz, I'm just here for the food. Well, cool, me, too. And it's good. There are some parts of the menu I don't understand yet (Pizza beignets? Nah. I ordered them tonight, and I did not get it.), but there are other parts that are firing on all cylinders like the speciality combos and the mozzarella logs. Those pizza/calzone options are both named thematically and really great. I order the Unforgiven (artichokes, mushrooms, kalamata olives, red sauce, cheese) as often as I can, and my co-workers steal it from me just as often. This is a damn fine calzone. The crust is also different from most of the crusts in NOLA, and I appreciate that quite a lot. 

Having cooked at a lot of spots, I do recognize that the team at Outlaw is pushing to get the food out without the perfection of a fine dining spot. Things will come out a little more or less done or a little burnt on the edge or whatever. It's not supposed to be Antoine's, though. This is a neighborhood joint, not that stuffy place your grandma took you when she turned 80. We have to acknowledge the difference and feel a little weird about it all at once. But eh. We've all been that cook that is trying to do a great, from-scratch menu at a joint that is casual enough to not fully care. 

I really appreciate that Outlaw is doing something a little different here in the NOLA pizza scene. They haven't knocked my #1 pizza joint (Magazine Pizza) off the top spot, but I've been calling Outlaw more and more lately. Perhaps it's possible to love two things equally, hrm? 

Accessibility notes: online ordering available.

A great little neighborhood market with great sandwiches. I ordered the Italian hoagie and it was delicious. Every ingredient was sliced fresh in front of me, the delicious meats were piled on, and the arugala provided a great contrast.

I had taken a couple of trips to New Orleans without seeing City Park, and upon arriving I was genuinely impressed. The sheer scope of the place and variety of activities it offers are beyond what I'd write in a review. It's free in a town that really likes to bleed you of your money. Notably, a streetcar runs from the center of the city to the corner of the park in a reasonable amount of time, making this one of the city's few transit-friendly locales. The art gallery at the end of the streetcar line is as yet on my to-do list, but the island in the center of the park makes for a nice walk, and I would be thrilled to use its sporting facilities.

And it's also easy to drive to and has an abundance of free parking. My only real disappointment is that the park wasn't built all the way to Lake Ponchartrain (one residential area sits between the park and the water), but that isn't going to change. As it is, the park is a place I'm hoping I'll visit regularly.

What a complete and total price gouging establishment. Growler of Victory IPA $19.99 !  Even Iron Hill's specialty growlers are only $17.  Shop elsewhere, save your money.  Try Tollgate Liquors, wayyy better pricing.

Nah I wasn't thrilled with the quality if the food or taste. I had the chicken and artichoke dish.  The chicken was rubbery and the flavor if the butter was off.  I didn't try to pie bit they did look pretty good.  I am from Cali and I would compare it to a Denny's !

Blackened grouper was perfectly done....better than other my husband has sampled this trip. Flaky and tasty!!  The crab cakes were divine with the house made roumalade!!  Our waitress was quite attentive and knowledgeable with our allergies.  The hurricanes are a MUST, as are the 3.50 margaritas!

The best brunch restaurant near UofA North campus and Whyte ave area. We came here twice for Saturday breakfast when we feel like to have classic eggs benedict. Side potatoes are something special here.It would be nice to have some menu under $10 though (cereals are under $10). Everything is around $15 for breakfast. Adding a side and a coffee easily rounds up the bill $20 per person. I feel overpriced for breakfast.
Has that Portland vibe. The coffee was on point and the customer service was great! Be sure to check out this new cafe in Meridian!

Jacob is a gem! Brought my boyfriend's belt in for extra holes added and in seconds he added holes as needed and I had a surprise repair for Christmas.  He even offered to trim the length of belt for me! No charge and was a dearheart.  I'd just lost a 17 year job I'd had so this was a lovely bonus :) Jacob didn't know about my job loss, he was just doing a kind favor and from now on know my go to leather repair shop and will make referrals.  Thanks for the kindness!  Best wishes,  Michelle M.

I will never get my haircut from anyone other than Matt ever again. I have gone to high end salons as well as Supercuts like chains and have never been so happy with a haircut. He listened to everything I had to say and executed the cut exactly how I requested- he also gave me some input on how the cut could better frame my face as well as some suggestions for products/styling techniques. Don't bother looking elsewhere for a better stylist because you won't find it.

I really wanted to love this place, and I'll have to settle for just like. The tacos had so much going on and still missed the mark. The duck taco was greasy like mostly grease greasy, the chipotle BBQ brisket was good but too saucey, and the Korean shirt rib was good. Something different to try. I like buena onda a little better, but this place is more unique so worth a try!

I recently had my hair cut by Rachel--she was professional, fun to talk to, and did an amazing job. 

I decided to go from having mid-back length hair, to sporting a pixie cut. This is my first time with short hair, and I'm so happy with my cut that I'm not sure if I'll ever go back to having long hair. I had it cut several weeks ago and it's growing in really nicely. 

This cut was only my second at AmMo, my first was by Kaitlyn?? (I'm not sure, I only went once two years ago and then moved to LA, I don't have a great memory) and it was cut+color. It also turned out beautifully and she was very nice too.

I highly recommend this salon!

We had a really bad experience with Thai Coconut. My wife and I ordered Summer Rolls, 2 Star Pad Thai and 2 Star Panang Chicken. While we were there the woman tried to convince us we should eat the peanut sauce provided with the summer rolls and that's what you eat with the summer rolls. We explained we like the spring roll sauce (red sauce). She said you're supposed to eat it with the peanut sauce and any other sauce we wanted would be extra (cost) so we just let it go. We got home and the Pad Thai  was extremely hot! Too hot to eat! We called them up to make it right and they wanted us to drive 20 minutes back and bring the Pad Thai in so they can check to see how hot (spicy) it is. Definitely NOT customer service oriented! I've been enjoying Thai food for 20 plus years in the Tampa Bay area and this restaurant is on the lower scale by far!

My favorite tavern in Lambertville, nestled among its residents, making you feel apart of the community thread. We didn't realize it was cash only, and our server was gracious enough to let us return with cash...unheard of in this day and time! The food and experience was excellent! Highly recommended!

I'd been wanting to try this place forever and I finally got my chance this past Sunday. I met a friend at Indeblue for brunch and since I was early I took a seat at the bar and grabbed a drink. The Rose Mimosa was nothing to write home to momma about (it was just champagne and grenadine), but the price of the drink ($6) and the attentiveness of the hostess/bartender were pluses. For brunch I went with the French toast and a side of bacon. I didn't pick the most adventurous thing on the menu but overall the food was decent (especially the side of super savory bacon...it was a VERY healthy portion and probably could've been shared). PROS: fast service, they honored my reservation time, the staff was super friendly, the restaurant/bathrooms were clean, portion sizes were perfect, and the prices were on par for the location.  CONS: There isn't a variety of options on the menu, the cocktails could've been a bit more daring. 

I'm definitely visiting again because there are some other items on the menu that I'd love to give a try. My friend had the chicken and waffles and she gave it an 8 out of 10.

Ahhh! The Tucson Botanical Gardens Luminaria!  Very tastefully done, festive, beautiful, everything Christmas!
The problem?  The people!  Too many people of all ages, in a small venue trying to walk, talk, eat, drink, take pictures, push baby carriages, wheelchairs and walkers; children running amok, parents, also running amok chasing the children!  ALL IN THE DARK!  Know it all's, know nothings, people with no sense of direction nor respect for the space of others, less alone respect of the botanical gardens, leaving litter behind for the others to clean up.  Inept Police Officers, standing in the road without their covers or the use of flashlights, trying to direct traffic.  God damn, Officer, use a 30 minute road flare if you are too cheap to buy a flashlight! (I'm a retired copper so I know of what I speak).
I have to say it was very organized inside, but getting IN was a disaster.  There is an entry "arch" and a line of people.  We see the Musician check in and the Volunteer check in, but where is the pre-paid/will call area?  OH, the signs are on the pre-paid/will call table?  Can't see that from the parking lot, folks.  And although well meaning, the Volunteers in the parking lot were useless.
I understand trying to run an event on a limited budget.  BUT, there HAS to be large, colorful signage to direct people, not small 8  1/2 x 11 copies!  People are akin to cattle; they have to be directed and prodded to move.  Filtering out the pre-paid/will calls out from walk-ins, then morphing them back into the walk in line, telling them to "wave your program" on the way in is a recipe for fraud!  IF I was the type of guy who wanted to defraud the Gardens, I could've picked up as many programs as I could (the number of programs that were discarded and floating around the inside area was unbelievable), walk outside and give away the programs to the "walk in's!!!!"   $$$ down the drain.  Something to think about next year.
This was our 2nd year in attendance.  We brought an In-Law from Back East and travelled an hour and a half to attend.  She loved it.  Lacking any visitors next season, we will not be attending the Luminaria.  I cannot justify spending $12 to be subjected to being pushed, jostled, stepped on and otherwise abused.  I can get that for free at any mall!

First, salsa bar is amazing. None of the salsas will let you down! Although some might surprise you with a kick!  
Second, the Burrito Mojado is a must try! I'd recommend wetting the burrito more with the Avocado salsa. 
Third, the huarache is also a great plate to try. Though it could be messy, it is a tasty thin-like sope.

Poor service. Went in for lunch and sat at the bar for 15 minutes and no service. They were all too busy congregating at their section enjoying their drinks and conversation.  Nah, I ain't giving away money today!

Just finished my second Shige experience. I get sashimi and nigiri each time and it's never very good. I just ate two pieces of salmon that didn't taste anything like salmon. I don't know what their hot food is like but I don't really want to find out. Surpised they are still open to be honest.
Thai food picked up for the misses. Great food! Very popular spot in my township and they continue to get great business.

Though I was totally enamored by the idea of being served dishes crafted by an Iron Chef (Jose Garcia), I thought the dishes were a bit lacking. I thought that the head chef for the day was a bit heavy-handed with the seasoning. I get it, you want each dish to pack a punch but there's magic in the subtleties of combining flavors that make your taste buds dance. Maybe my expectations for the Iron Chef were too high... I'll check back in when I try my favorite Iron Chef's restaurant (Michael Simon). ;) 

Other than shattering the pedestal I placed Garcia on, the experience and ambiance of the restaurant was so romantic. It definitely made me give my date some brownie points for surprising me with an ad hoc dinner here during my very short visit to Philly. :)

Food was slightly below decent but service was superb.  They were really sweet to my kids.  The cashier gave my little one a special snack on our way out, so, we'll likely be back despite the less than ideal food.

I can't even put in words how great the food was. So much of the menu was locally sourced from the owners farm and you could taste the freshness. It's was pure bliss eating and listening to the in house piano player! The food was cooked to absolute perfection. Our Dessert was prepared at our table and was exquisite. We will definitely return and make this a regular place for date nights and special occasions. Five Stars all the way.

Update: review is from before when it was Bay Harbor Hotel under construction. The place was basically a mess with a lot of riff raff.
Pros: gorgeous views of the water and sunset.  Tables and chairs outside behind the building. Restaurant has decent food and drinks. Staff is nice. Recieved 2 $10 vouchers for cafe in lobby.  Cons: hotel needs updating. Pool was not heated and birds were bathing in it. Needed maintenance. Too bad because the pool area could be a chill spot to relax and have drinks or get some sun and read, go for a swim but it's only used as a short cut from behind the building to bar/restaurant. Also, the beach bar was under construction. Last time we were here there were fire pits and volleyball and 2 bars. False advertising as far as the beach bar being open and "heated" pool being ice cold. Also, hallways in hotel were not air conditioned.
 When I asked a housekeeping maid if I could switch out a few dirty towels for clean ones, she basically told me no. Then changed her answer when she saw the look on my face. I have worked for 3 different hotel chains with impeccable hospitality. They need to work on theirs here. Rooms and hallways smelled stale and AC unit vents were not adjustable, so they blasted air toward the pillows on the bed, drying out our noses and throat.
No food at a place with kitchen in the name was surprising. Very cheep beer. Service was poor; the bartender was out back smoking with another patron for most of the hour I was there

My fiancé and I decided to check out Charleville because we love local craft beer and get so excited when something new opens! The place was warm and welcoming, but kinda dead for a Saturday night. We moseyed over to the bar where we were greeted by the bartender, who was absolutely fantastic. I wish I could remember his name to give him the recognition he deserves! Said bartender was knowledgeable and patient with our gazillion questions and we felt right at home. Onto the drinks... The bartender gave us an ample amount of free samples to ensure we got the beer we liked best. I ended up going with one of the stouts, which was incredible! 
We looked over the menu (we got there after kitchen closed) and are excited to go back and try the food. I am especially thrilled about the Chef's Gone Wild Poutine nights! I hope that the food is as good as the beer! 
All in all, we REALLY enjoyed Charleville and it was perfect for our date night. We will be going back sooner than later...and will bring friends next time too! It is my hope that this small brewery will thrive!

Went in for a Chicago dog and a polish.
Their was one person in the dining area.

I would have thought my items would be out in a minute... it seemed like 5 minutes..... way too long...

I found out these are new owners.
For three people running the place the service would be quick....  

Also, the restaurant carpet looked filthy.

You need to order $5.00 to use a debit/ credit card
$3.00 for a hotdog and $5 for a polish... is what I ordered. 

For someone who lived in Chicago for 30 years, I know hot dogs...

I will not return

Theirs another place down the street... that will be my next review.


 Follow up .... this place is closed ....   been driving down olmerton and every time there is a closed sign...

Time for some new owners who know the business.... 

Make me an offer and I'll take it on..

Ate at the bar....Rebecca..... she did a GREAT JOB.....good drinks and the food was excellent. 
Definitely a must while in Nashville.... love this town!

This place is awesome. I was a super beginner when I started, and the teachers were super patient with me. If I couldn't do something, they were able to modify it to fit my abilities until I could do it. The owner, Katherine, is very approachable. If there are any problems, she's always in the thick of things and you can ask her anything. The fact that there are numerous long-term students speaks highly of this school.

Customer service can be better. Not very attentive, when busy. When you are at an AYCE establishment, you shouldn't have to wait 10 minutes between orders. However, the sushi was great! Plenty of seating, overall great atmosphere!

Dined tonight at 5. Danielle (something like that) was our server. I think... we saw her at the beginning when she took our drink and food order and then at the very end when we were done. First off I order a peach Bellini (was not very good, they added sangria it did not belong) she didn't check my Id. I would be flattered except I am 23 and on a good day I look like I'm 15. It makes me wonder who else she hasn't Checked and they really aren't legal. Now to the food, it was incredibly subpar. I was incredibly disappointed I wanted a really good chicken parm. I got what tasted like a burnt microwaved chicken nugget covered in plain tomato sauce. I would have told the server except we didn't see her until the end. And we were 1 of 3 tables in the whole restaurant so it was not busy. The server was nice when she was there but was missing the caring. Just over all nothing to make me want to come back. I should have gone to Olive Garden.

My son in law's father is a long time resident of Merchantville. He told his son who told me about Park Restaurant. Being a long time seeker of new places I and my four friends went to Park on 12/2. Frencesca and Phil provided us with a meal that was equal to or better than most restaurants in Philadelphia. The cost was what I will call moderate at $50 per person befor tip. It was certainly worth more than that. We started with chicken liver pate served in a china cup with toasted rye bread. Two orders were shared by the table. The chicken livers were done to a fine paste but still gave us that slightly minerally taste that is chicken liver. I could have eaten two myself. For the entrée's there was a roasted lamb shank. Almost more than I could eat. It was done perfectly! Almost falling off the bone and cooked so well that the fatty flavor of lamb was there but in a very worderful level that to was hard to stop eating the extremely generous portion.  There was skate on a bed of pulled short ribs. Again the fatty taste of short ribs was mellowed so that it didn't overpower the delicasy of the skate. Last lastly there was a rib eye steak aged 55 days. Done to a delicious medium rare that was cut with a table knife with oven roasted potatoes. The restaurant is byob which made the overall meal that much more delicious. 
  
The wait staff kept the water filled at all time. Attentive but in the backround. Francesca kept everything moving at a pace that we were never left waiting but never felt rushed. When we asked for more rye bread for the appetizer, it appeared almost magically. Reservation was for 6:20 PM, we were seated immediately and finished at about 9:15. It was a truely dining experience. 
The only drawback is that the restaurant is tiny, seating only 32 patrons but no one seem to care and graciously got up to let people pass. Everyone that was there almost seemed like one big party. The noise level was quite high but that didn't seem to bother anyone either.  
 
Truely a white table meal dispite the home made plywood tables.

I will go back again and again.
Terrible service and rediculous manager.   Waited over 2 hours for food then had to deal with a manger who could care less.    Never again.  They should be ashamed to be associated their Hilton
Excellent haircut. The place was packed but it seemed that the barbers had everyone in order. Decent environment.

I travel for work. I was looking for some hot and fresh food. I walked in Pho Saigon at first didn't think anything of it but by the time I walked out it's diamond in rough. 

BEST VIETNAMESE FOOD EVER... 

Thank you Pho Saigon for marking me believer!
Love love love this place! Always great fresh sushi. Wait staff is fabulous and always so friendly and happy. Ask for "secret" special sushi menu for some great creations.

Had a great experience here today for a team lunch. I had the chicken salad sandwich and loved it! Hardly any mayo and amazing smoked chicken with seedy, toasted bread. I wish the beans that came on the side were larger because they were quite delicious also. A table favorite was the skillet queso. Other had a giant burger, ribs and juicy brisket. Before this I have only had drinks on the patio which is great in warmer weather. Will definitely keep this on my list of great places to go!
My favorite place in philly!! Such a cool theme. Great service, amazing food and fantastic drinks! Can't wait to come back!
Great place to coms and relax. Seaside on the bay of Tampa.  Good food in the bar, and drinks were just as delicious. Atmosphere is real laid back without a lot of tourist.

Returned to O'Leary's after a bit of a respite and found the service and food just as I remembered it. Julie, my favorite bartender, waited on us and provided outstanding service in spite of the fact she had the bar and all surrounding tables. We ordered nachos and chicken wings and they were fantastic. My hope is that all will remain the same when the establishment changes over to Patty O'Brien's the first of the year. One thing is for certain, they will be well advised to keep Julie behind the bar.

Why do we need reststops?

Gas - next rest stop is about 16 miles away,  if you need it, fill er up.

Restrooms: clean with plenty of stalls and sinks to get your bladder empty and washed up, ready for the rest of your journey

Mini Mart: small, but we'll stocked. Offering bottled beverages,  small snacks and candy

Food options: this place has plenty of those. Burger king,  starbucks, popeyes, sbarro, aunty Anne's/Cinnabon, there's a tex mex place,  and a bakery. So many options,  I didn't know what have. But we were only there to grab a snack. We picked up a few pretzel nuggets, a churro, 2 big chocolate chunk  cookies a brownie and a couple off drinks from starbucks... I told you I couldn't decide.
We don't usually stop in Delaware on our road trips down south since it's only 3 hours from our start,  but this time was an emergency. I was very pleased with what we uncovered. May have to include this stop on the way back

This theater was recommended by a local relative. Our experience was nothing short of magical. It is a unique experience. The theater is beautiful and has recently been restored. You cannot help getting a bit distracted by all the ornamentation on the walls and the starry night ceiling. It is a destination no matter the movie that's playing. The employees are very attentive and proud to talk about the history of the theater.

Can never go wrong with papa johns cheese sticks! They are always fresh and taste so good. Occasionally as an online customer you get points for free sides and the cheese sticks usually taste that much better :) papa johns is great!

I would say A on concept and C- on execution. It's tough doing the first year of anything as you have to work out the kinks. We grabbed a spot in the garage and it was a gorgeous December day, so we knew it would likely be very busy, and it was. Lines for food were wrapped around the sides and the line to ice skate were crazy. I think it just opened when we got there because there was no one on the ice, right around 2pm. I'm glad I was not hungry or thirsty because my patience would have worn a bit thin for food or drink. It was very cool to check out the little huts with the Christmas goods. I did find them to all be a bit similar. I hope they can work out the bumps and continue this as I think it is a great addition to the holiday festivities!

First time eating here and it was delicious. Ordered carry out online and picked up in 10 minutes! Hot braised chicken, Chicken Korean noodles, eye drop soup and Pork Vietnamese soup. Perfect for a chilly night! Nice customer service as well!

I ended up here because of a snotty cab driver on the evening American Airlines tried to ruin my life...My flight home was cancelled and I was pissed. I grab a cab from the airport and say I want to go to my hotel. To which the cab driver replies, "do you realize we wait three to four hours for a fare and you only want to go xx miles?" So after some back and forth I say he can take me to one of the best restaurants in St. Louis if that's more to his liking. I imagine he took me here because 1. It is a fantastic restaurant and 2. The cab fare was close to $60.
As for the restaurant; it really is phenomenal Italian cuisine. The restaurant is in an adorable Italian area (think Boston's North End but smaller). The restaurant is very old school Italian feeling and I loved the dark, plush decor, and the Christmas decorations did much to bolster my black mood. 
The service was excellent. I had a drink at the bar while I waited for a table. I was afraid I'd be waiting a long time on a Friday night, but I only waited as long as a glass of wine took to drink (not long).
I usually pass on bread but I almost ate the entire basket. It was so fresh and so delicious; don't skip out on the bread here. They had French Onion soup as a special tonight and it was probably the best French onion soup I've ever eaten. For dinner I had chicken lemonota and it was one of the best lemon chicken dishes I've ever had. I ordered a side of pasta since all pasta is made in house. The pasta itself was good but I regretted getting the garlic and olive oil sauce. It was so crazy spicy I started sweating and I live in the south where we pour hot sauce on damn near everything. If I could go back in time, I'd caution myself and insist I order Alfredo or red sauce. So maybe also heed this warning when you go. Unless you enjoy having your taste buds burned off your tongue. 
I ordered cannoli for dessert which was definitely fresh and pretty tasty if not the best I've ever had it was still good!
I would highly recommend this restaurant. It really was one of the best dining experiences I've had in this city and the food is just absolutely delicious. The price is also fair. My bill for all the food I mentioned was $55 which seems like a steal considering how fancy the restaurant is and how delicious and wonderfully prepared the dishes are.

Do not get the prosciutto pizza it tastes awful. Also, I ordered wings and got a calzone. My girlfriend recommended this place and said it was the best in town. She clearly did not know what she was talking about so I broke up with her. Noble pie parlor ruined my relationship.

Today was our first time eating here.  Glad we decided to cone here instead of Hooters... Started off with cocktails at the bar while waiting for a seat in the main dining area..Pam was our bartender, she  was very helpful and friendly. After 10 minutes, we we're seated.  The food was delicious..my seafood platter arrived in a timely manner and was broiled to perfection. My husband had the prime rib..he said it was awesome! We visited the salad bar which had a nice selection of fresh lettuce, salads, fruit and pasta dishes..oh and 2 tasty soups with all the trimmings...it was a perfect meal. The service here is excellent!  Our server  (Faith) was very efficient... pleasant and attentive. We will definitely come back! Very good experience!

Beautiful view from the rooftop bar. Our server Danny was exceptional !! 
We had the fish tacos and buckets of Budlight , the tacos were excellent and the beer was cold. We could not have asked for a better way to spend an afternoon.
whiskey sour was awesome! adult grilled cheese was great, so was the service. definitely will be back!

I have so many good things to say about this Chick-Fil-A! One of them being that their customer service is always top notch. Never have I once had an issue with this location. Another thing is I always receive my food as fresh as possible so that is always a plus! No one wants cold food once leaving through the drive through. They are so quick even when there is such a huge lunch/dinner rush. There is one specific time I wanted to mention about this location as well. I don't usually carry my wallet with me when my husband is with me so I figured he had it on him. We get to the window to pay and he completely looks embarrassed and we both realized we had no way to pay so we asked the gal if we could come back and pay for it and them just save our meal for us. The gal was so sweet and said "this one is on us!" We were so shocked and thought that was the nicest gesture a fast food restaurant has done for us! I am always raving about chick-fil-a especially because I never grew up with one in my hometown and never realized what great customer service was until I stepped foot into this fast food chain. One last thing is that the owner of this location is so sweet and although I've never met him, he is always sending coupons for a "free treat" on the app! AND btw if you don't already have the app, GET IT!! You earn rewards just by scanning the barcode!

We picked this place because it was close to Bankers Life.  Well what a disappointment!
The service was very slow.  I actually had to walk up to the bar several times!  One to place an order
for food and once to ask for a fork for my food!  Also to get a refill on drinks!   Once our food came out, it was cold.  A cold grilled cheese is never good!  Although I have to say it would have been amazing if it was HOT!
Our favorite Mexican restaurant.  Very family friendly.  Excellent service.  Highly recommend!

Really enjoyed the cheesesteak empanadas. Had a burger and tacos as well. Waitstaff was attentive and kind. Bartender was a little sassy but it's philly what do you expect. Great place for dinner and drinks
This my first time at the Hampton location and does it's big brother on Del Mar proud. A cost yet open atmosphere and delicious food.
First time in to the new location and I'm happy to report it's the same great food and attentive service as their other locations!

What an excellent addition to the Reno food scene! Liberty has such a variety of good drinks, appetizers, atmosphere and food!  The gnocchi was excellent, but the meatballs and Bucatini Carbonara are my new favorites. So much flavor! My wife and I really enjoyed ourselves and believe Reno needed a food establishment like this. We will be back with family and friends soon.

I wish I could give this place zero stars. Don't ever use this dry cleaner! It's been a week and they only have half my order complete. Told me to come back the following day for my shirt, still not ready. The place smells like pot, the store is always locked up because the employees are getting food. So there's a "be back 5 minutes sign". Then the lady acts like it's my fault that my shirt isn't ready. Unbelievable...beware of this business.
Very polite and excellent food. I love their chicken and goat Madras and bullet naan!
Delicious food!! Th food is as so good I forgot to take pictures!!! Get the cheese and charcuterie to start. Then the boar ribs!! We finished with spinach salad.  Very good food and service!!

First trip to this IKEA. It wasn't crazy as I anticipated with it being so close to Christmas. 

Great deals and yummy food. I love Ikea!!
Promos is always good, but this was my first time using this location. The service is awesome here. It's nice to deal with nice people.

Lord! The place that originated the char-grilled oysters aka "Heaven on a Half-Shell", truly lives up to its reputation! I've had them elsewhere but here, I am forever ruined. These are the best - hands down! The shrimp and grits are amazing; with fresh rosemary and fluffy as a cloud grits - OH MY! And then one of the best creme Brûlée I've had outside of Paris! 

Ask for Fredrick - he is the best waiter and the nicest person!

Good vegan options! Love this place, happy their are more vegan options opening up in Idaho. Love that they have their sauces for sale and it's made on location. They offer non vegan options as well. Love their Vegan Nachos!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Small and easily passed by on the road, Classic Barber Shop keeps a late 60's theme and delivers solid trims. My barber Leroy handles the fuzz and he does a great job. $15 for face management and hair is a drop in the bucket. The two chair establishment is laid back, and the waits are short. No matter the chair you sit in the cuts are pro, so stop by if your in the neighborhood.

Came here for a pedicure ahead of the Christmas rush- super relaxing and very professional place. Felt pampered as soon as I walked in with a heated neck wrap and spa water. Not only were my toes cared for but I also learned about how to keep them healthier and why my nail tips had been cracking so much. Toes look great and feet are super smooth and moisturized. Also enjoyed the boutique vibe and the array of local products available for sale. Definitely beats your average nail spa spot hands down.
Great service good food I would recommend this place that loves good old fashioned food that tastes good, and plenty of it.

The food was flavorful. Atmosphere nice. Friendly staff.
Everything on the bill was an upcharge or incorrect. $2 more for vegetables instead of meat. $2.50 for guac instead of cheese. $3 for fountain water. Wrong charge on the beer.
