I love the atmosphere, either outside in the beer garden, or inside with the dainty mock windows with views of the Alps. I enjoy the variety of German beers on tap offered in a array of sizes. The menu is simple, but vast enough to have something for everyone. Last of all, but certainly not least, is the refreshing selection of schnapps that we always order, because I know of no other restaurant and bar that offers Caraway schnapps! Wunderbar!

After giving this place and staff rave reviews on Yelp, and talking up the night experiences I've had up to co-workers,  they finally agree to join me for lunch (including my VP)... I was totally embarrassed and disappointed with our lunch experience today. While the food was still fantastic (thank goodness) our waitress, Desiree (sp?) was not. I can't say she was rude but gave us ALL the impression she either didn't want to work today or wait on our table. When questioned, she explained menu items/ingredients as if we were asking ignorant questions (she did all but rolled her eyes), barely visited the table, and spoke in a tone that signaled she was aggravated. Trust we ALL are professional women and was only asking about things we couldn't pronounce (saying this just point out we aren't inexperienced diners). Again, the food was good but today's experience sucked!!

Love love this place! The best chicken and the peri peri sauce is to die for!! Always awesome service and I love their pop machine! So many flavours to choose from! Thanks Nandos! Also love the fact they chose to join skip the dishes. Worth while!

Fun fun place to hand out on a Friday night.  Lots of food and REGGAE MUSIC. Errol and his crew are just amazing.  Always good laughs and dance.  The food is ok not the all authentic Jamaican food I usually like to eat but it does the job for the night.   The rum punch is delicious!!
Good sauce, cheese and dough. Real authentic Sicilian owner and employees. We will definitely be back. Thank you for being open during the holidays.

Awesome pizza slices. Great service. I wish I was in town longer because I would have really liked to try their entrees.
Don't be fooled by the mall location this place is legit!

This is one of the best restaurants for New Orleans food. I absolutely love coming here every time I visit (which is quite often). It hits the spot for authentic NOLA cuisine with the perfectly understated vibe. The servers are always nice, though the overall cleanliness of the restaurant could be improved...but hey, no one is heading to Jacques-Imo's for a white tableclothed dinner.
Great to have a place like this in Westchase. Açaí split bowl was great. Nice staff as well.
Very clean and they don't freeze you out as most bowling mats do! lol Staff does their job.

The drinks are great.  Food is above average but a bit overpriced for fairly standard Mexican fare.  The service was really bad the night we visited.  If I could give a half star, I might go 3 1/2 Stars, I would.  Forced to chose, I would lean to the 3 and not the 4.  We will probably try again and hope for better service.  Not a bad restaurant, but not a 'can't miss' either.

I really like this place! I've come here a few times since I work just around the corner. I've had the boxed lunch twice - once with the turkey your way, and the other with the nutty chicken salad - and both were delicious. I also had one of their signature paninis which was good, but the boxed lunch is a way better deal. 

The staff is friendly and helpful. 

The upcakes (upside down cupcakes) are delicious and come in a TON of different varieties - it's hard to choose! 

Work or live in the area, then definitely check this place out. It's a cool spot that offers something a bit different from the rest of the lunch crowd.

Wanted to love this place as much as the original tasting room but.... just ain't feeling it... started with a Grapefruit Pale ale and it had nothing..No flavor.. No pop..zip...went to a Phila Pale Ale which is one of my top 20 beers and again "Nothing:..flavor, citrus hops all missing...I'd rather order a bottle of Yards somewhere with an approachable menu and good juke box...oh and heat...place is like a freaking ice box...

Every time I have gone to the Brooklawn Diner, the experience has always been exceptional. The diner is clean, the food is amazing, the servers are attentive, and the manager is out on the floor with her servers and genuinely strives for a good customer experience. I'd rate Brooklawn as the best of the best.

We stopped by Sun King and thought we would check out the new Oca restaurant/shop inside. Oca, meaning "Goose", is a spin-off for Goose the Market that opened inside the public area of the brewery. Although they hadn't "officially" announced they were open, I had heard that they were open in the evenings and were working through a soft opening process. So glad we stopped by!

My wife and I both tried one of the bundled French Bread sandwiches. Tonight's featured City Ham and Gruyere with Dijon mustard, tarragon, and mini sweet pickles (cornichons). I placed our order at the counter, paid, and gave my name. They asked if I wanted the sandwiches toasted (yes!) and that allowed me time to pick up a couple drafts at the Sun King counter. As soon as I was making my way back to our table, the Oca staff called out my name and I was good to go. 

I loved the crispy crunch of the bread and the toasting brought out the flavors of the ham and cheese. Excellent pairing for the spices too. Can't wait to come back to try some of the sausages and charcuterie. 

*****update******
I made it back one evening and decided to try the Choucrote Garnie which may as well translate to "meat lover's dream!"  Actually, it's a "traditional dish of France's Alsace region bordering Germany" and the Choucrote is fermented cabbage while the Garnie means it is dressed with Riesling (white wine), herbs, potatoes, and charcuterie.

 This huge option is brought out in a roasting pan.  My eyes started to glaze over at all the meats.  In the center was a large peppery Knack(wurst) nestled over a large serving of the Choucrote.  To the left was a thick (a full inch) smoked rib chop that was the most tender pork chop I've had.  In the upper left corner were two Nuremberg sausage (technically much larger at about 5 inches instead of the 9 cm traditional).  The Nuremberg have a thicker casing and more in the Bratwurst family.  To the right of the Knack were a couple slices of Pancetta that looked like American bacon, but have a higher salt content.  Just below that, there were two Strasbourg frankfurters.  Oh, and there were two potatoes that were halved and roasted.

The Choucrote itself was a great surprise at how much I enjoyed it.  My mother used to make a really nasty version of sauerkraut and dressed it with white vinegar.  I hated it!  But here, the pungent odor of vinegar is replaced by the pleasing notes of the Riesling.  The sour of the dish is tempered as well, so the overall taste is quite pleasing, especially since it is warm and served thoroughly tender. (I am not a fan of the sometimes rubbery and tough texture of raw cabbage.)

The portion size suggests it is for two to four people.  They mean it on this dish!  I made really great headway on devouring the dish, but common sense struck me before I was stuffed and decided to get a to go box.  Not for the picky eater, this is a dish that goes great with a dark beer (I went with the Sun King "Stuck in the Middle" Milk Stout option. Yum!)

*****back to the original review*****

As if I didn't have enough reasons to stop by Sun King already, now I can get great quality sandwiches while there. Note that Oca sells packaged meats to take home if you stop by to fill your growler.

Tech stuff: They are open generally the same hours as the brewery.  Parking is free in the Sun King lot.  A number of platters are meant for 2 to 4 people, so bring friends!

Review #439
Rev #30

Mediocre food at best. It's a good tourist trap, that's about all. The atmosphere is pseudo country. The tourist love it. The chicken was dry, you'll need the sauce to get it to slide down your throat! 
The catfish was over cooked too. Not sure anything was good except for the cornbread.

Amazing, much needed addition to Old City. True neighborhood, laid back bar with delicious food. Hosted our office Christmas after party in the incredible second floor space. I cannot say enough positive things about the staff, service, food, communication, etc. All our guests truly had an awesome time and raved about it! Will continue to frequent as an Old City resident and would totally host another event at Gina's.
Amazing studio! I will miss it back home, it really was a treat during the New Orleans vacation

Purchased a new 2018 Sonata from Vadim Naumov in Clearwater.
Best car buying experience in a decade. The process was super easy at this dealership. Got a great car and a great deal. V's professionalism is second to none. First class experience all around. My family has purchased several vehicles from him at this dealer. We will definitely be back in the future.

I did my due diligence and had five moving companies give me estimates to move from central Florida To Mountain City Tennessee. I quickly realized that consumers are at the mercy of the unscrupulous movers. An industry where misinformation, deception and down right dishonesty is all too common. Platinum representative Kris Chavez came to my home and was polite, knowledgeable and most importantly reassuring. He looked over what we had to move and estimated the weight to be 14,000 lbs. (final actual weight 13,800). I explained to Kris my reluctance to sign with a moving company. Instead of defending the moving industry he said that I was right and he understood how I felt. I decided to sign with Platinum Relocations in early October. I contacted Kris numerous times prior to my actual move to ask questions, to clarify contents of the estimate and for reassurance that they would treat me fairly. Each time Kris was always polite, understanding and again, reassuring. On the day of the move, movers showed up on time and loaded quickly. They arrived as promised with all our belongings and actually lowered my quoted price due to the lower weight. The team that unloaded was the best. Hard workers, careful and polite. I would recommend Platinum Relocations to my friends and family. They treated me right and did't try to take advantage. I have authorized Platinum to give my phone number to anyone trying to decide on a moving company. Platinum Relocations did right by me!

Had high expectations of this Thai place. Several winning charts are displayed at their counter. Ordered my usual tom yum shrimp soup and was not up to standard at all - with few shrimps, slices of mushroom, a slice of tomato and lots of onions for $11. Definetely not worth it! It should be lemongrass I should be seeing instead of onions. Soup was not spicy but blant and I had to add chilli flakes. The other dish we ordered Phad Thai was still acceptable. Service and ambience were good but quality was disappointing. If you are looking for authentic Thai food, you can give this a miss.

Had a wonderful business dinner with clients here. Excellent service and the food was extremely good.  Great ambiance and I especially enjoyed that even for a glass of wine they poured, generously, at the table from the bottle. Had the signature seafood chowder and it was superb. The specials for the evening were outstanding as well.  Very enjoyable experience. Will be back for sure.
Hands down best chicken I've ever had. Great service too. My wife and I order out from here at least once a week. Treat their military good too.
Basically deconstructed sushi rolls. Super fresh and great variety. Big fan. Had the salmon bowl plus some extra toppings. Loved the fresh watermelon cucumber juice.

No thank you, Nashville
       If you are visiting Nashville, and want a full Nashville hot experience, I don't think this is the place for you. If you want well made southern food, this still isn't the place. If you want something that tastes good, well...
      My wife and I planned a road trip from central Florida to Pigeon Forge, and we decided to make a huge diversion to try a BBQ place (Martin's) in Nashville. It, by the way, was amazing! Since we were doing that, I just had to try Nashville hot chicken in Nashville. I poured over tons of reviews, saw that it was on the cooking channel, and decided to go to Hattie B's. Having a pure love for fried chicken, and indulging in everything from Publix (don't lie, you know it's good) to Art Smith's, I just love all kinds of fried chicken. This is my opinion, 43 years qualified!
           Let's start with the service.This place is giving the customer pre-made food. Basically fast food. It took us almost 20min just to get one plate of food, and some fingers. Honestly, that's just ridiculous. There was a long line at noon, but I thought it was because the food was going to be amazing. Instead it was because they have about 100 people in the kitchen, and all of them taking their time doing whatever they were doing back there. Efficiency is not a priority at Hattie B's.
           Now the sides. The only good note to this review was the pimento mac n' cheese. It was a good mac n' cheese. I understand it's called pimento because it has pimentos in it, but if you're expecting that rich full flavor of pimento cheese, it's not there. If you were blindfolded, you would think it was just mac n' cheese. Nothing special.Now, the collard greens. Literally, I mean this without deviation, literally the worst greens I've ever had. They were severely under cooked, and had absolutely no flavor at all. None. Not a bit. There was no salt, no fat, no oil, no smokey flavor, nothing to make them good. It was boiled greens, that needed a lot more time to cook. Whoever came up with this recipe has no idea in the world how to cook greens.
          Last, the chicken. Again, as serious as a fried chicken lover can be, this was inedible. I honestly could not eat it. I tried and tried, but it was completely flavorless. I got the hot, and I eat spicy food everyday. It was that, spicy. But under the spice was zero flavor. I'm guessing they do a water bath or soak on this chicken, and maybe use just plain flour to coat. If they add any seasoning to the breading, it's not nearly enough. It wasn't dry, it was just bland. My son got chicken fingers, and he didn't even finish them. There was nothing there.
             If you want good southern style food, do not go to Hattie B's. This place is nothing more than a tourist trap with very bland and poorly prepared food. It's all hype and no delivery. This was my deepest regret on my entire trip, and if this restaurant is indicative of Nashville fried chicken, then Nashville has no idea how to fry chicken.
Great concept. Food and service were excellent. Really comfortable environment. I got the pork belly it was amazing, super tender and had great flavor. I will be back to check out the fish next time.

The mildish wings are the star for us at Riccardo's! They have a great flavor with a hint of spice and they are cooked well. The pizza is good, not the best in the area but it's pretty good. I normally order plain or sausage and pepperoni with mushrooms. The people are really nice in there and delivery is prompt.

Customer service has been a horrible experience!! We still have not received our order after we paid for it and have made calls and a 2 hour trip to the Turnersville, NJ location after over 10 calls to the store location and customer service.

I have always had burgers here and great service.  Last night I went with my family and the burgers were still perfect except the service.  SLOW.  Got there a bit before 6pm and was lucky to make it out before 7:30.  When we go there the dining room was virtually empty.  We ordered the fried mushrooms which were excellent but also got calimari which was basically a few chewy ones and what other fried dough at the bottom of the fryer - disappointing. So disappointed because my husband and I raved about this place and brought our kids in town from school and it fell flat in so many ways.  I don't know if with a party of 5 and the wait staff know they automatically get 20% and put literally zero effort?  Don't know, not sure we will be going back.

I am lot going to lie. I never have on yelp. But this is hands down the greatest thing I've ever eaten. I live in NYC and Sometimes I drive to philly to get a cheesesteak. After doing some asking around someone suggested this nifty little place. Oh boy! I was so happy I drove the distance. I would make this drive every day if I didn't have to pay bills... the bread was great. Not the normal philly type- next time I'll try the pork sandwich, but that cheesesteak was dope!

I loved this new location. Jimmy was our waiter. He was amazing. We ordered green tea and were surprised with a fantastic pot of Jasmine tea.  Next up was salt and pepper eggplant which was up to usual yummy house standards. Cilantro garlic shallots ! Must try one of the salt and pepper appetizers if you have not had it before. Then Peking duck and Buddha delight. The Buddha delight had lotus root beautiful mushrooms and asparagus. My favorite was the duck cooked on the bone. Lucious. Had a great time!

By far amazing! I went in with high hopes and they definitely delivered. We got the sushi burger which was messy but so worth it as well as this mango milkshake type drink. It had the tapioca pearls which I usually hate but theses were very different and tasted really good. We only got two sushi rolls but I wish we got more. Their Marilyn Monroe roll is crazy good and I highly recommend it. Also their tuna princess toll took on a very unique shape which I really liked. Also we got their beef soup and for only $9 it was totally worth it. also their onigiri was tasty too, although a little heavy on the rice side but no real complaints here. We shall definitely be back!

By far my favorite Hibachi place here in Nashville.  Usually I go here for lunch between 11-3.  The lunch hibachi is awesome and a great bang for your buck.  Usually we get paired up with another couple or so, but I've never had to sit at a full table during lunch.  All hibachi and take out orders get charged an automatic 18% gratuity which is stated on the menu (And on delivery apps when you order it to be delivered) so this should not come as a surprise.  The hostess who seats you is not the one who gets your drink order.  They have another server come over to take your drink and food order as well as serving the soup and salad.  Typically, the soup and salad come out very quickly.  They always have it timed out right, so just as you are finishing the first two courses, they are about to start cooking the main meal. The main course is delicious as well and has always been cooked just the way I ask.  I love this place. 

Edited to add photo of takeout.

Aside from Nordstrom already being one of my favorite places to shop it's also one of my favorite places to eat. You can't go wrong with any of the selections on the menu and the service and hospitality is on point.

Got to say this is some very good Cuban food with lots of fresh ingredients prepared and spiced to perfection. Friendly staff and well priced for counter ordering. Been there many times. Portions are large. Goto for Cuban St. Petersburg
Awesome burger and beer! Ordered the caprese burger. Very good... cute little cozy burger joint. I will bring my husband back here.

I will love to say that I have a great experience every time that I go Ella's, but is the opposite. The food can be good, but service is bad - very bad. Last time I was there I had to wait 10 - 15min for the server to bring me water, and another 10 to have the water in my table. It was not busy and it does not take much to bring water and take my order. Unfortunately, is not the first time I had that bad experience with them. A month ago I wait to be seated for like 20 min and then another 15 to have the server (again) bring water!!! So, if you want to have a very bad service then go to Ellas! They are pretty good making their customer wait!
Food was excellent. Service was a little slow. A little pricey. Worth a try. Really good. Small intimate restaurant.
These are definitely the best wings in the greater New Orleans metro area. I have been to 95% of them and this one is my favorite.

Freddie's has been a Ewing staple for longer than anyone can remember, but lately it has been undergoing some changes and I am impressed.  The remodeled dining area is beautiful, but what really brought me back and continues to do so is the Sunday Brunch.  It is unbeatable!  Every sunday from 10am till 2pm they set up a never ending procession of food.  From your standard eggs and bacon type breakfast staples that also include phenomenal eggs benedict, to pastries, meats sliced to your liking, omelets made to order, and delicious lunch options of pasta, salmon, or chicken marsala.  The staff is attentive and incredibly friendly.  You will not find a better sunday brunch with booze anywhere in mercer county.

The food is terrific, but the service is horrible.  They do not have enough people working.  Tables are not cleared in a timely manner, there are no refills on drinks and people wait to be seated even though there are many tables open.  It is the same every time I come here.

This place is amazing. Chuck and Steve helped us out and made sure we had the greatest time during our first night in town. They weren't overbearing but kept a great balance with our drinks and food coming out. Very cool vibe and very cool staff. If I'm in Nashville in the future then I will make sure to hit this restaurant!

I have to give this so called restaurant 1 star because yelp won't allow me to give 0 star. Food is not all that great and they have the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! I do not recommend this place at all!!! Don't waste your money!

Such a great place! Staff were friendly and very welcoming. Offered recommendations, which were ALL so delicious. I had the braised lamb pasta and the Jean & Jam drink. Will definitely be back for the pastries.

When we pulled up to this place for dinner, we were a little skeptical- it was in a strip mall, the restaurant was nearly empty, and it looked like a fast food dive. Because of the good yelp reviews, we went in anyways.

We're so glad we did! The staff was friendly and the food was absolutely incredible, with a surprising amount of vegetarian options! I had the enchiladas with summer squash, the rest of my party had the carnitas, the plato charro, and the plato frontera. We also ordered chips and guacamole to share. The guacamole was delicious, tasted so fresh and was appropriately chunky! Those who had meat said it was well-seasoned and perfectly cooked; there were no complaints about anything. 

Talking to one of the employees there, we also found out that the restaurant uses all fresh ingredients- they don't even have a freezer so they have to prepare new food by hand every day. You could definitely taste the difference! We will definitely come back here as soon as we can!

Stopped by for lunch for the first time. Excellent service, excellent burger, excellent fries,didn't have scotch (my beverage of choice) but my server recommended an excellent beer by the name of "Nothing Fancy". I liked it so much, and I'm not usually a beer drinker, that I went out looking for it later to have at home. Thanks for the recommendation. All in all I had I great time relaxing after a trying morning enabling me to be in better spirits the rest of the day. I will be back and bring friends.
Solid meal. Solid ambiance. Friendly service, but a little loose. More comfortable than fine dining. Beet salad is underrated.
My chicken was burn so they take it back to redo it then the manger bring it back out and didn't said anything and it look the same it still burn and dry I will not going back to this place .

Food was ok. They do offer gluten-fee options which is always nice. As far as ambiance, hard to say. We were seated at a table, which was a little crowded. We notice 3 booths nearby, which were open and asked to be moved there for a little more elbow room. It was only 2 of us, so it should not have been an issue. When the host came back, he proceeded to take us to the "back" of the restaurant  It was cold, no heat,no TVs , etc. They sat us in a booth for 6. It was quite obvious that they did not like our asking for a different seating arrangement   Needless to say I lost my appetite and only my son ate. We will not be coming back here. No one likes to sit with a jacket on and eat. It was quite unpleasant   It seems customer service is not their strong suit.

The decor and service were great. Seated immediately, welcoming setting and wait staff was extremely attentive and polite. Food came quickly, however, the food itself was underwhelming. The steak and lamb portions were small, which would've been ok, however both were overly chewy. Would give it another try, but was not impressed.
Excellent work...they were here for 1.5 hours!!!! My car is sparkling~!!!! Definitely an official long term client.

Yummy. Great food. Tasty and flavorful. We had chicken tacos, shrimp tacos, burritos, cheese dip. Everything was yummy. We are coming back! 
The restaurant was empty at night, but that's because it's in the business district.
I couldn't believe how pleasant the lady was here! Great pizza! Hard to find good pizza other than imos around these parts. This place delivers!

We did a walking voodoo tour with Robi Gilmore today 12/9/17 at 9am. I can not say enough great things about him. This tour was beyond informative. He was also a great tour guide. He was interactive, funny and beyond knowledgeable. I'm so glad me and my fiancé took this tour with him. I would def do another tour with him if we ever come back to visit New Orleans :)

In my pursuit to find a warm, flavorful soup, on the first snow day of the season, I came to Cafe Nahn. It seems many other people shared my idea because the tiny the restaurant had a 20-30 minute wait.

Well, the wait well worth it. I ordered the beef brisket stew and the caramelized pork belly, with boiled egg and rice.

The stew was hearty and very flavorful. This place clearly doesn't rely on a pile of salt for seasoning, like I've experienced at other places that serve headache-inducing, overly salted broth. And the beef was so tender that it fell apart. The rice noodles were also cooked to perfection with the ideal bouncy texture.

While the pork belly was good, it was well-seasoned and tender, I was expecting something a bit more grand. When caramelizing a protein, I thought the outer portion should be, at the very least, browned with a light or very light crisp on the surface.This pork didn't have the desired color or texture, it looked like it was stewed. Also, the pork belly lacked the star feature of this particular cut: the tri-layers comprised of skin and meat that are joined together by a nice layer of fat. And depending on how it was cooked, each layer lends a contrasting texture. At Cafe Nahn, it appears the chef removed the skin, which was a mild disappointment.

 Despite this, the dish wasn't the worse thing and had many other redeeming qualities like the aforementioned amount of flavor and tenderness. Another delicious touch was the boiled egg that was stained the color of the pork brother because it was most likely boiled in the broth.

I will definitely comeback to Cafe Nahn. The customer service and food were both great!

Terrible location!! I go yesterday after opening and order the Pike Place, their most popular coffee. I'm told they don't have any brewed. Okay, I get another coffee that's strong. I go today at 4:58 am, they open at 5:00 am. I expect to wait at the door for 2 minutes as SB usually opens the doors within seconds of the opening time. A woman comes to the door and tells me that they open at 5:00 but they don't have any coffee brewed, so it will be about 5 more minutes. She had no intention of letting me in. I commented that perhaps they should have started the coffee 3 minutes earlier, a time that will allow them to sell at the opening time. I leave and go to a SB 5 minutes away. The SB that I went to had the Pike Place ready, at 5:04 am!!! This SB is 1 block from my hotel. I will not be back. It's a new SB, so I suggest that someone in management tell them what "open at 5:00" truly means. It doesn't mean that the lights are on and the door is open, it means open and ready to do business. Obviously I'm cranky if I don't get my coffee first thing in the morning. BTW, I have never left a negative review for SB, as I love SB coffee.
Gio's was awesome.  The muffuletta has real Italian style smoked ham on it.  The pizza was excell and had a great sauce.  Kudos to them!

Love the food and service.   However, I just witnessed one of the cooks quickly sprinkle some water on his hands for maybe 2 seconds,  no soap, and then hurriedly leave.   It seriously degraded my dining experience.   I would greatly appreciate it if the manager could conduct a hand-washing class.

My son and I went here before a show,grab a drink and a couple of small plates and head out. Waiter seamed confused finding what we were ordering on his tablet. My son said" Maybe you can just write it down". We ordered a gin concoction that tasted like Hawaiian Punch. Pretzel bites looked like giant Corn Pops ,no taste ,with cheez whiz and a not so unique house hot sauce.(pretzel =mustard)Sliders seemed baked not seared. No flavor from meat. Beet Salad was "eh". Got mistakenly charged for two extra drinks which the waiter apologized for and corrected. Maybe when they work out the kinks we'll try it again

One of the best steakhouses I've ever been to, and I've eaten at many fine places across the country. The service was top notch with a fantastic decor in a historic building in the heart of Philadelphia. All the dishes ordered were nicely done. Worth the visit if you're in town.

Walking into Skull's Rainbow Room is like taking a step back into the 20s. I walked in on a Monday night not having any expectations. There was a female singer and  person playing the piano... they were amazing. It was a slow night but I was in awe of the talented musicians on stage. Would love to go back to have dinner.

Fantastic environment, service, food, decor, location, everything. Bonus, it's a top choice for people watching. 

Every moment from the bread to the desserts is perfect. Great for special events and large parties.. brunch, lunch and everything else too.

Been to two other Cajun kitchens that I've loved. The food at the Goleta spot is way greasier. I've had the egg sandwich, chillaquilles, and a breakfast burrito. Basically just balls of grease. Service is great LOL

Place was packed so I was optimistic. However. Burger was just ok. Potato salad didn't have a lot of flavor. Waitress completely jacked up the separate checks and I ended up paying for 2 of my friends. Would not rush to go back there.

What a special find for Christmas dinner ! Driving down state street on Christmas Day was becoming worrying, mum and I were starving and nothing seemed to be open. Madam Lu caught my eye and I saw the open sign so we went for it. 
Arriving around 430 the staff were setting up for dinner, no big crowds at this point but quite a few people still dining. 

Our server was really awesome, she was well-spoken and confident. The decor was old but cozy, it was just perfect for a hot dinner on a special day. 
The best part about the menu is the amount of vegan options they have ! I would have never expected a Chinese restaurant to be so accommodating to a vegan diet, my mum was stoked. 
I ordered the Beef Basil and my mum ordered the Vegan Kung Pao Chicken. 
My beef basil was so delicious, the onions were to die for and it was so garlicy. My mum liked hers, she didn't rave about it but she ate most of it and took the rest home. 

Closer to 530 the restaurant was completely packed and I totally understand why, it was delicious. Feeling lucky we found this place on a whim !

Although not prone to being a "review writer" there comes a time when doing so is necessary. I live in center city Philadelphia and work at the King of Prussia mall. Are there opticians in the city and at the mall . . . You bet - and loads them!

. . . and that said, I still go to Dreyfus Opticians in Yardley!  Why? Because they are, by far, the absolute best opticians I have ever experienced. Whether it is the latest in frames or the skill, expertise and care that Eli practices every day. There is none better nor any others who are his equal. Check the other reviews - it's not just me!!

This local eat was on me and my husbands list to visit. Unfortunately after the way my daughter was treated by the manager/owner I will not visit this location. I will make sure that I tell my friends and associates not to visit this location either.

The BEAST is the bomb. Best BBQ we have ever experienced. Love that they serve it with warm tortillas. It lets the meat speak for itself. If you're lucky enough, get the burnt ends They don't always have them. Love the sauces as well. Craft soda. Craft beer. Unique ordering system. Unique side items. Unique place. Uniquely good. Try it. You wont be disappointed!

Another Bench gem! Walked down the other night they had nice live music but not so loud we could carry on a conversation. My daughter and I ordered the Carne con Papas, which was amazing. My son had a chicken dish I can't recall but it was excellent too.  Service was very friendly and attentive, beer and wine available. So happy to have another great restaurant on the Bench.

Update: I was contacted by Dalie's; they apologized and sent me a coupon that reimbursed a bit over 50% of my purchase. This raises my rating from an original "1" to a "3", and I do plan to return. Thank you Dalie's.

I was so disappointed in my latest visit to Dalie's. My macaroni and cheese had a long, dark hair on top of it - they did replace my macaroni and cheese when I showed them. However, the real problem was when they asked us to "give up our table" when we hadn't been done with our meal but about 5 minutes because "they were getting busy". I have never, ever experienced such rude behavior from a restaurant. I will likely never return, which is a shame because I really love their fried fire & ice pickles and their Sweet Hope sauce.

Catering & delivery is depicted as easy in the commercials-WRONG!!  I tried to arrange this for a party I had.  I even went there personally because I got no help on the phone.  Ridiculously hard to try and place an order. Ended up ordering From Mama Louise's & glad I did! It was easy, & Good!
Mystic Fish remains a great place for a nice, local night out.  Good service and food - we've remained loyal for years and have not yet been dissappointed.

Beautiful clean environment, friendly hospitality, and great high-quality work on my full lash extensions! I bought the Groupon deal for a half-set of lashes, which was very affordable (~$40 I think), but they were barely noticeable. So I ended up coming back within two days to fill it in and make it a full set, which jacked up the total price to around $85 (for the Groupon then the fill appointment). This was still cheaper than buying a full set at their retail price of $165, which I think is incredibly expensive! But, four weeks after these appointments and my lashes still look decent! They use high-quality adhesive here and the process was completely painless, unlike my previous lash spot. I bought their special mascara and make-up remover at check-out, which are both supposed to be complementary to their lash extensions. These, too, were quite pricey ($130 total). Long story short: very pricey place for very high-quality product. Will be coming back.

i love this place! such a nice & funny team. 
i've been to so many barber shops and they always mess up my hair or miss spots. 
they did an AMAZING job & i didn't have to wait 
reasonable prices too.
Got a garlic chicken pizza.... Yuck.  Not enough sauce, dry chicken, dry crust... Just all over plan and dry.  Looked great, tasted like cardboard.

Why did they change the seats again?? I think this theater was originally redone in 2013 with giant reclining seats that were super comfortable...it was amazing. Fast forward to 2017 and they changed the seats again...now they're nothing more than cheap imitations of the leather seats they originally installed back in 2013...incredibly uncomfortable and half the size...Major bummer.

Absolutely fantastic! Great place for a date night too. The decor is beautiful and calming. The food is wonderful. You know the places where after the first bite, your eyes roll and "mmmm" inadvertently comes out? That's this place! I had the paneer tikka masala (my go-to dish) and it was heavenly! Not quite as spicy as I like it but the best flavor I've had in Philly (so far).

This is one of my favorite restaurants hands down and I am not even vegan! The service is impeccable, the food is surprising and delicious. I love the "crab"cakes, the pasta and "meatballs"dish and the gnocchi just to name a few. The desserts are all a must try also. Last time we were there we couldn't decide between the lemon cake or the chocolate and our server brought out both as a treat! Great place and the ambience is warm and intoxicating...

This was very disappointing. We came 4 people for lunch, and spent about 1 1/2 there. We ordered dim sum to share as appetizers, they picture 4 pce on their menu but only serve 3! After ordering our main meal, we were served in 3 different settings so the first person was done, by the time I got my lunch. We asked to make small changes, and none were accommodated. The shrimp lo mein had 4 (!) shrimp. There was 7 servers standing around, yet our table was full of dirty dishes. The location is great and restaurant is very nice and clean inside, but the service and food is not worth a visit.

So good. Comfort from the moment you walk in. The ambience, decor, live music, service, and food are excellent. So many options that were excellent from the cheese sticks and o-rings to soup, fish&chips, or bangers, you can't go wrong. Definitely a new staple for us!!
The food is delicious and the staff is nice. I enjoyed the Pan de Queso, and I highly recommend that. Good job y'all .

Unfortunately, my experience was similar to those who described poor service and impolite staff. I ordered sweet potato veggie rolls, after making sure there was no egg in the tempura mix used to deep fry the sweet potato. I explained that I was a vegan and didn't eat animal products. As I was walking out of the restaurant, something told me to check my order. It was indeed a sweet potato roll, but it was covered with a substance I'd never seen before in the 40 years I've eaten sushi. I went back into the restaurant, where I was told it was eel sauce and that they "always"  put this sauce on sweet potato rolls. When I responded that I had been to the restaurant before and was served sweet potato rolls without eel sauce, the cashier/manager told me that I was wrong, that I had never been there before (I was, in fact, there two other times), that she would have remembered me. She repeatedly denied I had been there before over the course of the incident. She laughed at my dismay at having to waste more time waiting for my food and did not honor my request for wasabi to be put on the rolls. It was a very disappointing experience.

This is an interesting place and if you are ever passing bye stop in for an amazing cup of coffee! 
They have a small coffee themed gift shop and they sell grab & go cups of coffee. There is no where to sit , it isn't a cafe, just a retail store.
The coffee was excellent and it was only $2.00!

Fork is reliable for good food, a pleasant atmosphere, and solid customer service.  It's not mind blowing which is why i don't give it five stars.  When I people visit me, I'll suggest Fork as a good dining option especially tuesday's - The chicken & waffles change lives.

My family has a fun tradition of going to this Macy's for the organ and Christmas light show and the  Dickens Village on the 3rd floor. My parents are Philly natives and both grew up doing this and now we drive up from Baltimore to do this as a family. So much fun and very well done. They also have the window displays outside!

Surprisingly large quilt shop that still has the feel of a small local place. Passing through on our road trip and looking to collect some fabric souvenirs, the people there were very kind and helpful. Highly recommend, fabrics are reasonably priced
La Boule is a gem and our go to escape for coffee and pastries. Beautiful displays and friendly service. It's an oasis in this little neighbourhood.

Dirty store.  Stood at the register for some time while the cashier was having a personal conversation with another employee.  She had her back to the register area.  I had to get serviced by someone who didn't even have on a uniform.  Why would you keep these kinds of people employed?   This location needs some serious attention and maybe some management changes before I come back.

Stay away!  Far, far away from this place!!!   The blue cheese dressing for the salad came out with stuff growing on it.  I ordered baked ziti with meat sauce.  A bowl of pasta in water may have had more flavor.  We sent this dish back.  My boyfriend ordered lasagna. What came out did not look like lasagna. Did not taste like lasagna.  The owner came over to ask what was wrong with my dish.  Was completely argumentative about everything.  We got the bill.  They charged for the returned ziti.  When I asked to have it removed, I was yelled at and told they have never had such a stupid complaint.  That he shouldn't be taking it off the bill.  He finally did.  But with an attitude.   Not quite sure how this place stays opens.

It's a small, cozy place. Sort of packed. Seemed to be short of waitstaff when I went...
But the server and hostess took care of us and the food our promptly. 

Now, I usually get nigiri/sashimi dishes but the cold weather made me wanna try the udon and some rolls. 

The oyster shooters appetizer was good. Spicy ponzu, I think was not overbearing at all. Yummy, succulent oysters with no sand/shell bits. 
The udon broth was flavorful. It hit the spot for this freezing af weather. 
The fresh yellowtail roll was delicious. Simple ingredients and you could totally tell the fish quality of this place is crazy. I was expecting chopped/mushed yellowtail but origami has it in a nice chunked cut. 
^ that roll alone made me sort of regret not getting nigiri. 
The PO-boy roll was good, but I probably wouldn't order it again. 
You can tell how much the sushi chefs care about their dishes when you see how clean and nicely rolls were presented. I used to work/frequent sushi spots where the chefs would pump out sushi bar dishes with the rice falling out, rolls not being cut, and miscellaneous sauces on the plate.

Def stop by this place.
One quarter of the tables full and took FOREVER to get waited on.  Food took FOREVER to get to table.  Horrible service.
Excellent acai bowls very clean and the employees are helpful and friendly can't wait to try the rest of their offerings
Great coffee, owner is super friendly and I love the vibe of the shop. I would definitely recommend trying this place if you enjoy iced coffee !

Between the deli, the sandwiches, the selection of Italian dry goods my grandmother would love, and the extremely friendly service, it brings me back to living near the Italian Market as a kid.

Primo's is just a few blocks away from here but I prefer the italian hoagie from Castellino's. The meat is sliced thin enough to see through and they put sherry vinegar on it which is a very nice touch. 

The owner is super friendly and actively asks his patrons for feedback and recommendations on items to carry. The deli meat is very high quality  and he's not afraid to offer a few samples while you're shopping.

I could go on and on, but if you're in the area, check it out for yourself, you won't be disappointed.

I have been going to OTF for the last 3 years in several cities and couldn't be more pleased with the variety of workouts, coaches and energy in most classes. All of the coaches do a great job, but I have to say that Angel and RJ stand out on a consistent basis. The energy that they bring to each workout makes it that much more fun for all of us. In addition, their focus on form and safety allow us to work out smarter and build confidence. They both push and motivate in a way that makes you want to lift more or run harder. I am a huge advocate of OTF, these coaches and will continue to support them!

Decent beach bar connected to a hotel. Bartenders are attentive & nice. The only issue is that during peak times of the year, it can be pretty crowded full of drunken "douche-bros" and "mid-life crisis 40 somethings" being a little extra annoying. We tend to only go on the off-season when we want to enjoy a good acoustic act. 
Prices are decent. Atmosphere and a location on the beach make it worth going.

my favorite place to get my groceries and produce. I do a one stop shop here most of the time since there have a huge variety of products. I also love their delicious food! staff super friendly ! can't get better than this!

Great place! The food was amazing. We got the platters with different meats and falafel. It was well served and delicious. The place is small and cozy, but I feel that if it was full it would feel a little crowded. Also, they were out of a couple things we wanted to get. Regardless, we had a great experience and would recommend it.

Ordered an omelette and was unusually surprised by how awesomely fresh the salsa was and how great my Omelette tasted. The mushrooms were so good too. It was a nice surprise to the usual omelettes that I get at other diners. The hashbrowns (tators) were perfectly done & crsipy! The coffee was good too!

My cousin and I tried this place out after hearing great things, the girl at the counter was very helpful and very nice! the inside is adorable, everything was great. I had the chicken Caesar salad and my cousin had the breakfast croissant, both were delicious.I think I found my new favorite place to get coffee on the West Bank goodbye Starbucks on Terry parkway forever!!!

They deserve more than 5 stars. 
We were so worried because my daughter's passport expired and we're going on a cruise in 7 days. 
They over night the passport to us in 2 days. 
The lady was really really nice. 
Thank you !!!!!!!

The bar, the booze, the BURGERS the owner SAM who greeted us @ the door & took care of us along with Melissa AMAZING!!! There is a reason these guys have won best burger in STL the past few years. My bestie & I are the toughest customers & we have nothing but great things to say about STACKED. Located in the quiant  Holly Hills neighborhood its a perfect example of why STL is FOODY heaven. I had the guacamole  bites, mac & cheese bites, BLT grilled wedge salad & veggie burger & was more satiated than last Sat night when I ate a petite filet @ Ruth Chris! God must have a hand in STACKED cuz IT WAS HEAVEN!!! Why are you not grabbing your keys & going there NOW man!!!!

This was actually my first steakhouse experience back in 2011. Sadly, I haven't had the opportunity to come back just yet. From what I recall, the decor was something out of an old Hollywood film - deep, dark, and mysterious. You walk through the days and feel transported to a different world. A world with tender and juicy filet mignon and oh so amazing shrimp cocktail.
Super nice guys here. They'll admit if you could wait another month for an oil change. Always go out of their way. Always friendly.

A local recommended Herbsaint for their gumbo. I'm a gumbo freak, having grown up on the Gulf Coast. Indeed, the gumbo was terrific, with a dark brown roux and a complex taste. Reputation well deserved!

I would give this restaurant 1 star if it was not one of my favorite sushi spots in Tampa (prior to this visit). When I attended USF I went to this establishment frequently and always had delicious meals. I hadn't been in the area for a few years and was excited to go back. 
We ate most of our meal and had a few pieces that we were still picking at - we went for a slice of ginger and there was a black hair on the plate (neither my friend or I have black hair). We showed the server and she didn't say anything/no apology, another server came to the table and said 'It was only from the ginger. Would you like some dessert?'. We were appalled. I said 'Absolutely not, and it is unacceptable to find hair on a plate served with food.' I had no response from the server. Another person came to the table with the check, and started clearing the table of plates. As I was telling her 'We should not be responsible for that plate of food, that is unacceptable.', she spilled soy sauce from our dirty plates on my friend and my shoes. A different lady came to the table and said she gave us 10% off on that plate and that's a $27 plate so that's all she can do. 
We paid our check, but left absolutely repulsed and disappointed that we can never come back to this place. Poor, poor customer service and terrible restaurant hygeine/cleanliness. Very sad.

So I love Greek food and for the last couple years, I've come home for holidays etc and we joke that Reno doesn't have a Greek place. This year, Moms said that there was a new one and close to us so we checked it out. 

It's really good! It opened just a week ago and they seemed to have everything under control early on, even though it wasn't very busy (they opened last week). We had the Greek meze and it was really ample; lots of dolmates, gyro, crisp fresh veggies, and the feta was amazing. When have you ever heard anyone claim that feta is really good?!?

Anyway, Reno has a Greek place now AND there's a whole Italian side (antipasta, calzones, pizza, eggplant parm etc). They say in the summer they'll activate that patio too so I'm pumped to have this option now.

I haven't even tried the food yet but it better be amazing considering how long I had to wait. They don't even acknowledge that you're there we had to wave them down to even get a menu and once they took our order it took 40 minutes until we just decided to wave them down again and ask them where it was and then another 10 minutes for them to package it up to go because we didn't have anymore time to be there because I had to go to work. The servers are really nice and it must suck having to deal with customers' complaints when it's the kitchen/management's fault. 

When I think of a café I think of popping in and getting a coffee and something to eat really quick. Don't come here unless you have at least an hour to spare out of your day.

Absolutely horrendous. From Andrew the manager (who acted last like it was my fault) worse management ever. Stayed at hotel. Made reservations. Didn't honor it. Waited 40 minutes they seated me. Waited for 30 minutes for oysters. Still sitting here waiting for dinner. What a joke. Maybe 40 more minutes.

I finally got to try Seoul Fried Chicken the other night, and I think my mind is blown. I went for the five-piece combo with original chicken, slaw as my salad, and the corn fritter as my side (as opposed to fries). The chicken was crunchy and extremely juicy, while the slaw was fresh and had lots of hearty carrot in it. I loved the corn fritter, which was served in a milky, sweet liquid. I did not find the chicken too greasy, and the price point was great. The place is rather small with most people doing take out. You might have a hard time finding a seat if you want to dine in during the lunch or supper rush.

Was once a great Mexican restaurant now awful.  There was actually a rat running across the floor while we were eating.  Said something to the waiter who just shrugged it off.  Never ever will eat there again.

Surrounded by wrapping paper when I realized I had nothing going for dinner. Placed an order for delivery with UberEATS. Food is great, hunger suppressed, gifts wrapped I'm happy.  I ordered vegetable lo mein and the noodles are a good size, good flavor, it's not drenched in sauce which I like. Sometimes lo mein oozing sauce it's almost soup like and slides down your throat, that's not a problem here. And I got it super fast! I waited not even 30 minutes from placing my order to my front door and nothing burnt so again I'm happy, I would recommend especially if it's your turn to cook and you lose track of time

This little coffee shop nestled right behind Circa Apartments was beautiful inside with it's exposed brick & original steal/ wooden beams on the ceiling. Service was great and the staff was very nice. There was lots ya of seating and tables for working or studying. Coffee was good, the lighting was pretty dim but on a sunny day there is plenty of natural light to come through their large windows. The sign out front is very small and it is easy to miss if you are unfamiliar with the area or coming for you 1st time.

My first time to this restaurant it was great..... the drink i had was fabulous even with excluding one ingredient.  We got the pretzel bites, they were ok but the hot sauce that came with it was to die for!!!!!  I kept raving so much about the hot sauce that without even asking our water David F gave some to take home... his service was excellent!  He was attentive but not overbearing.   Extremely nice.... we got the survivors menu with the lava rock..we got strip steak and salmon.  I love this cause you can season and cook to your liking... i can't wait to bring my kids back..   and when i do come back I'm going to ask for David F!!!

Just found this place about a month ago and I'm hooked. Quick service great prices and large food portions . You can order how you'd like . Extra extra spicy king po chicken is my go too . Large portions of chicken and the right amount of veggies all mixed in extra spicy. I love it . The lunch plate even comes with a drink . All under $7 . All so hot and fresh . If your ever in the east and lookin for good Chinese you should definitely stop in .
Great food.  We ordered 2 calzones and 2 pizzas.  First time here and we will definitely be repeat customers!  Friendly staff. Give it a try, it's great
This is my favorite lunch spot on center city! All the food is awesome and everyone is super friendly! Definitely reccomwnd!

I think it is because we spend so much money for coffee these days (it's amusing to think about the times in the 1920's when you could buy a cuppa joe for 5 cents!) that places like Starbucks, Peets, Blue Bottle and Handlebar are judged on another level: a higher level than most places you can buy an espresso drink or a coffee. This makes sense and this rings true.
My experience with this La Cumbre 'bucks has only been positive.
From the manager to the Baristas and everyone in between the service and interaction between the employees and myself has been pleasant, fast, committed.
There are a number of bad reviews about this place yet i have never received bad service here and i have been here maybe 100 times over the last several years.
I have to be honest and say something that i have been wanting to say here on Yelp for a long time:  you must take control of the service you get in a place in which you are paying good money; particularly when the people behind the counter are young people who are in the work force for the first time.
I say all of this to counteract, even in a small way the bad reviews of this Starbucks in my adopted city of Santa Barbara.
If i have an issue with a 6 dollar cappuccino, i speak up and they will make it over. "They" can like it, they can not like it. Not my issue. I am the customer. I am the one paying. Typing this here it does sound a little harsh but in reality, is it really? I am polite yet firm. 
In any event this Starbucks unit is one of my faves along with that in La Canada, Studio City and the drive thru in south Glendale.
The people here are, once in a while mesmerized by the beauty of SB, the beachiness, the surfer-like paradise and the loveliness of the land  but a little firmness in how you order and how you react to bad service goes a long way. I mean paying $2-5 plus for coffee is a serious thing.

Woweee!! Our first company Christmas Party here at beautiful Normandy Farms! When I first heard that was where we were having our party I thought it was a nursing home. It just sounded like that!

The venue is HUGE!! So huge in fact I had no clue where our ballroom was but luckily I found others from my company headed in and finally found my way to where the event was. Unfortunately after the event I went out a completely different exit and spent a little while trying to track down my parked car.

The venue itself was nicely set up there was a small room filled with chafing dishes for our buffet. In the bar area there was a self service coffee station too. The buffet was steadily being filled and the banquet coordinator was talking in a walkie talkie maybe to the kitchen letting them know what was running low. 

Now the food!! There were buttered appetizers like pastry puffs w asparagus, & cheesesteak rolls, both very good! Rumor has it there were crab cakes, stuffed mushroom caps and shrimp. Unfortunately the server with those goodies never made it to my table. They gave each of us the most delicious crusty rolls with the most delicious butter. On our buffet we had Caesar salad, cold pasta salad, al dente buttered green beans, fettuccini w spinach, sliced London broil, chive infused mashed potatoes, and the most succulent delicious salmon with capers. The salmon was broiled and well done on the exterior (but not dried out)and juicy in the middle- cooked to perfection.

The desserts were very decadent! Mini key lime, pecan caramel pie, petite cuts of layer cake, dark chocolate cups filled w vanilla cream with fresh berries on top! 

Excellent polite staff, beautiful venue too. I minused one star because there was no one to direct us to where we were supposed to go and I barely got any appetizers. Otherwise it was fantastic and I'm hoping we have our party there next year!

Stopped here when we were in town from out of state for a night. Always on the look out for great gluten free pizza and this place did not disappoint!! They even make their own dough, which is super hard to find. Members of our party also had the regular pizza crust and they were equally impressed. Definitely recommend!

Well alright now, a sushi spot with top quality fish that doesn't price gouge.  
The Spicy Garlic Edamame was like no other I've had, pretty cool twist on a typical app. Somehow they have Rainbow Rolls for $8.95 that are on point.  Finished it off with a Very Mango drink.
Next time I'm back I'm coming for that Angry Dragon Roll and Taiwanese Salt Baked Chicken.  Dude next to me had the chicken and wouldn't shut up about it. HaHa.

Not only is Suzanne an accomplished seamstress, but her calm, professional demeanor is a perfect complement to a stressed out MOB...not to mention the complimentary champagne. My daughter's silk wedding dress was extremely detailed and form-fitting, so there was no margin for error. Suzanne nailed it! The bride was exquisite on her wedding day! Suzanne may not be your least expensive option, but her experience and attention to detail is worth every penny.

I went with a few friends to the voodoo tour with Robi and totally loved it! He was really engaging, made the tour very fun and interactive, and made history come alive. I left the tour with a whole new appreciation and curiosity about the religion. This is by far the best walking tour I've done and would highly recommend it as a must do in NOLA!
We decided to take our friends or to dinner and it was definitely worth it.  The callamari and buffalo shrimp were amazing appetizers and the ny strip steak was delicious.  Go here!

I HAD THE BEST SERVER!!!! My server, Brandon, was absolutely fantastic!! So funny and kind, he got the food out super quick and was so polite! I'd give him tree extra stars if I could! I will definitely be back and will be requesting Brandon as my server again!!!!

We used to frequent this establishment when it was Pacific Grill.  Great sushi, our go-to sushi place at the time.  When it first changed ownership we tried it and were not impressed.  I don't recall the details, but it did not meet the expectations we had when it was Pacific Grille.

Fast forward to about a month ago, when a co-worker mentioned this place.  The co-worker is a very "meat and potatoes" sort of person, so we were intrigued that they were giving a place with what they might consider non-mainstream food a positive review.

With this in mind we decided to give it a try again.  We were not disappointed.

A couple of us got the teppanyaki meals, which had excellent portions and were very well done and quite tasty.  Others had bulgogi, a favorite Korean dish we refer to as "Korean BBQ", and it was excellent as well.  Having eaten this in Korea myself, I was impressed that they included the proper side dishes of kimchi, squid and seaweed salad, something I've never seen when ordering the same at other restaurants.

Meal prices were very reasonable considering the quantity and quality of the food, and service was prompt and attentive.

I highly recommend the Sunflower Cafe and will definitely be returning there for more wonderful food.

More or less a lackluster experience. 
Employee taking order wasn't particularly friendly or helpful. They were out of what I wanted, Taro Kreme, so I ordered Green Tea. About 5 minutes after we ordered I was informed they were also out of green tea. Had to settle for coffee. 
Blue Kreme with Fruity Pebbles was interesting but the Kreme base essentially had no favor of its own. 
Coffee was respectably strong flavored. 
Bottom line is the $7 a cup price in no way justified the product. Fun to look at but nothing at all special to eat. Maybe if they had more unique flavors it would be worth it.

Be warned!  There was a very big language barrier and when they told me they wanted to work on my husband's callouses during a pedicure; they neglected to mention it was an additional 10 dollars.  Nor is it on the sign.  When the pedicures ended, they told me men's feet were $10 more.  Then backtracked and said it was because of the callouses.  Would not refund.  My nail smudged right after I left as well.
Service was sub par. We didn't get coffee refills for a long time. The food was cold. Oatmeal didn't come as a starter so we cancelled that. And the server seemed to have an attitude.

(We actually ate at the carry out in Union Station) What a great place! We shared orders of the barbecue seitan hogie and dan dan noodles.  Both dishes were delicious, but the hogie was incredible. The seitan had a unique barbecue flavor that was baked in, not in a sauce - very tasty. The veggies were crisp and fresh, and the seasoning was lovely. It was a great sandwich. The noodles were terrific as well - they were enhanced by baby bokchoy. I mean, who finds bok choy in a train station??? The staff was friendly, and the order was out in minutes. Great experience!!!

Passing time here while I wait on my pizza ! 
The cafe is super spacious warm and inviting . Apparently this place is the flagship store . Makes sense .The customer service was the best I've experienced in Philadelphia !!! Shout out to  Meron for making my experience extra special .  


I had the turmeric tea and the Mexican single drip coffee . I'm on a diet ... otherwise I just would have ordered one of their infamous nitro coffees on tap . I first had heir stuff at a Whole Foods demo station .  Their flag store is cool because you can buy their limited release flavors which I picked up while I was here .

Their nitro canned coffee  drinks is like drink a creamy coffee flavored shake . 


Vanilla and mocha are my go to s . 

Silky , velvety and oh so sexy . Single drip coffee was also not too bad . Cocoa notes were definitely pronounced .

Tonight, I ended up meeting 2 family members at Boston Market. Two of us ordered food. I have to tell you, Chef Tony welcomed us (as did others) and he was kind and sweet. We made a special request and he helped us, like a friend. He had a great smile and was attentive to us Nd other customers. Thank you, Chef Tony, for making our dinner a happy one! Kudos to you and your Manager.
The service was incredibly slow when we went. The place was not packed so I'm not sure what was taking so long. The traditional margarita was so sour it tasted like straight lime juice.

Very friendly and helpful!  I tried poke in California and was hoping to find a great poke place in Tampa. Poke express hit the spot. Lots of great options and fresh ingredients. Will definitely be back!
One of my favorite pizza shops!  Used to come here for years, then moved.  Now back in the area and this place hasn't missed a beat.  Great tasting pizza!

Arrived from out of town and wanted to have a late lunch at around 3:00. Restaurant was moderately busy but had several empty tables with no line at the hostess station. Hostess told us there was a 25 minute wait. Very maddening when you are hungry, can see perhaps a dozen empty tables and are told you have to wait 25 minutes for a table. Decided on a different strategy and was able to find a table in the bar. Had a bowl of gumbo which was lukewarm and bland.

My wife saw that it was buy one get one free on Facebook that day and I was doing work while she as at the gym, so I didn't care what we ate as long as I didn't have to cook it. 

We showed up in either late November or early December around 8:00 pm.  There were a few people in front of us and we jumped onto the tablet to place our pizza order.  Paul, the man behind the counter, was extremely helpful when trying to order on the tablet, because we couldn't find all of the toppings we wanted.  We couldn't find goat cheese under cheese, but he told us where to go to get it.  He made a few recommendations too.  

We dined in and I liked the amount of tables this establishment had.  We grabbed a soda and in a few minutes, the pizzas were brought to us.  I'll be honest, this is my third Snap Pizza experience at my third Snap Pizza.  The pizza tasted a little bit better.  I don't think it was my award winning toppings selection, but the dough's flavor and texture were better.  The wife thought so too...  Will this get me back here, quicker than six months?  We'll see...

Wish I could give this place negative stars. My husband purchased a slice of devils food cake and a bread pudding. The bakery items looked less than enticing. I decided to give it a shot. The devils cake literally tasted like mud pie. The bread pudding had a weird, moist green film on the bottom. I was disgusted and have been suffering from stomach pains since consuming the few bites. I wish I had read some of the previous reviews before trying this place. It is obvious that this place has some sanitation issues. I'm big on recommending great spots to friends, family and random strangers. This place will definitely be on my "do not" list.
Best quality! Amazing spicy tuna and salmon rolls. You really can taste the freshness of the food.
Pricey, but worth it. The buy one take one is the best deal around for good pasta. Place is nice looking inside too & waitresses & waiters are nice & knowledgeable

My friend and I tried this place about an hour or so before closing. Took a while to get acknowledged took even longer for him to get our waters for some reason even though my friend and I were 1 of about 3 tables in the entire restaurant. She got an omelette which she deemed just ok. I got the chicken fried steak which had that weird after taste meat gets when it's either not very fresh or had been cooked previously and had been sitting out and reheated the breading was over browned and didn't have any flavor at all just plain overcooked panko breadcrumbs leaving this slight burnt taste on your tongue that eventually overpowered everything else. I'll probably give this place another shot I couldn't say when though.

I gave this place two tries and both times I was not impressed.  First time, the margaritas were like diesel fuel.  I normally like mine to be on the strong side but I was feeling so buzzed I couldn't even finish the one I ordered.  The fajitas I ordered were quite odd as well.  The chicken had a sweet type of seasoning that kind of threw me for a loop, as I'd never had chicken fajitas taste like that before.  I thought maybe it was just a bad night since they just opened so I went again.  The second time I just stuck with the combo and my beef taco tasted fishy.  All in all after two failed attempts, I won't be returning.
My favorite Mexican place in brownsburg. I love their food, and they've always got good special deals going on! I adore their fried ice cream.

Really friendly wait staff that make you feel welcome at this lovely Japanese restaurant. An old stand by, they push out consistent tasty Japanese food. Bento boxes are great for when you want to try a bunch of items.  We are wanting to go back and try some interesting desserts...but we are always too full!

Love the Pho here.  Especially if you get there early when they first open.   The flavor of the broth is extra good.   Summer rolls are excellent as well.   The service is always fast and everyone there is always friendly,  unless they're really busy then it's understandable if you might feel rushed.   We usually go on off hours so there isn't a crowd.   We haven't explored many other things on the menu so I can't speak to the other dishes,  but the pho is fantastic.
Very good quality coffee that is very poorly prepared. Burned, served too hot, and no care taken in drink prep. Espresso is not served properly or at correct temp.

This was the first Potbelly location I ever came to, and after such a great experience I refuse to go anywhere else! (Esp. the horrible UA location)
Jessica is the best, super nice and friendly- she helped us figure out how everything works and recommended great sandwich options! Awesome customer service. 
This location is clean, quick, and precise! Super accommodating, and helpful. Thank you!!

This place is absolutely adorable! I loved being able to make fun shapes and cook breakfast right in front of us. Lots of options and a great activity for families! Can't wait to come back with a bigger group!!

As a location, this Starbucks is difficult to say the least.  The line for the drive thru is frequently wrapped all the way around the store and maybe two or three cars waiting in line on 4th street as well. This is particularly the case in the morning when their can easily be 15  cars waiting.  The drive through line also makes it very difficult to park in the lot so you can't app order and pick up easily as well.  

There is overflow parking behind the gas station next to it.

Inside, this is an amazingly comfortable coffee shop.  It is clean, wide open, and very accessible. Despite the volume of customers, they never seem to run out of what I'm looking for.  Customer service has always been great here for me as well!  

Starbucks coffee will certainly scratch the itch but it's nothing to write home about.  It's good but it doesn't blow you away.

Came here for lunch and a drink. Got the flight, and was not disappointed! Would recommend coming with a group and trying out as many beers as possible. The food is also pretty decent: the nachos were a little bland, would recommend the calamari and sweet potato fries. The beer selection was definitely the highlight. As far as ambiance goes, space is casual enough to watch the game but still nice enough for a family meal. Also, there looks to be an outdoor area that must be lovely in warmer weather. Would definitely come again for a casual meal! 

(Another plus, we brought Bananagrams and the wait staff didn't blink an eye.)

I have been keeping an eye on this place for a few months now but every time I would check- estimated wait time was much longer than my hunger would allow me to wait for. Luckily, the day after Christmas I was able to stop by for breakfast with a wait time of 0min!!

It's the quintessential brunch spot with the open tables and booths, cute wall decor and literally everything and anything you could want for brunch. 
Stuffed French toast is one of THE hottest dishes on the menu. Heck, they even have a chalkboard wall dedicated to honoring this dish.  It's a whomping serving size so make sure you bring your sweet tooth and few others to share it with. We kept it simple and ordered a bagel and eggs benedict to share. Both were excellent but my favorite items were the latte and cappuccino. 

If I lived closer, I would definitely be a regular here.

Not for everyone. The dough was good but it wasn't what I expected. It was just too much cookie dough for one person. I asked for the single scoop chocolate chip cookie dough and I ended up with 3 scoops. I couldn't even finish half a scoop, rest had to go to waste. This was just not for me.

I love sushi, it's right up there with pizza. I only eat veggie sushi and their avocado roll was great. Also I had a pot of green tea, also great as was my miso soup. 

Our server, Mayumi, was friendly and attentive. 

And now for the cons.....
website said my avocado roll (at dinner) was $4
The menu said the avocado roll was ........$6
The bill? .........$7 each.
The spicy edamame was 1.50 extra for spicy?
My husband's spicy chicken was not a favorite. 

One small thing. We were seated 10 ft from the door and were hit by a cold breeze with every person entering. 

Not sure if we will return.
My husband says three stars is generous.

Mayumi gets five stars though.

We had our office party at Splitsville in Tampa last Friday.  It was a blast, really got everyone moving/talking/having a great time.  The food was very good (to my surprise) and the staff was amazing. They were very attentive, kind, friendly and accommodating.  I would highly recommend this venue for a way to get the office working as a team.  It is clean and comfortable, the only complaint I have is that it was a bit warm in there.  So glad we had our party there.

Had the Brekky bowl. It was really good. But it was missing something. The Brekky bowl would have been out of this world with something that oozed throughout and meshed all the textures and flavors together. I was thinking a sort of sausage gravy or something. Without, albeit delicious, it still felt like something I could have made at home. It's essentially the cooked eggs with slices of cheese and your meat sitting atop of bowl of heavenly tots. Next time, maybe I'll ask for a side of gravy. 

And the french toast was tasty. You can never go wrong with that.

Delicious mexican food, and fairly priced. I got chicken enchiladas and my friend got the vegetarian fajitas. Both were delicious and came with all the fixin's: rice and beans, steamed tortillas, and we got delicious margaritas to compliment the food. One star off just because we had to wait too long for our drinks; our waitress forgot them and we only got them with our food.

Cute, cozy place to grab dinner or a tasty adult beverage. Because its located on Rittenhouse Square, facing the park, you're not going to go wrong with sitting indoors or outdoors.  The ambiance indoors is really neat-- from the gas lamps to the low lighting, it definitely feels like you're in a parlor back in time.  Drinks are a little pricey ($13 for a glass of wine), so I'm imagining dinner would be a little pricier as well. Would definitely recommend this spot for date night.

Seven Things to know about the Feast of the Seven Fishes Christmas Eve Dinner here:

Uno: Acqua e Farina (Water and Flour), owned by the same owners as Vecchia Osteria, is usually a pizza place, but for Christmas Eve, they transformed into a seafood lover's dream, and like, the number 7, we were lucky to be able to attend!

Due: The menu was small (7 dishes, and actually 10 fishes!) but everything was delicious (yep, we ordered the whole menu for 4 people, and had a LOT of leftovers). Gluttony is clearly my family's favorite of the 7 deadly sins.

Tre: The menu included a calamari and fried smelts appetizer and two gigantic salads (arugula, shrimp, and octopus, and a salted cod and cauliflower salad), lobster ravioli (so good it was the only dish we didn't have leftovers of), a heaping portion of linguine de mare (clams, mussels, calamari, shrimp in spicy red sauce), lastly, a branzino with sauteed spinach and Chilean sea bass with tomatoes and toasted bread to dip (both incredible). For dessert they were out of cannoli but we had a delicious (and surprisingly light) limoncello vanilla cake (tiramisu and a chocolate cake were also available). We were so full, but basically in 7th Heaven.

Quattro: The service was amazing- they coursed out the dishes for us since we were eating family style (definitely recommend doing so), and our waitress told us all about her family's Italian roots and traditions. We started with a complimentary roasted veggie appetizer, and finished with housemade chocolatecello on the house!

Cinque: It wasn't too crowded but they could accommodate parties as large as probably 7 at one table, maybe more. The restaurant can probably seat about 50 max. We called ahead to make a reservation.

Sei: The ambiance was lacking a little bit (bright lights and a pizza place with a big oven...) but we still had such a good time! 

Sette: Don't forget to BYOB!

If you're looking to change up your Christmas Eve traditions (we're not actually Italian) or just trying to avoid cooking for your family on Christmas Eve, I highly recommend it! Buon Natale!
Excellent homemade soups, love the 1/2 sandwich and soup deal.  Great salad bar as well.

Great little place.  I saw a review that said not good for kids.  Well we brought three toddlers and a baby. It was great.  The servers are so good based on our experience with Dale.  Wonderful server who was always there to recommend food or drink.  

We parked on the street using the park mobile app.  Download it before and it will help you find a spot in Dunedin.  They have a parking lot too but we went during the parade so it was very busy.  

Food very good.  Nachos.  Sweet potato bites.  Pretzel bites. I also got a flight.  I loved the cider.  

Highly recommend this place!

I'm not crafty.  I can barely paint a simple picture with words.  So when I tell you about the cool paintings and the neat art on the walls, I can only share with you that some of them are downright cool.  And when I tell you that they have all of their future paint project ups on a calendar on the website, know that I haven't attempted even one.  I'm just not a painter.

What I am, is a consumer of art.  My art of choice is food.  I love this art form and the Crafted Palette has created a work of art in making some really tasty food.  The best thing on the menu is the Shirred Eggs - two eggs and leeks buried in a creamy parmesan sauce served with some gluten free bread is SUCH a great treat.  They also have these quiche bites that are good for a quick bite.  My daughter always loves the croissant with her drink.  I've also had a couple different croissant sandwiches.  All were something I would get again.
