When we come in for Vertical Coffee it's great to have some tasty treats to snack on and cut the rumbly tumbly.  The wait for the food can sometimes be a little while, so if you are ordering, order as quick as you can after arriving.  That way you aren't waiting around for the order to come out.  I think they even do order ahead and Uber Eats.

My wife and daughter are doing the painting class right now as I type this, maybe they can give you a better idea of how fun or effective the art side of the business is.  But if you like to drink while you do your painting, they have a great wine selection and lots of cocktail choices.  They even have some high end bottles of Tieton Cider.

Service is very slow, but still worthy of 5 stars.  I had a private room for a party of near 20 for lunch. Any mistakes the servers made (table not properly set up prior to our coming to others during the meal were compensated for by management without a word being said by me).   The food was delicious. Two guests are critical gourmets.  Both thoroughly enjoyed their meals.  Too many people and food options to specify any particular dish except even those who had mishaps enjoyed their meals.  A mark of an excellent restaurant is how it handles mistakes. A second indicator is the quality of the food.

I know I shouldn't judge a place for something they're not known for, but I'm about to do it. My boyfriend and I went to Lafayette Square for a house tour yesterday and wanted to get brunch beforehand. Square One's brunch menu sounded really good, so I made an OpenTable reservation the night before. We were seated quickly, and the service was generally stellar throughout the experience. Unfortunately, the food was not. We ordered a Belgian waffle to share which was okay, but not outstanding. I don't know if it needed more butter in the batter or what, but it is not often that I am dissatisfied by a waffle. The real trouble came with my main dish. I ordered the Irish Skillet (I think that's what it was called) which was supposed to be corned beef hash with eggs. I am a CBH aficionado, so I was very much looking forward to it. Upon taking my first bite, my excitement dwindled. I kid you not...the hash was so spicy my nose was running after two or three bites. I have no idea why it was so spicy because the menu mentioned nothing about heat in the dish. Granted, I absolutely LOVE spicy food and the idea of hot corned beef hash is kind of intriguing, but this was so spicy that it was painful. It was the kind of spicy that you regret, and I did. I asked our waitress what made it so hot, and she said it normally wasn't and they must have over-seasoned it. Even before we got up to leave, I knew that heat would haunt me during our house tour, and it did. I had heartburn and indigestion for most of the day which really sucked. I have rarely in my life wasted food, but I didn't even take my leftovers as it was just too hot and my stomach was already upset. Generally, if I order really spicy food, I know there is a possibility I will suffer for it. What sucks is I didn't order spicy food, at least according to the menu. I will be back in the future to try the beer, but I will most certainly be skeptical if I'm ever ordering food again.

This review is strictly for the M Club, nothing else at the Marriott, a lounge for gold members or Marriott credit card holders.  All others may access the club for a fee.  The M Club offers a full, hot breakfast and there is an omelet station.  Dinner is also available. Most nights there is a gumbo, salad and charcuterie.  The hot offerings rotate.  I saw seafood and regular quesadillas, meatball sliders, and some veggies.  Coffee, tea, hot chocolate and soda is available 24hrs a day.  Alcohol is only available for purchase after 4pm, but I think you can bring in your own alcohol after dinner service ends. Dinner is not spectacular, but an excellent alternative to going out. Yes, you can wear a hoodie, sweatpants and flip flops. No one cares.  I have one complaint which is that when the lounge is busy it is understaffed.  It would be smart to have an area where patrons can deposit their dirty dishes, rather than leave them on the table. That being said, the staff (Deibi in particular), is super welcoming and friendly making the M Club a great place to hang out any time of day.
I have ate here twice and both sandwiches I have got where great. I just had the Philly Cheesesteak and it came out nice and hot and fresh.

We were deciding where to go for dinner on Christmas Eve and we noticed that Boomtown's buffet had Southern barbecue on their website. I'm a big ole' fat boy from North Carolina loves good barbecue and we decided to pay a visit. We get to the buffet and they charge  $48 and the only thing barbecue they had was pork chops. We spoke  to two managers and they wanted to know what we could do to be happy and we recommended to  give us a comp for a future visit. They informed us that they could not allow us to continue to eat so we got our money back and left.  The hotel casino does not have to worry  about tire  residue from my vehicle messing up their parking lot.  It will be a long time before we come back to visit!

I came here with my boyfriend for lunch as I was leaving nashville to head home.

The service was quick and the food was hot. But I just didn't enjoy my tacos. I usually try to avoid Mexican chain type restaurants as I prefer authentic Mexican places every time. But my boyfriend insisted this would be fine and quick due to limited timing. 

I had two different tacos, one pork and one steak. The pork was dry and lacked flavor. The steak was alright. I just overall, didn't care for the food. But my boyfriend ordered carnitas and seemed to enjoy it. 

If you go for Mexican, find an authentic one, you'll be glad you did.

This is my favorite place to just relax. They have comfortable seating. The owners and staff are always helpful and make you feel welcome. For mornings the breakfast offerings are amazing. Their doughnuts made on site as are the icings. For lunch and dinner it is wonderful cafe food. They make amazing gyros. Full of savory meat, paired with sharp salty bite feta,onions,tomatoes and lettuce garnish the gyro. vegetarian options exist as well. If you want a place that invites one to come relax for a casual meal or to satisfy a sweet tooth. This is a must try.

We visited this mountain because it was close by to where we were staying and we had really enjoyed the hike in Sabino Canyon we had done the day before. This is a paved road at first, not hiking like in Sabino. But it was worth it, and also easier for the kids, I think (11 and 5). To be honest, we only made it up to the midpoint (I guess about 1.5 miles) and then we saw that it went up even more, unpaved this time. We decided not to push our luck with the kids, so we used the portapotties (thank you!) and had some water from the spout (thank you again!) and disposed of our garbage and recycling (awesome). Then we headed back down again. I am sure the view from the very top is awesome but the view even from the midpoint was great. Props to all the folks who made it all the way up!

We come here quite frequently to eat and have a few drinks before the hockey games. They changed a few things out on their menu as far as the dishes go. I am only giving it 3 stars because the service is lacking big time. Their bar tender, I won't name names, is there every time we come. God forbid it gets busy. It puts him in a bad mood and the service is then horrible. He slams down the drinks, tosses the silverware at you, and when the food comes, he slams the plates down as well.  I see the other servers waiting quite a while for their drink orders that are not getting filled because he does not know how to multi-task. 
They need to get someone back there to help this man during the hockey season. 
Their shrimp tacos and Turkey sandwich is pretty good and well worth the try.

If you're looking for a place to wear your boots and learn some line dances, this is the place to go! They do lessons very frequently where you could learn 3-4 dances in a night. Music was ok, nothing special.

We typically go here for breakfast and my favorite item is the Philly Jack Benedict! It is to die for, when it's made right. Sometimes when they are busier the eggs are made too hard.  If you are a coffee drinker they have flavored coffee creamer which is my favorite!

My husband is a big pancake connoisseur and he says they have the best pancakes of the breakfast places we have tried so far in the Brandon area.

The service is typically pretty good here they seem to have their staffing levels figured out for their slower versus busier times.

I've tried a few of their lunch and dinner options as well, sandwiches, cheese burgers and chicken fingers and fries.  My favorite was the chicken fingers and fries, would definitely get that again. 

It is also nice that they are open 24/7 so if you have a late night and want a meal you have the Village Inn as an option.
Check in was easy. Not too busy early on Saturday & staff very helpful. PA listened to me and helped me quickly. Feeling much better already!

Waiting over 8 minutes in a drive thru is unacceptable this place has gone down big time! Hateful person at window is intentionally not asking customers about their orders and has the worst attitude ever. I'll drive to Starbucks next time...
